Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the Negatives!”
Reviews.Author: Brock9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel in early April 2012 and had mixed thoughts due to varied reviews on Trip Advisor. Am pleased to give it a big thumbs up. No queues on checking in, hotel was beautifully clean and location is superb. For an inexpensive hotel, this hotel met all the criteria we wanted/needed. We opted for a Premier Room with marina views and am glad we did pay the extra money as the view was awesome. Easy access to the shopping mall from the lobby area, and a 5 minute walk (if that) and you are at the marina area. Some people complained about the chirping birds, well we thought it was quite nice and did not find it annoying. The pool area is quite large and certainly refreshing for a cool down. Give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Has the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: Melanie l
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midnight after a 5 hour delay annoyed at not being able to dine out as planned, we were only staying one night! The reception staff were lovely, apologising for our delay as if it was their fault! Immediately extended our checkout time to allow us more freedom the next day and had our bags sent to our room so we could enjoy a snack and drinks in the hotel lounge. The lounge is a fantastic space stretching the full height of the hotel and tastefully decorated with well thought out seating. Our room when we arrived was modern, spotless and spacious with a good view over the marina. The position of the hotel is spot on we walked to everything we wanted to see. Due to our late checkout we could also enjoy a dip in the pool in the afternoon before checking out and storing our bags prior to our evening flight. The pool area is large with nice seating areas under cover (it does rain a lot!) and a bar etc. Would happily stay there again. Apart from our late night snack we didn't eat at the hotel preferring to go out and explore the local area so I can't comment on the restaurant. We didn't visit the spa either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: perthlee
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Marina Mandarin Hotel in April 2012 mainly because they would guarantee us 2 connecting rooms for our family of 5. What a great choice we made - our whole family ( 2 adults &'3 children 18,14 & 11) all really happy!!! Check in was a breeze, bags delivered to rooms quickly, fresh apples & bottled water supplied each day. Our rooms included breakfast which was a reasonably large buffet - enough choices to keep us all happy from fresh fruit & cereals, eggs,rice noodles, breads & pastries, sushi & curry!!!! Only criticism would be that sometimes had to wait a while for coffee. Had very nice coffee in lounge area one morning & included Wi-Fi access code which worked all day even up in our rooms!! Family made use of the gym & business centre both good. Hotel has direct access to shopping mall thru stairs near reception on 4th floor. Within walking distance to marina bay & sun tec with the fountain of wealth - great laser light water show at night. Beds really comfy & even have a pillow menu. Bathrooms clean & showers great. Rooms spacious & very clean. Caught the free shuttle to sentosa from the font of the hotel. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Artistry of Hospitality for Business Workshops”
Reviews.Author: KevinAsbjornson
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a leadership development accreditation at the Marina Mandarin Hotel in Singapore. I was impressed with the attention to artistry and aesthetics which includes the selection of colors, singing birds, selection of flowers and artwork which are found everywhere in the Marina Mandarin. The culinary experience is exceptional and includes a delightful selection of Asian and European fusion which tantalizes the eyes and stomach. The assignment of highly attention staff to the break area of our business workshop provided a personalized experience and the thoughtfulness of the staff in remembering my preference for cappuccino in the morning and Tea Tarik in the afternoon, is remarkable. I especially appreciate the live pianists performing acoustic instrumental music at the conclusion of a busy day which fills the atrium of the Marina Mandarin Hotel. The Marina Mandarin is definitely my business workshop hotel of recommendation and preference in Singapore. p.s. Notice the inverted orchid which is represented by the stunning, hanging artwork which is the centerpiece of the Marina Mandarin Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: juanita7_11
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for Easter 2012 and stayed at the Marina Mandarin Hotel . The hotel is fantastic, its location is just perfect and the staff were great. Singapore is an amazing city with lots to do. I would go back to the Marina Mandarin as there was nothing i could fault about it. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in Sigapore”
Reviews.Author: Experienced55
Reviews.Content: We stayed also at the Marina Bay Sands during this trip and the Sands was hectic, too trendy & too busy to give us individual service & we found a pillowcase that had not been changed - YUK!! However the Marina Mandarin, although looking a little tired, was a peaceful haven with lovely staff & the best position for great shoppoing. The rooms are so comfortable and they allowed us a later checkout at no charge; something no other hotel does these days. Will always stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Geoff F
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really good pool and fitness area. The rooms are comforable the wi-fi is free. Only gripe really is the breakfast, which I thought was overpriced at S$30 for pretty ordinary food. That said, the selection wasn't too bad (inc porridge, and some dim sum if that floats your boat at breakfast time).

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Riceone
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Singapore to experience our first cruise and then stay on to explore Singapore, we chose the Club rooms at the Marina Mandarin as it was our 30th anniversary and wanted to treat ourselves to some luxury. the staff and facilities were fantastic and we could not fault the hotel for its location or attention to detail, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STOPOVER AFTER FABULOUS CRUISE”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel beautiful comfortable and very conveniently placed. The staff were pleasant, helpful and always willing to provide information. We enjoyed the amazing range of food at the breakfast buffet,had a great meal in the Italian restaurant and a delicious piece of cake in the cafe. We just could not find fault with this hotel and it made the perfect end to a holiday of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: Excellent_12
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Marina Mandarin Hotel in Singapore. Previously with family but this time was just my wife and myself. As always we had a very pleasant stay and the staff were very courteous and helpful. Our room was exactly as per brochure- very clean- relaxing with a view over the Singapore river Will be returning in 2013

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but rooms a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: TinTinTin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, within walking distance to shopping complex and also the MRT. For exercise enthusiasts, there's also a good running trail around the bay area but the hotel's gym is rather small and cramp. The room's a fair size but I find the furnishing and deco a bit dated/tired. The hotel probably needs some refurbishing. The 2nd room I stayed in had water leakage in the toilet area. Breakfast was great, buffet style with huge variety but be prepared to share tables. Overall, I find the hotel quite expensive for the price - but this is the going rate for Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, quiet and relaxing. Staff was attentive and helpful especially the front desk concierge, Mr. Mohd Rafi Patani. Set up a wonderful private tour of Singapore for us. Helped us find the best restaurants and got us reservations. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mad_Travel_Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in February, 2012 with a friend, it was a gift from my husband who had stayed here in October, 2011 for my 40 birthday. We had a pleasant stay, the room was clean and comfortable and we had no problems sleeping, although we did find the birds a bit annoying. Our room was always cleaned neatly each day. We used the pool a few times and love that, after a long day of sight seeing and shopping it was great. I thought it was perfectly located across from the transport and conveniently located to shopping etc. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful arranging cabs etc for us. I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: ““Good location, comfy beds, nice shophouse feature””
Reviews.Author: tiaralabuan
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin Singapore located on an easy access location, it offers great range of dining choices , on first night would like to try the buffet , but can't dine in due to fully booked . BUT , 2nd night i can try for it , really a lot of variety choice . Hotel staff are friendly and knowledgeable about hotels facilities, surroundings as well as attractions. Check in and out were as smooth as I expected. The location is excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Good but....”
Reviews.Author: Infodesign
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here in a standard room for a week on business as a change from her regular hotel. The good... Nice lobby, public areas, clean rooms, good restaurent options and overall good location. The not so good....relatively small rooms but big bathrooms. Service was good except for one occasion when we were comprehensively ignored at the lobby bar. Got a good corporate deal so good value. Not sure we would say that if charged rack rate. Wifi was a ripoff price and unaffordable even on business. Why do luxury hotels do this when there are three nearby Starbucks that can offer this for free? General conclusion is that we would stay here only if we got a good rate. The Stamford Plaza is a better option and is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Stay after P & O Cruise”
Reviews.Author: turn4
Reviews.Content: Seen reviews from another passenger from the cruise but not our experiance. This is not a 5 star hotel as published While I agree with the rooms not ready and safe to leave luggage. Firstly we are a family of 5 in two rooms split us up on different floors not great they couldn't even get to our floor unless given another lift key. When the room was ready (7th floor rubbish view) our room for 3 only had two of everything. We had to request another single bed and enough of everything for 3 people. Wouldn't have minded but this holiday was booked since April 2011 so they had nearly a year to get it right. Not much variety at breakfast ( having stayed at the 4 star Shangri La in Singapore in 2010 this was more a five star hotel) Wouldn't stay again needs improvement a bit dated and the room next to ours flooded out onto the walkways no attempt to dry it up.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of ten!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie359
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband and I have stayed at the hotel and was even better. We stayed on the 21st floor in the Meritus Club which had its own private lounge for guests. The room was spotlessly clean with modern bathroom, complimentary slippers, robes, bottled water daily and plenty of toiletries. Our room had a city view and at night was lovely to stand on the balcony and enjoy the lights. Breakfast in the Meritus lounge each morning offered an amazing choice of all types of food all beautifully presented and served by the wonderful staff. A special mention must go to Frisca whose friendly manner and assistance was much appreciated by my husband and I. I would also like to thank Senthil whose efficiency and helpfulness did not go un-noticed! The location of the hotel is perfect with Suntec City and Marina Square shopping plazas a few minutes walk plus the MRT easily accessed. Check in on the 4th floor was speedy and our luggage brought up to us within minutes of reaching our room. If excellent service by friendly staff, great room service, good location and a variety of amenities are what you look for in a hotel then you need look no further than the Marina Mandarin. Fabulous service, fabulous hotel and very friendly staff who can't do enough for you - it's the only place I would stay in Singapore. Thank you for making our holiday one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilynWalesUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night after a cruise with P&O. The hotel was booked as an 'add on' night in Singapore to give us a few days in Singapore before flying back to the UK and was P&O's choice. We could not have chosen a better hotel ourselves. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. The balcony, although a bit small, had amazing views and the atrium was superb. We found all the staff extremely helpful and friendly. We arrived early morning(along with approx 30 other couples from the ship) and our rooms were not ready,but we were able to leave our luggage, book a day tour and get on with some sightseeing. The hotel is extremely well situated for most major attractions. Breakfast was included and there was a huge selection of both International and Asian cuisine.We had no trouble getting a table and had very attentive service. The following day we were not flying out until late evening but again we were able to leave our luggage securely and go out for the day, knowing we could use the changing rooms by the pool to freshen up. Singapore is a fabulous city and we will come back for a longer stay next time and will definitety come back to the Marina Manderin.

Reviews.Title: “They stinge on toiletries and on stationaries.....typical local owned and local-run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller696
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights and on the fifth day had to call housekeeping to have our room slippers replaced after they have been used and soiled for 5 days prior. On one night after coming back late, I urgently had to use the writing papers and envelopes to send a letter, but to our horrors, found that these stationaries had not been replenished(we used some on our second day and there were none around on this 6th night that I am writing this review!). I think this kind of cheap-skate attitude is common in a locally-owned and locally-run hotel like this Mandarin Group of hotels. They stinge on small things! I can also confirm other reviewers' comments on the illegal car racing that takes place on the road (Raffles Bouvelard) in front of the hotel. On the early Sunday morning that we were staying there, my wife and I were rudely awakened by tremendously loud revving of car engines. I keeping hearing the revs every few minutes and finally, when I could not stand it any longer, I went over to our balcony to have a look. Sure enough there were at least half a dozen racing cars weaving in and out of a surprising not-so-empty-road racing against each other. From our 11th floor, we could see that they even beat the red traffic lights at the end of the road where they turned right and then probably continued with their circuit whereby they re-appeared from the left(facing the road) over and over again. This all happened at 3am on Sunday morning. And I am a heavy sleeper, mind you! I called the Police but they were ineffective as these "hoons" were still at their games at 5pm, although by then they were racing around some roads nearby(deducing from their engine revs) and were no longer using the same circuit. I called the duty manager at 4am and told him the problem and asked if they are assisting the police in this matter. "Oh we are not the only hotel affected", he replied. I said surely this would not be the first time that this is happening and the hotel would have known quite a bit to help the police? "Oh things were much worse before and this is a lot better than in the past", he replied again! I swear that I did not make this up and I will leave readers to form their own conclusions as to what the hotel management(as represented by that duty manager) expect their guests to put up with in relation to the racing problems in front of their hotel! When I mentioned this on-going racing to a local friend, he said that these racing wanabes may be the kids of the connected and "important" people in Singapore and that is why there have been no effective actions taken against these illegal street racing that has been taking place on a portion of their F1 circuit. In any case, this is a hotel that thinks and acts like they are a 5-star hotel when in reality it is at best only a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Street Race”
Reviews.Author: drj_jak
Reviews.Content: The stretch of Raffles Blvd. in front of the hotel is often used as a race track by Singapore residents driving their sports cars & motorcycles. To avoid the police they tend to do it very late in the evening until the wee hours of the morning, particularly during week-ends. For those staying in this hotel in rooms facing the street, the noise will definitely disturb your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “totally pampered”
Reviews.Author: blueboyinvernessuk
Reviews.Content: my wife and had a Meritus club room for 2 nights. The service and staff were exceptional from perfect check in till departure. The facilities were superb, with a special mention of the Lobby area. Everything was so good we even had all our meals in house.

Reviews.Title: “unremarkable visit - great view though”
Reviews.Author: SQ452
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I did a staycation here for a night to celebrate her birthday. Things were rather OK here, nothing mind blowingly good, but nothing terrible either. Check-in was efficient. I had arranged with the hotel ahead of time to have a cake (complimentary) sent up to our room for her birthday. I liked the fact they did it complimentary, I really appreciated it and I thought it was a nice gesture. Confirmed the timing of the cake to be sent up when I was checking-in. Was put on a no smoking floor. As the hotel is in a sort of "triangle" like shape with the "base" facing the road and the two sides that arc up to a pinnacle. We were given a GREAT room all the way out at the point overlooking part of Marina Bay towards the ocean. The room had a GREAT view and was quietly located far far away from anyone else. perfect. Room was good, clean for the most part, nothing that blew us away. The desk chair's seat cover we noticed was torn at the side and the seat cover was filthy, dared not sit on it! I did later complain about this and they did say they would send someone up but i don't think they ever came (even when we were out, still not 100% sure but there certainly wasn't a new chair when we got back). The lamp-stand for the standing lamp was also broken a bit. The hotel has been here for quite some time (15-20 years perhaps? maybe longer?) so they have "updated" it so the rooms are nice and modern, with a good cheery vibe to them. Bathroom was a bit dated though. And the cups in the bathroom were filthy. I don't tend to use the glasses put in bathrooms anymore just because they are usually pretty filthy and lord knows how hotels actually clean them. Shower was also a bit tiny. But other than the cups, the bathroom was quite clean. Toilet and bidet included as well! Although, the bidet had scalding hot water regardless of which temperature the handle was pointed towards. They have a "pillow menu" which we noticed on a printed placard next to the bed, I thought that was a good idea. Bed was comfortable to sit on and rest, but I didn't sleep so well; even with my pillow I bought from home. We waited around for the cake (I guess I should say I waited since my girlfriend had no clue it was coming up!), but the cake never arrived. I finally went downstairs to the front desk roughly an hour or so later and let them know. This was also when I told them about the desk chair. The cake eventually arrived, but quite later than we expected and the surprise was a bit ruined as my girlfriend was quite suspicious why I was walking out of the room at one point and pacing around the room. The cake was EXCELLENT though; that is worth mentioning. We got some room service too before the cake arrived and the food was OK. Nothing fantastic, but the cake was heavenly; rich amounts of chocolate - just perfect, with perfect flavor. Job well done! I don't usually get excited about chocolate cake much these days, I find most places in Singapore that have any sort of chocolate cake on their menu just seem to make it super bland and almost tasteless. But this place, this cake was AMAZING! So thumbs up there. We were able to score a late check-out the next day which was quick and easy. All-in-all it was an OK stay. The service still needs some attention I think given the tardiness of the birthday cake and also the general attitude of the staff. They could definitely raise the bar there, maybe even renovate the bathroom for the room we had while they're at it. But like my title suggests, it was an unremarkable visit; nothing bad, nothing great with a few misses along the way. Happy to give it another try in the future though, although there are many other places in Singapore I'd like to try before returning.

Reviews.Title: “best for business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: businesswoman58
Reviews.Content: I was staying only three days, but collected wonderful experience. Extremely high quality service, politeness and professionalism. Warmly recommended to everyone for business & pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: 1FriendlyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel many times and I keep coming back. Is a great location away from the busy orchard road area. All the rooms have a balcony with great views. The hotel is actually located on top of a shopping mall. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. I am usually there on business so I am depending on getting a taxi, and staying at this hotel the taxis are actually waiting for you and not the opposite as you would experience at the hotels in orchard road. The MRT station is also very close, so if you want to take a trip to orchard road you can just take a short walk to the MRT station. The staff is very friendly and always helpfull. I think I have tried out all the rooms (not suites) and of course staying at the meritus club is a big plus with a seperate breakfast area. All in all, a great hotel with a great location at the Marina bay area in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday /business accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Mez101
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Meritus Club level and found the benefits of paying that little bit extra, the staff and service to be excellent. Would recommend this for adults on business or holiday trips. The air conditioning in our room was a bit noisy but apart from that, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities and Location;Small Room”
Reviews.Author: RozanaOch4
Reviews.Content: The reception area is at 4th Floor, so it was a bit set-back for those of you from long flight and expect for immediate check-in. However, my check-in experience was very nice and they allowed me to check-in early around 11 AM. From the hotel lobby, there was a beautiful bird sound, as if you were in a natural habitat. My room rate was inclusive breakfast and internet so it was convenient. The hotel is connected to Marina Square Mall so it was convenient to look for foods, groceries, etc. The bathroom is clean and spacious. One of the cons was that my room was quite small compare and the walk-way from elevator to the room is quite dark. The breakfast selection was not so appetizing.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: chernox
Reviews.Content: Our family took 2 stopovers in Singapore on our way to Bali. On our way there we decided to stay at Marina Mandarin Hotel. The location we thought was perfect, very close to metro station, the walk through air-conditioned underpass. We arrived at hte hotel at around 7 a m, well before the check in time for that day but were allowed into our room without questions. I read in avdance that the hotel was early check-ins friendly and it appered to be true. Immediately we decided to take a swim in the pool, this was just opened. the pool was OK apart from oily smell from kitchens air extractor. The service was alright. Inside the hotel is empty pyramid which makes it airy and pleasant to sit down and relax in lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay was very good”
Reviews.Author: AmarMisra
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay. We had gone there for business and had taken 3 rooms. The hotel staff was very courteous. A specific stance of trying to expect the expectation – We being vegetarian did not have much choice during the buffet breakfast and the moment we told this to the Manager Mr. Senthil, he immediately organised special dishes for us. The business lounge was very good and we saved a lot of time as all the facilities were very handy. The staff at the lounge was very warm and hospitable. Over all I liked the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Missing those final touches”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star hotel it falls short, the decor and rooms could do with an update. On the plus side staff were very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast menu was fair but for 5 stars would have been looking for that something extra

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business, but lacking in service and smiles”
Reviews.Author: arracka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marina Mandarin for one week in March 2012 (on business). Would I stay again? For business: probably. For leisure: definitely not. The main thing that is letting this hotel down is the rudeness and ignorance of staff at reception and at breakfast. Arrival: We arrived with taxi early in the morning (the taxi ride from airport costs approx. $20), and were advised by porters to take lift to level 4 to reception. One of the first things we noticed was that reception had about 8 counters, but only 3 staff manning them. After having stood in a queue for 15 minutes, we were finally served, yet check in took another 15 minutes- no smiles and at times rude behaviour, made me recount (and agree with) the Tripadvisor reviews suggesting check in was a drama. And right they were! Breakfast: you need to agree to sign up for each day and then they will charge you $30 only> Otherwise it is $47. We only agreed for convenience, but the breakfast is uneventful (especially for vegetarians), and it is very hard to get a cup of coffee. Staff just don't seem to be bothered to help guests, and they look like they don't want to be there. Don't expect any smiles and friendly service here (even though it is the norm everywhere else in Singapore). The selection of fruits is very limited (unlike the Mandarin Oriental next door). Staff tell you where to sit- and actually argue with you if you suggest a different seat (perhaps for more privacy, out of the sun or whatever) - very annoying. Room 905: clean, spacious, safe that worked, beautiful bathroom (excellent water pressure). View over city. Very happy with the room. Wifi: Very expensive if not included in your package, and a hassle to have to call 'o' each day to get a new code. Twice code did not work. I reported it once and they promised to call back, but they did not. Disappointing. Internet pretty slow. Business Centre: To print of a document (black/white) the Marina charges $2 per page - very vey expensive Housekeeping: Perfect. No complaints. Housekeeping staff were friendly and very thorough. Room always very tidy - bottles of complementary water replenished each day. Bar (on fourth floor): at night there is live music (piano music with singer) - yes I could hear it in my room, but not really loudly. Indeed I thought it was quite pleasant. The bar area itself is very nice and at two occasions did we have drinks here. It's expensive, but a lovely place to unwind after a busy day (if you like cocktails I recommend the skinny Hendriks). Bar staff are friendly. Swimming pool (fifth floor): not big, but big enough to do laps. Not very busy early mornings or late afternoons. Plenty of lounge chairs to lie down out of the sun. Towels provided. Location: my colleagues and I were attending a conference at the Suntec. The Marina Mandarin was an excellent location. Take the lift to level four, then steps down to level 3 to a door which takes you to the Marina Square shopping centre. From here you follow the signs to Pan Pacific Hotel and the Suntec. Very easy walk in air-conditioned mall for about 5-10 minutes. Due to its location would I consider staying here again, for business only. I will be visiting Singapore with my partner in a few a months, for leisure this time, and shall not be staying at this hotel. When on holiday I do not want to have to put up with unwelcoming and unhelpful staff, especially considering the price you pay at the Marina, and the excellent service you get elsewhere in Singapore. I am surprised the Marina's Manager has not addressed the issues at reception and in the breakfast area, considering the many reviews highlighting these particular shortcomings. Thus my recommendation: the hotel is ok if you are attending a conference in the Suntec, but if you are going to Singapore for leisure, you're better off elsewhere. Many hotels in the same area offer more, for the same price, and with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: LondonCitytraveller
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Marina Mandarin in 1998 when on business in Singapore and had felt then that it was a special hotel. We have just made our first trip to Australia and spent three days in Singapore on the way out. I just had to book the MM. We decided on a bit of luxury and booked an Executive Suite with breakfast. No cheap (about £320 per night) but this was for a holiday of a lifetime ! We arrived excited but tired after a 13 hour flight and were allocated an Executive Suite (or was it a Meritus Suite) on the 16th floor with access to the Meritus lounge on the 21st. The room was vast, very well appointed with everything we could have wished. A great clean and more than ample bathroom (with tub/bath) and bidet; huge sitting area - bowl of fruit, tea/coffee making machine - superb quality - and a bowl of fruit and business newspaper. Two balconies (both small) with great views of the Singapore Eye and Marina (especially spectacular at night). Reception was fine if a bit formal. Breakfast was in the Meritus lounge on the 21st floor; more than ample, great friendly service and quiet. There are facilities in the lounge for free internet, newspapers and tourist guides. There is even a conference room which you can book. All in all the hotel did not disappoint. We have travelled in all continents of the world and this is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great services”
Reviews.Author: Jituvaxhish
Reviews.Content: it was an amazing experience staying here, as the location is great. We stayed at Meritus Club for 3 nights. Entering in the lobby, you can feel the great vibe as people will welcome you with great smile, want to mention Mr.David who was there to serve us all the time. Staff is really nice, and the location gives you pure urban feel of Singapore as it is located in Marina Area. Singapore is a great place to visit and such hotels add excitement to your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location and accomodation good, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Richard E
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for a special birthday occasion, occasioning a visit to Singapore. The hotel provided a lovely cake for my partner (nice touch) and the accommodation was very comfortable with a location that suited us well - close to MRT and that gives access anywhere. We had some visitors on 2 occasions and sat in the lobby for tea and drinks - service was on both occasions slow and orders were not filled correctly. This was not in keeping with the overall standard of the hotel and suh a simple thing left a a tainted memory. Otherwise - a good stay...

Reviews.Title: “spectacular foyer, really friendly service, room service not so good”
Reviews.Author: paulybear
Reviews.Content: This hotel was visually stunning on the inside, except I was finding the overall 'smell' of Singapore overbearing and felt very ill. I am Asian, and can cope with many places, but Singapore disagreed with me and \i wasn't well for day. nonetheless, the hotel staff were so friendly, I was treated like a special guest from the moment I walked in. The room service takes a long time, and room service food was stone cold one evening, but the hotel refunded the meal. otherwise, great stay, the pool is relaxing, and the choice of restaurants is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobM77
Reviews.Content: I couldn't disagree more with the negative comments about the Mandarin on this site. From the second we walked into the amazing 21 storey atrium we were totally smitten with this hotel. Our room was very nice indeed, and due to the hotel's design, all rooms have a beautiful external view out over the city. The open air swimming pool on the roof of the 4th floor has an amazing view out over Singapore, although to be honest although I used it many times it wasn't heated and a bit too cold for me!! We ate in the hotel's Chinese restaurant, which provided wonderful authentic Chinese food with excellent service. The service in the Italian restaurant was nowhere near as good, although the food was lovely. The hotel's location is also perfect for exploring the city, with the Singapore Flyer and the dramatic and impressive SkyBar just a short walk away. The Mandarin's staff were also all very professional and friendly. If we return to Singapore we'll definitely be staying at this hotel, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Elite and Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Senba654
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I ad ever visited, staff are very professional and kind, Whether its food or service, I found a LOT OF VARIETY. Impressed on first visit and still stays in heart.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect efficient room service.”
Reviews.Author: Spudsmother
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for 3 nights. On arrival we were told a room with king-size bed was not available (only smoking room). We eventually took room with single beds (view from room was great). Room service is non-existent - Rang to request more coffee sachets, they never arrived. Eventually had to look for staff outside room - we were give 2 sachets - you must be only allowed 1 coffee per person per day!! We also rang to extend check-out time - no one got back to us. Eventually had to phone reception back, we were able to extend for a short period for a cost!! A bit rich considering we could not have bedding we asked for. To top things off, when I telephoned to arrange collection of cases no-one arrived. We eventually had to take our cases downstairs ourselves wher it took over 30 minutes to check out, the queue comes from both sides and everyone keeps pushing in. We had stayed in 2 other hotels in Singapore and service at both of them was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Gevin H
Reviews.Content: We travel to Singapore frequently. The Marina Mandarin has always been one of our choices on our visits to Singapore for holidays. Stayed in January for few nights in one of their Marina Bay view room. The room was large and clean. The view was fantastic. The staff were efficient, knowledable, and helpful. The only downside is that they charge internet and wifi. Nowadays everywhere we traveled in the world most places do not charge internet and wifi anymore, except in Hong Kong and Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mwbarnes
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel ! Our room was very comfortable and had a small balcony with great views. The hotel atrium was amazing (apparently the largest atrium in Asia). All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful although language was a problem on occasions when trying to order food & drink. The self service breakfast was amazing with food catering for all nationalities. My only criticism here was that the waiting staff at breakfast time could have been more attentive to customers, as coffee or tea had to be served by them but there didn’t seem to be anyone responsible for serving it. We also had a meal in the Chinese restaurant and unlike other comments on Trip Advisor, we found the service to be really good and the food was amazing. We wanted plain egg fried rice with our meal which was not on the menu but this was not a problem and we got it. Our only criticism of the hotel was that the large atrium echoed noise which could be heard in the bedrooms. We could clearly hear the caged birds that were in the public areas and on one night we could hear the sounds of a large party being held in one of the function rooms. The hotel has easy access directly into a shopping centre which has several food courts serving all types of food. If you are in Singapore and like gardens, then a trip to the Singapore Botanical gardens is a must. We took a taxi there which was cheap and entry to the main Gardens is free, but for a small cost you can go into the Orchid Garden to see the World’s largest display of orchids – it was amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Superb, a perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Cattai
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a couple sharing our holiday with another couple we'd been friends with for some years. Although we booked through different travel agents, an email from one of our agents found us in rooms next to each other. The service was wonderful. Nothing was too much trouble and staff were charming and appeared happy to go that bit extra to ensure guests were well looked after. Our rooms on the 21st floor were in a fantastic position...we looked down on the "Raffles Hotel" the view was amazing. We were also within walking distance to fabulous shops and "must see and do" experiences. The rooms were lovely. Well appointed, well maintained and generously proportioned. They were also very quiet. The privileges offered by staying in a Meritus Club Room were numerous...easy check in and out, buffet breakfast without a crowd, snacks during the day, happy hour 5.30 - 7.30 each evening (with very tasty canapes) and free internet access. We will be heading back to Marina Mandarin again in the very near future. So much more we'd like to see and staying at this fantastic hotel is an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 20th century”
Reviews.Author: JonoNano
Reviews.Content: A very unique, attractive hotel that's always a pleasure to stay at. Very convenient shopping being attached to Marina Square and only 10 minutes stroll to Suntec. Only issue, no complimentary internet. In this day and age it is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KylieandAaron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin for our 1st anniversary on our way through to Koh Samui. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was beautiful. The (real) birds that chirped downstairs in the atrium echoed all the way up past the rooms but we could not hear them from our room. They sounded beautiful. We also made use of the pool and bar facilities which were also very nice. Just a bit pricey for what you get compared to the shops accross the road. But that's what you expect from a hotel. Location is great. Sun City is accross the road the the MRT is pretty much just downstairs from the hotel. We didnt have the best view from our room though that was the only downside. I would have preferred a view of the Marina Bay Sands. Instead we had a view of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Good”
Reviews.Author: Shanaussie
Reviews.Content: Was in Marina Mandarin Singapore for fewdays and still the memories left. The hotel and staff are very warmth, I would have atleast changed my tickets online status, the concierge and guest services were very polite and suggestive. Good for business and pleasure, Peach Blossom was really cool. they really suggested some nice dumplings to which my daughter became addictive. Staff are really nice all over, services are better than their resort in langkawi. Enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: cred68
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin Hotel was amazing. We stayed three nights there and we were very satisfied.The hotel staff is excellent and helpful especially those working in the lobby and concergerie.The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and well equipped.The main lobby is breathtakingly beautiful. The location is perfect right in Marina Bay and near all the Singapore attractions.I recommend staying at this hotel. Novo! Clique nas palavras acima para ver traduções alternativas. Dispensar

Reviews.Title: “GuestServices is a true Ecstasy”
Reviews.Author: Abimannanpathi
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin's great service is like an icing on cake for its great atrium shape facilities in the hotel. From the entrance to its top is true grandeur in its style. We hardly went out for our other appointments, their atrium lounge provides free wifi on purchase of drinks which is a gold deal. All our venture corporation associates loved it. Love to pat on the shoulders for guest services team at level 1 for suggesting us this, than saying NO for our request .

Reviews.Title: “Sea view so special”
Reviews.Author: Lakshtata
Reviews.Content: Singapore is totally a vibrant city with so many specials, amongst was Marina Mandarin hotel. I really thanked my company Tata for it's courtesy to put us in this really wonderful place with Sea view. The hotel has really nice staff like Desmond Chong and Senthil kumaran who showed their extra effort in showing us around and suggesting nice places around. We also had our conference in it's ball room where we really felt a 5 star standard

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: jc w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now and both times where great , from the service to the food ,the club room etc... if you are looking for a peacefull stay in Sing this is the place near shopping centers ,theater , casino .

Reviews.Title: “Nice building - Hotel met expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lavy81
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the nicer hotel buildings I've stayed at (as opposed to a resort) that's right smack in the centre of the Financial District. It has a huge atrium in the middle of the building, with skylight pouring through from the top. The reception is on the 4th floor, and as you take the elevator up, you get to see the expanse of the building and the lobby. I was most definitely overwhelmed by the sophistication of the hotel. I booked a Deluxe Room and the reception was friendly and efficient - I managed to check in at 1pm. Please be aware though that you have to park your car at Marina Square and they provide free 24 hour parking per night's stay if you are a guest at Marina Mandarin. You will need this complimentary season ticket from the hotel concierge in order to get the free night's parking. The room was huge by Singaporean standards and we managed to put in the extra bed without any issues. Certainly one of hour highlights was the pillow menu where we got to choose soft, medium, hard or contour comfort without any additional price. The housekeeping will send up the chosen pillows once you have made your requests through the phone. The room came with the standard amenities - tea and coffee making facilities, fridge, shower (no bath - as we had extra bed, we chose a slightly bigger room but we forfeited the bath), bathrobes and a safe. However, as per all 5 star hotels, you have to pay for internet and wifi. I didn't manage to check out the gym or the pool as I did not have enough time but its safe to say that this hotel is well located - it is next to a mall (Marina Square), it has a 7-Eleven next door, it has plenty of eateries, Hong Kong restaurants round the back and Suntec City Food Court is open early for breakfasts. I am not a 5 -star hotel person but overall I will stay here again if I need to be in the area because of the price. The other hotels around the area tend to be a bit steep in pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & location, food average”
Reviews.Author: robw48
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the Marina area the Marina Mandarin is a good bet - it's located in the maze of pedestrianised tunnels and shopping centres that take a bit of getting used to - getting around the first time is like negotiating a maze - but that applies to other hotels we've stayed in around there as well Reception and the front desk are very good and the rooms are large and very well equipped & maintained. Housekeeping and room service were the fastest & best we've ever encountered anywhere - and we used them a lot Food & Beverage is not as good - very formulaic and the breakfast buffet is halal - so no bacon or ham. That's not a problem but you don't know until you start loading your plate. More sandwiches in the bar area would also be good nice pool but the bar/serving station seemed to be unmanned for far too long Reasonable value

Reviews.Title: “pretty good value for money in expensive singapore”
Reviews.Author: cbob155032
Reviews.Content: -great location within walking distance of many local attractions and shopping areas, and close to MRT (subway) stations when you want to go further away -well maintained facility with comfortable, quiet rooms and normal ammenities -competent, friendly staff - especially one of the concierges, Rafi Patani, who was very helpful on several occasions during our first visit to singapore -unless you like a very large breakfast every day, the Aquamarine buffet is very expensive and there are numerous and more reasonable nearby options (can't comment on other meals at the hotel as we ate all other meals elsewhere). -internet costs now out of line with the rest of the world -once you get accustomed to singapore being one of the most expensive cities in the world, and looking at other options and other traveller feedback, this hotel still rates as a pretty good value for money. cbob

Reviews.Title: “just not the same”
Reviews.Author: bonnie024
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights at the end of february. We arrived at around 7pm and the man at the door pointed to the lift and told us which floor to go to. We stood at the reception for about 5 minutes because the two men were busy on the computers, eventually a girl was available to check us in. I gave her our hotel voucher which clearly stated type of room, how long we were staying etc etc, then she asked if we had any other paperwork, my husband said why is there a problem she didn't answer. She gave us a card which she didn't tell us how to use for the lift and room. The room was on the 9th floor with a very busy noisy road outside, not very clean at all the valance sheet on the bed was filthy, cupboards were dirty and dusty just terrible. What made us laugh was the toilet is squeezed behind the door to make way for a bidet. It was so much better when we stayed about 4 years ago, what's happened? I filled out our questionaire the day before we left but we have not had an e-mail yet, i get the feeling they don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Old Structure, Great Interior!”
Reviews.Author: mongkeybiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel building is already old but believe me when you get inside you will not believe your eyes how it is well maintained. Rooms are very clean and quiet too. The only downside is that it took me a while to call for a housekeeping to throw my oversized trash out of the room. I left it outside instead and eventually they threw it all away in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: Stayed end of Feb, early March. Check in was a breeze. Requested a Non-smoking, King room (just a deluxe). This they confirmed at check-in, so I took other Trip-Advisors hints and asked for a Marina Bay view room. "Certainly" they said. The view was fantastic. The room was large and clean. They provided complimentary bottled water and fruit, which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: After moving from the Marina Bay Sands we were not sure how this hotel would rate. Check in - Quick and no worries. Rooms clean and tidy, but our non smoking one had a cirgarette burn on the carpet. No lingering smell though. Great location. Only fault was that we kept getting locked out of our rooms with no explanation. We were there 5 nights and were locked out on the 3 and 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our 2-night stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: UmiSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in January 2012 for a mini break and to celebrate a friends birthday. The room was big for similar priced rooms in Singapore, had a big bathroom and a powder room, modern bright atmosphere, and a small balcony to take in some fresh air and enjoy the view of the Marina Bay. The location is great for a nice morning walk/ run from the hotel, around the Marina Bay and back. Amenities were ample and of great quality, service was prompt and accomadating. Breakfast choice were delicious, varied and plentiful, even had freshly made wheatgrass juice and healthy bread options. The fitness room and yoga area was clean, comfortable and crowded by 6 am, as all the executives were getting their workouts in before their day at work. For us on a holiday, 7 am was a better time to go to the fitness centre and enjoy the workout, then a cool dip in the outdoor pool. In review, this hotel is in a great location, with great view, great look, uncluttered and calmer than being on Orchard Road. Great for a romantic getaway, getting together with friends, and still family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: the_retirees_Perth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the last two nights of Chinese New Year. We watched a Fire Work display from our balcony. We could also see the Marina Sands Hotel and the Singapore Flyer from the balcony.The room was large, clean and modern. The staff were efficient, knowledgable and also helpful. We would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lio-Isa
Reviews.Content: Everything was smooth, staff was nice and gentle, the room was huge and clean, service is perfect. We took the Meritus Club rooms, with an amazing view on the bay. We would have loved to stay more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but ageing”
Reviews.Author: Toppee
Reviews.Content: This was once an amazing hotel with a huge atrium in the middle. The decor is just starting to look a little aged as are the rooms. But they are still of a reasonable standard and quality. They put out songbirds in the mornings which is lovely to wake up to the birds singing. THe sound fills the atrium and you could sit and listen for ages. Nice and centrally located though and you can pretty much get anywhere you want from here. Short walk to Raffles if you want to go and get an original singapore sling!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with several friends for 7 nights recently. Great location, our rooms were all on different floors and had different layouts. More than enough space - both bedroom and bathroom ( full bath and separate shower, twin basins). Quiet, efficient housekeeping and customer service. The gym and pool were both in great condition and we all enjoyed the use of those frequently. The lounge area is easy to access, coffee downstairs is great. Close to everything you might think of, and the front door staff were very polished in procuring transport, giving directions, finding locations for us. Malls, restaurants and food courts all around you, so heaps of choices there. The Irish pub a short distance on the same street is worth a try. An absolutely enjoyable stay - take the buffet breakfast option though - made a good and stress free beginning to our days - Singapore is slow to wake up!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: James_birduk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night as part of a Singapore Airlines deal, so it feels bad complaining as the room rate was very reasonable. But - the Mandarin Marina is listed as a five star hotel and the amount we paid shouldn't affect the service or conditions of the hotel, it felt as though it did... It seemed to take an overly long time for the person at reception to allocate a room to us. We had asked specifically for a no smoking room, we were given a room on the 9th floor, we went to the room and it had obviously been occupied by a heavy smoker and stank of stale cigarette smoke. We went straight back to reception and told them and to their credit they reassigned us to a room on the 16th floor overlooking the marina. So well done for putting us in a good room - but why not just do that at the start - that's what 5 star hotels do. The location of the hotel is very good with views across the marina. The reception area and atrium are quite impressive. Oh, I almost forgot, charging £7 for a small beer from the mini-bar, why?

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sasisekar
Reviews.Content: Really took a risk of arriving Singapore without a reservation lead to a great satisfaction. Just got to know about this hotel by one of my mutual friends. When arrived, it was just a rate query and room show round, But the gurst services staff did a great JOB. Karez did a show room and where as Senthil explained about facilities. Got bowled over by their marketing though, but what made a perfect stay was the one afterwards. Every day they use to encourage me and my wife for a city tour, night safari and even the nearest hawker centre. My wife really got amazed the way they cared for us. Specially the bed making with a card saying happy honey moon etc etc. Though we stayed in Hotel Michael later in sentosa, our fond memories were there here. My bosses daughter is planning a trip next month, hope the services gonna be the same, I think it will.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rrrrulb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in February I was booked into a non smoking room. Upon arrival I was given a very smelly smoking room. It took reception a long time to change this (late at night) after offering to put an ionizer in the original room for awhile. I refused this option and they finally found me a room with two single beds. My company had booked the hotel / room and I had not bothered to look at the room rate / type. So finally went to bed thinking I was in a standard room for this hotel. I had a closer look at the booking late the second night and was astonished by the room rate. Even considering Singapore prices. I checked with a work college that stayed in this hotel the week before for 4 days. My room was a standard below his but $240 per night dearer. It's a good location but by all means check your room rate and what they actually give you when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baindur
Reviews.Content: Was there for a business trip for a week and it was an excellent stay at the hotel.The room was on the 17th Floor with view of the Marina Square.The room had all the facilities that were essential to make your stay worth.It had a stunning and a large lobby and a very good breakfast. The staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Service at the concierge desk”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth503
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay at the Marina Mandarin Hotel in Singapore, my husband and I had some dififficulties with our flight leaving Singapore to Ko Samui, Thailand. When we asked at the concierge desk to have our flight confirmed, the flight had been changed to another time and we would not have been able to make our connecting flight out of Malaysia. Rafi, one of the concierges at the hotel was most helpful and worked to find us alternate options to get to Ko Samuii. He phoned the airlines, searched the net, phoned our agent in Vancouver...sent emails back and forth with her and looked after us with coffee and reasurances. While doing all of this, he continued to help others with their questions. Rafi also contacted us on the way to the airport, just to make sure everything was going smoothly. We were most impressed with the hotel and with the service, especially Rafi, what a guy! Thank you once again. I highly recommend this hotel to travellers. We did fing the drinks and food expensive. We also would like to see the larger hotels provide free internet service. Elizabeth and Neil

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs and expectations”
Reviews.Author: Theresa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in January 2012. The room was excellent. Clean, comfortable with a 5 star feel about it. The views over the Marina were excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning lobby, fantastic breakfast included in rate!”
Reviews.Author: KOmmen
Reviews.Content: Once you walk in and look up, you are impressed with the feeling of this hotel. I stayed with a group from my company, and everyone was treated wonderfully. When I checked in, my reserved King bed room was not available, but while I was at work the next day, they (with my permission) moved my luggage to my preferred room for me. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent, with items available from many different cultures. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to show it's age but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tartan69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 3 years ago and since that time the hotel feels a bit more well worn. It lacks the sparkle and sheen of a 5 star but is excellently located and has good facilities e.g. pool, spa & gym My room was a bit dark and quite small. Nothing stood out for me in terms of decor but it was clean, comfy bed and decent bathroom. The one annoying thing about this hotel is the noise. The hotel has a big atrium and at night when bands are playing in the lobby area, you can hear this music in the rooms. The breakfast buffet was not up to quality of other 5 star hotels but decent enough spread. If you get a good deal, it is worth staying here. If you want top notch 5 star in Singapore I would probably look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With Flaws”
Reviews.Author: mcleanlaw
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Marina Mandarin in Singapore while attending a conference. Superficially, the hotel is what one should expect of a five star property. It is underneath the surface that flaws are discovered; and these flaws can be corrected if the hotel management chooses to do so. I stayed at the Merits Club level, which I thought was a benefit. It was expensive (S$500/day), but given the prices for meals and drinks, this was worth it. We had cooked breakfast daily, and cocktails with appetizers in the early evening daily. The charges for breakfast alone would have been well over S$45, and the glasses of wine would be over S$20 each. So the costs rapidly add up in Singapore. Additionally, the Meritas Club entitles one to free Internet access, which also saved. The Club Level staff were spectacular. The most friendly I have experienced at any concierge level at any hotel. The rooms were very clean and elegant. All the emenities that one would expect at this price, including bathroom toiletries, etc. I found that the room was always too cool even if the AC was on the warmest setting. The only thing one could do would be to turn the entire power down in the room, which led to the room warming too much. So one must adjust to this. The in room coffe was the best I have ever experienced anywhere. I went to one restaurant at the hotel, which turned out to be a mistake. The restaurant was Peach Blossums. The service was horrible and the food bad. The wait staff offered the upscale full dining menu without also offereing the lunch menu (we were there for lunch). Not knowing better we ordered from the more expensive menu. When we asked for explanations concerning the entres, the wait staff could not explain the dishes. It was a real mess. I noted also that this restaurant serves shark fin dishes. I was astonished that in Singapore, and at a world class hotel, that shark fin was still available given the world outcry over the decimation of the worlds shark population and the UN stance against shark finning. I spoke with the management of the restaurant about this, and all they could say was they "were discussing it". I was really surprised the Mandarin would allow this practice at their facility, and I take it that the Mandarin Chain supports shark finning as a result of allowing the menu to include shark fin items. The fitness gym was adequate for the hotel, but nothing to brag about. Most of the equipment, including free weights and resistance machines with cardio machines, was dated. I suspect most of the equipment was acquired used. Many of the free weights, such as dumbbells, were mismatched. There were no medicine balls or exercise balls available. This is a cosmopolitan hotel catering to an international clientele. The sister hotel Mandarin Oriental is within easy walking distance. For the price paid, I would expect an updated hotel, a better fitness center as well as a more environmentally aware facility.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: dwainrego
Reviews.Content: pure bliss.. beautiful rooms, posh location, a perfect place to stay in singapore.. Marina Mandarin Singapore is a 10-minute walk from City Hall MRT Station. Local attractions like The Esplanade, Singapore Flyer and Suntec City Convention Centre are less than 1 km from the hotel. Featuring warm lighting and floor-to-ceiling windows, rooms at Marina Mandarin offer panoramic views of Marina Bay and the city skyline. Each is elegantly decorated with a flat-screen TV and tea/coffee making facilities. A well-equipped 24-hour fitness centre provides guests the opportunity to work out during their stay. An extensive range of spa and skincare services are available at the St. Gregory Spa

Reviews.Title: “Quality all the way......”
Reviews.Author: Ardfernbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive deluxe room, which was very well furnished and had a large, well-equipped bathroom. The hotel is very impressive and oozes luxury, from arriving to a very warm welcome from the porter staff to the reception staff on the 4th floor. The hotel is triangular in design with a huge atrium from ground floor to twenty-first. If you suffer from vertigo then perhaps you might want to avoid this hotel, especially as 4 out of the six lifts have glass on three sides. We didn’t eat in the hotel as, despite the range and obvious quality of the restaurants, we prefer to eat local. Access to the Marina Square Mall is immediately off the hotel and, as well as shops, there is a food court featuring Malay, Chinese, Indian, Korean, Indonesian and European food outlets. The food is excellent and the average price for a main course is about £3 or less. Outside the Mall, towards the marina, is a small hawker market, where the food is almost as plentiful, just as good, and almost as cheap. Many locals eat in the food court and the hawker market, a sure sign of both quality and value. We could not fault the Marina Mandarin for comfort, quality and service. It is well-placed, just 3 minutes from the marina and about 5 minutes from Raffles Hotel and the Padang. If you prefer more international, in other words bland, food and bars, then you can get to Clarke Quay which is only about a £2.50 taxi ride away. But then, you might just be as well go to Benidorm as there’s not much difference in the bars – apart from the prices - £6 for a pint of beer.

Reviews.Title: “Splurge Hotel on RTW”
Reviews.Author: plushkanyc
Reviews.Content: As I am on an around the world trip, I need to be budget conscience, so I originally booked into a hostel in Singapore. I spent one night there, but was quite sick, so I decided to leave the hostel and splurge on a nice place where I could get room service and recover before leaving for Bangkok. I chose the Marina Madarin because of the location, service and it was a bit less expensive than simliar hotels in the area. I'm used to business hotels for work, and this was exactly that. Staff were mostly professional, except the morning I left when the staff in the lobby were goofing around instead of helping me, but I would not say they were friendly. I was very grateful for the soft bed and hot shower. Room service was okay, overpriced as always, but that is to be expected. The inefficiencies during check in and check out are maddening!!!! How can it take 10 minutes to check out after I have already paid for the room and left you my card details to cover incidentals? Why do you have to walk all the way around the room to swipe a credit card? Why do we need to print out multiple pieces of paper? I was just lucky I was first in line. The people behind me on both check in and out were going nuts. The hotel served its purpose for me, offering me a peacefull and private place to recover, but I probably won't be back. I've stayed at better. I'm not sure the guest really comes first here.

Reviews.Title: “Premium pricing without the premium service”
Reviews.Author: tpgrand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 2 nights in February. Firstly, the location of the hotel is excellent and central to restaurants and attractions in Singapore. The taxi ride from the airport was about 15 minutes and costing about $15-20 Singapore dollars. We had stayed at this hotel before and had booked an upper floor suite. This time, we booked a standard room on one of the medium floors. The good: - The MRT train station is a short 10 minute walk through an underground walkway with many shops. - The hotel is connected to a large shopping mall with good restaurants and shops - The room we got was clean and spacious with a comfy bed. The bathroom was big with both a standing shower and a bathtub. - The lobby is quite grand. With a comfortable lounge area - Breakfast is a typical buffet with a decent variety of Eastern and Western foods The bad: - When you enter the hotel, to get to the reception you must first take an elevator to the proper floor where reception is located. - Our check in took 25 minutes. The receptionist was cordial but took a long time to find us a room. At one point she left us and returned 10 minutes later with no explanation. (For travelers who have come off a long flight, this was annoying) ** This was also a stark contrast to our previous visit checking into a suite, where there is a private check in area, which is quick and efficient. - The hotel is what I would describe as open air in the sense that if you look down from the hallway, you can see all the way down to reception no matter what floor you are on. This may sound cool; however it becomes an annoyance in the evening when the noise from the lounge area permeates the walls and into your room. It was difficult to fall asleep during the first night, - For a tip on the rooms, try to get a room on the upper floors as our mid floor, city view room really had no view except the building that was across the street Overall: - I think you can tell a lot about a hotel by the different experiences that they provide to you depending on what room you book. The difference in booking a suite and a standard room is vast. While obviously the experience would be different, the level of satisfaction that you have with your experience should be the same no matter what room you book. - This hotel is a 4 star hotel masquerading as a 5 star hotel. It is a business hotel with impersonal yet professional service. - This hotel would be suitable for business travelers, however expect to pay a premium no matter what room you book - On our next trip, we would opt for other hotels in the area that provide better value and experiences for the premium that the hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Location & Great value for Money”
Reviews.Author: masgendut
Reviews.Content: Pretty much every thing about this hotel is great. The location is very central to most of the major attractions, the rooms are very big for Singapore and overall the hotel just has a great feel about it. Overall an excellent stay and I will certainly use it again. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Travellerr_024
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay at this hotel by chance as a last minute thing and I sure am glad that I did. The rooms were nice and clean and the best thing about the hotel was the fact that it was connected to the mall! Great for shoppers! The general look and feel of the hotel was very nice and service was great too. Would definitely recommend others to stay here while in beautiful Singapore, made my trip even better!

Reviews.Title: “Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: rachelevans0
Reviews.Content: The outstanding feature of the hotel was the buffet breakfast which is absolutely stunning in its variety. Food to suit all tastes and cultures, always plentiful and always fresh. Very good indeed. As to the dining room, we did eat in the Italian themed restaurant one evening but found it quite expensive and the food rather bland. Our room was a standard one on the fourth floor and was absolutely fine. Bath and shower, big bed, and the balcony was nice. Staff were very helpful and pleasant: looked after our luggage for us, having it sent up to room on arrival, and storing after check out on departure. Any problems were dealt with promptly - for example, the safe in our room didn't work and this was sorted out within 15 mins. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the money you spend”
Reviews.Author: SYTrips
Reviews.Content: So every time I have come to Singapore, I stay at this hotel. Granted, the room does feel clean, but a bit dated. They have some updated rooms on different floors that are more modern and cleaner feeling. However, overall, I'm not highly impressed with this property. The nice thing about the property, is it is connected to the mall for dinning options for business people on the run. The mall itself doesn't have a very wide selection of shops.

Reviews.Title: “My holiday”
Reviews.Author: Dianne P
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 days at the Mandarin Marina. People say what can you do for 10 days in Singapore well let me tell you i could have just stayed in the hotel for 10 days. The rooms are fantastic, great views, good beds, great bathrooms and very clean. The restaurants were amazing with fantastic italian, yes strange to go to singapore for italian but probably tne best italian i have eaten. The chines restaurant was amazing and because it was nearing chinese new year so much atmoshere. Then of course there was the breakfast with anything you wanteed to eat or could ever want to eat. The atrium of the hotel was enormous and had birds chirping all day. I used the gym and pool every day, the water in the pool was the softest i have ever swam in and i swim a lot. The service was first class, nothing was a trouble to do and the staff were so polite and helpful. This was my third visit to singapore and i loved it, the accomodation was first class. The position of the hotel is fantastic, just a short walk from everywhere including train station and the underground shopping centres. You can leave the hotel and shop or catch the train without ever going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and service”
Reviews.Author: Gus_Riboldi
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Singapore was make even more special by the great staff, food and service at the hotel. It is central to all services and transport and the friendly staff are always on hand to look after your needs. The variety and quality of the buffet breakfast are the best I have experinced in my travels throughout Asia. Will certainly be back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....!!!”
Reviews.Author: monisha402
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel a really really long time back..But it has by far been one of the best hotels i have lived in.. The staff was really warm and cooperative. the rooms were huge and had a great view. The bathrooms were grand and well made. The best part was it was connected to a shopping mall as well as a station. A must visit place.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pammy_502
Reviews.Content: I love how this hotel is linked to a shopping mall which leads to another shopping mall just by walking. Very convenient to major central attractions. I actually ended up seeing all the attractions in Singapore including Sentosa. Great service and lively hotel with plenty of entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: Matnau
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little outdated. The rooms are just OK...but the views are great and it's really close to a lot of malls and shopping. The gym is small with older equipment, and not really ventilated very well. Breakfast buffet is above average. Would probably try a different hotel for next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCoin
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very convenient to major central attractions. I was able to walk around to most sights. Nice, spacious rooms and great facilities (pool, gym, dining options). Lively hotel with plenty of entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the hotel 2nd time around!”
Reviews.Author: dlfn78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marina mandarin from Jan 28 - Feb 1st. The good reasons for staying at this hotel were still there but unfortunately wasnt impressed with there service or rooms this time. It's very easy to get tothehotel, you can take a shuttle that Drops Youat the hotel (ask customer service) it will cost you about S$ 9, or you can take their SMRT. Singapore metro train, there is a stop right beside the hotel ESPLANADE, it will only cost you S$3.20, dont forget to get a refund for your metro cards afters, youget a dollar back. The bedroom part was neatand clean. The bathroom was another story, when you filled up the tub, there were little black things floating in the water.... And the shower had black molds in the corner, the door of the shower would not shut properly so we always had this big puddle after we used the showers. When we told the reception, they made a note of it and had their cleaning staff clean it thoroughly, they address the tub! But not the mold part. The duvet which is common in hotels, can get too warm at night, so just ask for a sheet which they will provide immediately. The breakfast we found was ok, if your paying for it its not worth the S$35. No love for bacon lovers! The hotel is attached to suntec and marina square mall, so you will enjoy shopping if your not up for orchard road. Theres a Starbucks across the street, carls jr. Burger place beside it. All opens at 10. An irish pub is just around the corner and a row of local restaurant. 7/11 in the walkway to the trains If you want to try the local singapore cuisine, theres one just stone throw away, apparently alot of tourist come here and the prices are cheap. If your going to universal theres a shuttle that picks you up at the hotel and drops you off too.. Free for tourist. Internet is fast, but if its not included in your package its $31 for 24 hours i think and its $10 for 1 hour. Good points of the hotel its great place to be if your always on the move, if you dont like to eat at the hotel there hundred to choose from just outside the hotel. MBS is across the marina. Its very accessible by train, and most tourist spot. Staff is willing to do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. My advice if you are going is its a very good choice hotel, just make sure you look into their packages or promos cause this hotel can get pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JillBob11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the way back from visiting relatives in Australia and enjoyed it. We only had breakfast, never ate in the hotel as there are so many exciting places to eat around Singapore a lot cheaper than in the hotel but breakfast had everything you would ever want but the coffee could be better. Not sure whether we like being served coffee and tea from a thermal pot, as it impairs the taste, sure it would be better if you were offered pots of coffee and tea. The hotel is above a shopping mall and you can access the hotel from the mall during the day and evening up till 11pm. The concierge desk is on the ground floor where you can also enter the hotel and get a glass lift up to your floor. The bedroom was a good size as was the bathroom, with a bath and seperate shower, cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Fresh fruit and bottled water were in the room too. We only had interaction with the staff when going into breakfast and checking in and out and both times we were dealt with promptly and efficiently. We would throughly recommend this hotel for future travellers.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: mike j
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over Chinese New Year in a very well appointed room on the 6th Floor which appeared to be more of a Conference Room floor than anything else - but nothing was going on during our stay - and I am happy to say I never saw another guest on that floor! Our view of the Singapore skyline was superb and the room was able to easily accommodate a rollaway bed for our 11 year old, at no additional charge. Check-in was swift and painless with our bags arriving 10 seconds after us. By the time we had unpacked and scrubbed up it was almost 10.30 and there was nowhere open in the hotel where we could have a proper meal except a very impersonal seating area on the reception floor that was more of a bar area. Normally I would deduct a star for such a failing , it was only 10.30 after all, but the Concierge came to our rescue with a half a dozen outside alternatives including free transport in a hotel limo! We opted for the Thai joint across the street and had some of the best tasting and authentic Thai food I have ever sampled outside Bangkok. Breakfast was always a great experience and I came away hooked on omelettes a la Marina Mandarin - they are seriously good and perfectly cooked. The coffee was also the best I had tasted on our 15 day trip. Chinese New Year was in full swing during our stay and the hotel was in the forefront of local revelry as they introduced us to the Year of the Dragon with very entertaining displays. It was good to see the GM of the hotel in attendance resplendent in Mandarin coat! Although we didn't have occasion to usetoo many of the hotels services we were impressed by what we saw and the attention to detail made by the staff. Our room was in excellent condition and the only gripe was when we wanted to use more than one laptop or IPad, extra charges would be incurred and new passwords were required.
