This waqs all quite irksome as on most occasions the password never worked so we had to call the operator very frequent for yet another new password. In fact I think I spent more time talking to the operator than I did looking at my few emails! In the event no extra charges were actually made. Rant over! We thoroughly enjoyed our Marina Mandarin experience and would certainly choose it again when we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stopover Location”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRN
Reviews.Content: Somewhat souless but we found the staff making big efforts to please. Restaurants pricy for what they offered and with an Asian slant. Rooms clean and pleasant but the atrium bleak. Very good location for stopover sightseeing but don't stay too many nights!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: kotyusya
Reviews.Content: In general, my impression of the hotel is not bad. I stayed here for two nights in January 2012. The entrance and reception area are well designed and u do feel u enter a five star hotel. Other impression one gets entering the room. They haven't been renovated for a long time and I was a bit upset an disappointed as I definitely remember my stay in pan pacific several years ago and marina mandarin was considered to be a Better hotel. Anyway, service was good and friendly, I had a good sleep in the hotel and can't say anything bad about. My only comment as an action plan to hotel management is that rooms urgently need renovation to be competitive with a variety of other hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bell27
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas and found it to be poorly staffed. It took us so long to check in then to be told that our rooms would not be ready for 2 to 3 hours and we had to wait in the lobby (was not pleasant with tired children). Took many calls to try to get our luggage to our room. Some of the staff had poor english therefore communication was sometimes difficult. Breakfast buffet was Ok but more catered for Asian cuisine and not a lot of variety from one day to the next. Rooms are clean but just Ok for the amount of money paid. The best part of the stay was the balloon drop for New Years Eve. Good location but not impressed with hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location here”
Reviews.Author: mn6935
Reviews.Content: Easy access for huge shopping center , Ruffles city and marina bay. A little bit far from MRT station, but lots of shops on the sides of the roads to the station. Comfortable stay here, because of heart warming workers in this hotel. I got upgraded room, no extra charge because of a tiny troble of other custmer, so I enjoyed fire works on the bay area from my room balcony on the high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gauravramchandani
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the business traveler, the hotel had gone through a major renovation. The executive suites were absolutely a treat to arrive into after a long and hard day’s work. Staff was very pleasant. The rooms were clean and well maintained each day. I would definetly recommend this to others. The location is just perfect, as the MTR station is just 5 mins away (by walk).

Reviews.Title: “Bonne idée ! to go to Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: descoutures-fam
Reviews.Content: wow!!! We are just Loving our stay at Marina Mandarin.. Singapore.Too Good. Sentil from Level 1 was very caring not only with us but to everyone. Il a un talent exceptionnel. Highly recommendable for anyone whether family or a couple... Staff are good. Ce sont des gens bien :) Just the room furnishing to change better.. but still OK :) C'est excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: suyash_dubey
Reviews.Content: These are the 2 things that are great about this place, the service is one of the best i have seen. The view from the room over looked the singapore eye in the form of giant wheel. which in the night was lit in different colours. The food was good and had varied choices including the indian food. Inroom dining would be mostly accompanied by complimentary drinks which was a pleasant surprise everytime. Over all a avery good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is seeming better the more I stay there”
Reviews.Author: eriktera
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel half a dozen times on business, the latest in early January. The incredible lobby is beginning to grow on me. It is quite stunning, the open spacious lobby. The rooms are modern and very nice, with a big flat screen TV on the wall, and comfortable beds, and electronic light switches next to the bed that function well. I'm usually in late and out early the next morning, so I've never eaten there, though I was a little miffed to be charged $11 dollars for a sprite in the lobby. I'll come back with anticipation (I just won't order a sprite.)

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: pUtRi_YaNi
Reviews.Content: Was here for 1 night for the 2012 countdown celebration. Spectacular view of the fireworks from our room on 11th floor and exorbitantly high price to pay even after paying staff price (courtesy of someone i know). Room was very spacious, king size bed, narrow long balcony, bathroom comes with separate shower area and bathtub. For a 5star, the place looks dated from the furnishings in the bathroom, I think the toiletries could have been of better choices. It has a narrow balcony and can accommodate only 1 person at a time to pass through. Our baby cot that we requested was delivered to the room 6hours later. We had requested for room service and the food was just okay. It was served on time as promised but wasn't worth the price paid - SGD 50 for a plate of burger/fries and fried rice! And there's no complimentary wifi either! Lunch at Aquamarine was surprisingly empty with less than half of the restaurant occupied. As it was the NY eve, the price was jacked up but looking at the food choices, was disappointing - seafood was only served during dinner. If there were specialities served in the buffet, definitely couldn't tell. Breakfast was at the same place too but has more variety to choose from. Apart from the food, another minus is the link from hotel to the Marina Square mall. Since there wasn't a direct lift landing, we had to walk down the staircase carrying down the stroller to the 3rd floor - short cut. Otherwise, the other option was getting off from the ground floor and walking across and back up again to the mall which is cumbersome. Overall, there's nothing WOW about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: ca_fanatic04
Reviews.Content: Have been a pleasant stay throughout. From the frontman, receptionist to the housekeeper, they have been very courteous and helpful throughout. It was a rainy day and I dont have to worry about getting wet without umbrella since the hotel itself is connected to a shopping mall in which if you wind further, there is MRT!

Reviews.Title: “OK but lots of little things wrong for a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklebcn
Reviews.Content: Maybe because it was Xmas but the reception seemed woefully understaffed. Took a while to check in, and on two occasions we tried to call down and no-one answered after over 20 rings. Our first room smelled of smoke (on a non-smoking floor) and had mildew in the shower cubicle. We requested a change and the replacement room was very nice. One peeve - the balconies have no furniture - with a decent sized balcony sheltered from the rain it would have been lovely to sit out with a bottle of wine, but no balcony chairs/table and nothing suitable in the room to move out there. Was *very* surprised to be told that neither the cable internet nor the wifi was free - in a 5* hotel!! Unheard of in this day and age in my recent experience! Beware - a non-alcoholic smoothie in the lobby will set you back almost $20! Otherwise well located hotel, nice pool and gym, live music in the lobby etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dina A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marina Mandarin as part out of honeymoon in 2011 from November for 6 nights. We arrived early in the morning at 3am and we're able to check in by 10am. Whilst waiting we had full access to the business lounge where you could watch tv and have free coffee/tea. We were delivered a bottle of red wine as a honeymooner's gift once checked in, which was not the best, but still a nice gesture. The hotel rooms are medium sized and are well maintained and clean. We requested to be put on the highest floor and we were given level 11. Rooms cleaned daily!! The hotel is attached to Marina Square shopping centre which is fantastic as it's open to about 10pm at night. It very close to public transport, just a short walk down the street. You're also within walking distance to The Singapore Flyer, which also has all the meeting points for tour pickups and tour booking centres. You also just have about a 10 minute walk to the suspension bridge which links you to Marina Bay Sands, which is well worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended for Leisure Travellers. Stay at another neighboring hotel instead.”
Reviews.Author: Tsunami_5
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the hotel in room 1918.  The experience has been disappointing and annoying enough to compel me to write this review.  My husband and I are staying at this property with our baby. The trip is a celebration of our wedding anniversary as well as an annual holiday.  From before check-in to date, the experience has consistently been lacking. A combination of major and minor issues add up to an extremely annoying experience: 1. Prior to leaving India, I called to ask for the rates for upgrade. I was informed that for an additional SG 50 per night, we would have a breakfast inclusive upgrade to the next category. When I called back to confirm, a different person answered and informed me that this offer would only be presented to us at check in if there was availability. When we arrived, the lady informed us that due to New Year's they would not be able to upgrade although there was availability as mentioned by previous reps (who were aware of our booking dates) and we would have to pay an additional SG 900. 3 people- 3 different answers.  2. At check in, we reached early so were told room wasn't ready. Fair enough, except the lady checking us in refused to confirm the check in time. Although hotel check in time was 2pm, she kept saying the room would not be ready by then as there were too many guests. Apparently, it didn't matter that we were guests and had a baby with us. I had to speak sternly before she finally agreed to have the room ready at the time that the hotel policy specified.  3. Housekeeping's idea of cleaning the room is making the bed and maybe cleaning the bathroom. Floor had not been vacuumed...I could tell because I'd accidentally spilled some baby formula, which was still there when we came back at night 4. Housekeeping also made the bed, but left the pillows and cover on the floor for us to pick up. Dirty plate was not picked up, but nicely rearranged 5. Some channels in the TV have bad reception 6. They also had a hot water problem- the water became tepid while I was bathing my baby 7. Drilling noise (related to New Year Eve celebrations) woke baby from nap. Issue was fixed, but damage was done 8. Shower makes keening noise. Housekeeping came to fix it and  succeeded...in making it less loud 9. We ordered jam for some croissants we'd gotten from outside, and they charged SG $2. This after we were paying SG $1800 for 4 nights 10. When they made our bed, they did not bother to make or change the sheets in the baby's cot 11. When asked to change the baby cot sheets, they forgot. After we came back and it was time for baby to sleep...sheets weren't changed so called again 12. When they finally showed up to change the sheets, the housekeeping personnel rang the bell. Before I could get up..in 2 secs..rang the bell again and before I could reach the door, in less than 10 secs, opened the door himself 13. On New Year's Eve, we were dining in-room due to the baby and requested 2 candles. Apparently these present a fire hazard, so the hotel does not keep 2 candles. However, they keep birthday candles. I guess these do not present a fire hazard??! 14. We had called from India to check if the hotel could provide a bottle sterilizer, so we would not have to lug it all the way and carry a large suitcase. Staff insisted this was unavailable, but of course when we got here, we found the hotel can provide these 15. The guest services manager, Mr. Senthil, was nice enough to sympathize and sent across a bottle of wine. Housekeeping forgot to bring the wine opener. Small detail, but with luxury hotels, details count Rooms are nice and location is good, but poor attention to detail means you are better off elsewhere. Definitely not recommended for any kind of special occasion or families with babies. Works as a business hotel, but leisure travellers would be better off staying in other nearby hotels. Very disappointing experience. Definitely not coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the Great Location but the rest is subjective”
Reviews.Author: KXPlorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Singapore Marathon held December 4. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the finish line at Padang. It was actually less than 10 minutes walk which is a great recovery walk after a 42K run. Fortunately, the room had a bathtub which is great for soaking tired legs in cold water. During our stay, we discovered Marina Square (beside the hotel), a mall where you can find just about any retail store or restaurant. There is an outlet of the famous Wee Nam Kee chicken rice there but I've tasted better in other chicken rice places. I have been to Singapore many times and Marina Square is a good new find. The hotel is also walking distance to Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade, Suntec City and Funan Mall. It's also beside the Esplanade MTR Station and near the City Hall MTR Station connected via an underground link that has shops and restaurants. An MTR station is a great take-off point for exploring other parts of Singapore. Aside from the great location and the view of the harbor from our room (we paid additional SGD30 a night), I can't say much about the value. The hotel itself looks like it was built in the 70s and has probably reached its peak renovation potential. In a country where technology is advanced, there is no free wi-fi in the rooms. They did not give us newspaper everyday even if I saw newspaper in other rooms. The Ala Carte breakfast we ordered at the outlet took ages to arrive as if forcing us to just take their buffet breakfast. And the price wasn't worth it at all. There are many places around where you can get a substantial breakfast if you are not really a breakfast person. Overall, I still give Marina Mandarin a very good rating. The hotel in general and our room is clean. The bed and pillows are comfortable. The airconditioning is superb. Everything in the bathroom works perfectly. They bring you bottled water twice a day. And lastly, the doorman was very helpful. He pointed our taxi driver to which airport terminal to drop us off. When I go back to Singapore, I will probably try Conrad next based on our friend's experience there during the same period. Marina Mandarin just failed to emotionally WOW me to patronize them again. The front desk people are so cold, its all business for them, fake smiles. It's like bye bye customer, next customer!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jontowel
Reviews.Content: Been there several times, either for business or leisure. Strategic location, just a short walk from the Marina Bay casino :) I also like its direct access to the Marina shops. Very helpful. Room is spacious and clean. Ask for the bay view. Its stunning. One important thing: at night after 9pm you should try the Makan Sutra Gluttons Bay, a set of famous foodstalls across the road. It really lives to its motto "die die mus try".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jeaterhoops
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights earlier in December 2011. Firstly the staff are very helpful. Our room had everything we wanted, the shower and bath were both excellent, the large TV was a bonus ( although there's so much to do in Singapore, that TV was only used rarely). The bed was large and exceptionally comfortable. Our room on the 19th room, gave a good view of various sites. It's just a short walk to a couple of malls and also the Underground Railway., which connects to most places of interest. We did not eat at the hotel, because we prefer to explore and eat at a range of restaurants. The room has a fridge and a kettle for making tea/coffee. Each day our room was supplied with two bottles of water,two apples and the local English language newspaper. All gratefully received.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed with the service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsurfer
Reviews.Content: I can honestly can say we could not find fault with the service. On entering into the main lobby of the hotel you are presented with a massive atrium stretching up to 24 floors I think. It is quite breathtaking. The swimming pool area was very good and suited our needs. The receptionist even noted it was my birthday the day before we arrived and they sent up a chocolate cake to our room the following day. I think the receptionist was Amanda who noticed. Thanks Amanda :) your a star ! So summing up I think this was the best hotel we have stayed in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not too bad”
Reviews.Author: snoopyjazz_07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Marina mandarin for 3 nights last weekend. When we arrived, we were told one of our rooms reservation was messed up. The manager and staff did their best to make up and give us good rooms, even though the internet rate did not permit upgraded rooms. My room faced the marina bay, and the view was excellent. Rooms facing the suntec city road, is pretty noisy at night. Is worthwhile to pay a bit more for quieter rooms. Overall, rooms were spacious and clean, although some air-conditioning in the rooms were not working well but their engineers did their best to ensure we were happy. Location is superb as it is within the Marina Sq mall, so everything is just a walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alecg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, getting out of the taxi young lady met us knew our name and took us to the lifts to go up to the reception. check in was first rate able to book a late check out straight away. Room was tidy bellboy explained everything in room, overlooking singapore cricket ground. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Guenther K
Reviews.Content: Everything went well since the arrival in Singapore - check-in at 4 in the morning is not a problem and swiftly done, rooms are very comfortable and spacious, whole staff is friendly and available, everything in the hotel from the wellness area to the restaurant is nice and cosy. I stayed in the Marina Mandarin together with two friends of mine. The inside of the hotel simply looks impressive: huge hall, large reception area at the fourth floor with comfortable lounges around it, six elevators and everything light-flooded due to glass roof at the top. Our room was spacious and modern and the view from the balcony simply breath-taking overviewing the city's skyline and the Marina. Large bathroom furnished with everything you need (bathtub and separate shower, hairdryer, bidet etc.). For the sport activities we made use of the well-equipped gym and the 25-meter outdoor swimming pool with sun terrace. For the daily breakfast there are two possibilities: either you go to the "normal" dining room or you decide to pay a bit more to get access to the unique Club Lounge on the 21st floor - we decided to do so and had breakfast there, as well as a daily evening cocktail and free Internet access. The best of the hotel is the first class service and the friendly and courteous staff - everybody tries to do the best and to satisfy the guests' needs and requests. Nothing seems to be impossible. The hotel is situated in the very center of the Marina and therefore ideal as a starting point for visiting the city; it is directly connected to the Marina Square Shopping Mall, to Suntec City and to public transportation. What to say?! JUST GO THERE AND TRY IT OUT YOURSELF!! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at Marina Mandarin Singapore - top service!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia J
Reviews.Content: We were at Marina Mandarin for 6 nights. The breakfast in the club lounge in the 21st floor (the highest with an amazing view of the skyline) was fantastic, of a very high standard. Even the relaxing evening cocktail with complimentary snacks, which was included in our price, was very delicious. Our room was very comfortable and clean, with a small balcony and wonderful view. Great outdoor swimmingpool! The hotel is in a good location for walking to most attractions and has direct access to a shopping mall. We had a wonderful stay at the Marina Mandarin but what really made it for me – besides the good location and the excellent food - was the wonderful staff, very friendly and helpful. If you are going to Singapore STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Give me a Shotgun”
Reviews.Author: HKPlum_Bum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days/nights and I have to say at times it felt rather surreal almost like being inside "Twin Peaks". Being the Xmas season if one sits in the lounge area there are carols playng in the background but given the open centre design to the building it gives them a surreal echo. Notwithstanding that Singapore hardly has a festive feel about it in a 32degC heat. But worst of all were the piped bird sounds. Now these seem to be on all day and can be heard everywhere including inside your room. So when I was laying in bed at 8AM then it was unnerving at best and downright annoying at worst - preventing me from dozing off again. I was contemplating ringing the concierge for a shotgun but I guess he wouldn't have got the sarcasm. Apart from this major downer there was one high point but it is possibly a personal thing - corned beef hash at the breakfast buffet! This took me back to camping expeditions as a child/young adult and I couldn't get enough of it. Superbly done. Imagine my disappointment when it wasn't on the counter for the second day of my stay. Other points are that the air con is too noisy. The control is either 'on' or 'off' and the 'on' position is too loud to go to sleep. Fortunately the room temperature was OK with the A/C off. Also why would I have to pay for wifi in the room but it is free if I went downstairs to sit in the lounge? Surely this is inconsistant? Apart from that the location, room, facilities and service were good but please just get rid of the b*****y birds!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: euphmag
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my girlfriend for a week and we decided to book a nice hotel for one night. This seemed the best priced of all the better hotels in Singapore and we were not disappointed. Check in was easy, although you have to get in the left to get to reception which confused us a little. The inside of the building is huge in the middle and I think it looked very interesting. Our room was a standard room, no special view or anything (I think that the other side would be better) but it was nice. Huge bathroom and shower was a highlight but it was very clean. We went out for food and came back and sat listening to a singer and pianist in the bar area. The next morning we used the pool and all the facilities looked good but I can't really comment further as we did only stay the 1 night. The location was good though, next to an MRT and shopping centers, all in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service staff!”
Reviews.Author: Oni-Lady
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin is located in a great location. I always feel welcome by the service staff when I entered the hotel. I would wish to come back again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “5-star that is not quite so”
Reviews.Author: babypig82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just for a night. Will break it down into the good points and bad points: Excellent - location of this hotel is unbeatable. There is a direct link from the hotel to the Marina Square shopping mall which in turn is connected to all other malls in the area such as Suntec City Comvention Centre, Millenia Walk. It is also very close to the Marina Bay Sands shoppes and casino. - service is excellent, from the courteous and helpful hotel reception staff to the cleaning staff who greet you along the corridors - room itself is good, generally very clean and comfortable My gripes: - the toilet was clean, but that was marred by the presence of fruit flies, which was gross. When I stepped in, I saw several tiny fruit flies perched on the terry bathrobe and the underside of the towels on the rack. Also, there were occasional plumbing-like/or aircon? noises from the toilet throughout the night. - depending on which side you face (my room on the 17th flr was facing gardens by the bay as well as the highway, it can be pretty noisy at night. I had trouble sleeping because of the noise from the traffic. However, the view of Gardens By the Bay was quite lovely. - welcome fruit basket was browning, it might be nit-picky of me to mention this, but I'm stating it because you don't expect this of a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: igotthis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and found the rooms to be great. My room was quite large and had a great view. The staff are also exceedingly helpful and friendly. I asked for quite a number of random things at various times from housekeeping, and they always obliged, though it might take a while. Unfortunately, I think they may be understaffed as their response was enver very timely.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and staff eager to please”
Reviews.Author: Forest4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while on business in Singapore. While the hotel doesn't look particularly inspiring from the outside, it is very impressive inside. It's well located and connected to a shopping mall with an excellent and very reasonably priced food hall. Internet access was excellent. Was able to say goodnight to kids back in Sydney face to face every night, and one small issue i had with internet access was promptly and efficiently resolved by hotel staff.My room was large and very comfortable. My only gripe was that the room wasn't made up until mid-afternoon, but it wasn't a big issue. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with 2 star customer service posing as 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_the_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 4 days in October. I was very disappointed by this hotel. Like other reviews state, the bathrooms have mold, the hotel is largely trapped in the 80s, although the rooms have been updated, and slow elevators. The big problem, however, is the customer service. It is very, very bad. The staff are rude. I interacted with many of them over the course of my stay, and all of them seem to be unhappy and agitated. The service is not 5 star service. Some other negative points: if you want to get breakfast for the reduced rate of SGD 30 you need to commit to it for every morning of your stay when you arrive, the details of order and cleanliness are missing (chipped tiles in the bathroom, mold in the shower, WiFi not working in all the room, hairs in the bathroom, toothpaste from other guests left behind), the vent to the kitchen blasts out by the pool area thus you smell food exhaust while swimming, grimy cabanas for changing your clothes, not having rooms ready for guests having requested afternoon check in (happened to several colleagues), breakfast buffet is cheap food although with many options, non-smoking rooms smell like smoke. Positives: they will open the gym at any time for you, WiFi for free in rooms when you request a code everyday from the front desk, location, and cost of the hotel (although you can get good rates at better hotels elsewhere). Overall, this is NOT 5 star like the Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons, Fairmont, etc. Its like a not as well maintained Marriott. The management of this hotel needs to be overhauled and I think that would help.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are better hotels nearby.”
Reviews.Author: Deepdarshi
Reviews.Content: It's good hotel, huge and clean. Breakfast was complimentary was good. Rooms are outdated requires upgrade / renovation. Staffs are professional and service is ok. Lobby looks great though. Paid around 100 sgd for Internet which I think is expensive. Though overall experience was good. If you get very good rates worth staying else there are better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great bathroom and almost everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: FollowLee
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe double for $187 per night and they offer me a upgrade to Meritus Club room (2nd highest level) for another $80 last year on both my wife and my birthdays. Their service is first class however they put us to a room which is smoking despite my advance request and my wife is sensitive to cigarette smell. Anyway they immediately asked the housekeeping to improve the situation for us. The view of the sea through the room was breath-taking. There is a wonderful coffee maker, special mist shower, great bathtub etc etc. Everything was almost perfect there. We even got a free birthday cake and wine as requested. Have a memorable birthday 2010 and wish that they contact me again if they got very special promotion again. This time I would take good photos about my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: teacherbob
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I'm not sure what other reviewers meant by dated rooms. Ours (15th floor, premier room) was exceedingly modern and updated. The beds were fantastic, the bathrooms clean and nicely furnished, the service was impeccable, and the price—if you search carefully—was reasonable. And, of course, it's hard in Singapore to beat this location, especially if you plan to shop a bit or see a show at the Esplanade Theatre Complex. You can even walk to see Merlion in about ten minutes or to take in the Impressionist exhibit at the Singapore Art Museum (about a twenty-minute walk.)

Reviews.Title: “Good and comfy, just a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: Tree69
Reviews.Content: The Lobby is spectacular, and when opened, must have been a fabulous hotel. It is know a bit outdated, and rooms have a 70 look. But they are comfy, and big comparing to Singapore standards. Pros: pool which has little sun, and is at the level of the AIr con fans, which makes it very, very noisy. A bit far from the Orchad shops, but the hotels gives directly in a good shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: alanamx_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on thr 15th of November, told everywhere else was full. Paid 700sgd for a very basic room, which was small, shabby,and had a stale musty smell. There was no turndown and no breakfast offered. Gossly overcharged for a very inferior product. They should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “amazing and simply fabulous”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter1102
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Marina Mandarin last week for 5 days. Stayed on the 9th floor, deluxe room. Simple rooms which could use a bit of a refurbishment but service wise top notch. From the Main entrance till up to the room every staff is very friendly and all I see is big smiles. Concierge & Reception are extremely effecient and I have felt a home!. I have stayed at other 5 star hotels in Singapore, Marriott, 4 seasons, The oriental etc, which are nice as well but nothing close to the service level at the Marina Mandarin. I will certainly return whenever my work brings me to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieSharon
Reviews.Content: After an earlier stay at the Marina Bay Sands, the Marina Mandarin was like coming home. The staff are very friendly the rooms comfortable and convenient eating and shopping all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mymoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel where the conference was held. Location is great - easy to get to Marina Square for quick shopping and meals. My husband who tagged along used the interlinked tunnels / walkways to visit a relative who was staying at the Fairmont Hotel. However, if mobility is an issue (mine was as I'd sprained my ankle and was using crutches), getting to the interconnected malls etc. would be more of a challenge as certain places only had stairs and the lifts, if there were any, were not immediately obvious. I ordered room service and the food, while not great, was adequate. The coffee ordered through room service was decent. And I agree with everyone, the food at the hotel was expensive. But it's not a problem because it is easy to get to for food. The room (deluxe) was spacious, as was the bathroom. On top of the usual amenities, there was also an iron provided, which was a real bonus. Service was not personal but was polite and prompt enough. My conference finished in late afternoon and I had to check out before the conference started. But I was able to use the bathroom facilities on the pool and spa level for a shower before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great service, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Trilife
Reviews.Content: A waitress spilled carrot juice on us, while serving us our tea. We had a meeting in 3hrs and were in abind to get fresh shirts. The front desk expedited, when they didn't make the deadline, they gave us some closely matching shirts to wear for the mmeting. That is Ritz quality service. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok but there are better options at this price”
Reviews.Author: kaybradj
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay while on business in Singapore. There are better options at about the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, tremendous room, Expensive Food!”
Reviews.Author: markhels
Reviews.Content: Great deal obtained for this hotel from laterooms.com. Only problem was being unable to get a non smoking room when we presented ourselves after 2pm for booking in. Had to wait till 4pm to get into a non smoking room. Had a coffee in the hotel cafe whilst we were waiting and was the last food we bought in the hotel, as the cost was astronomical! When we got the room, it was beautiful, clean, fantastic bathroom, ironing facilities and bathrobes with huge flat panel TV and fruit. Swimming pool area really nice with bar and sun loungers and parasols, really pleasant and not busy, at least for us. Also good news is the easy access to the shopping mall directly through the hotel and to the restaurant facilites in the mall. Have to admit that mcdonalds breakfast was a favourite! Close to Raffles, Chimes and Marina Bay and we had a great time basing ourselves here. Hotel was really flexible when we booked extra days through laterooms allowing us to stay in the room we originally had.

Reviews.Title: “Well connected, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: sankvid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a good whole month as part of a business trip..so I can vouch for this place!! - very comfortable on the whole. Rooms were neat and decently furnished. Staff (housekeeping and security) were amiable and efficient - there was this one time a cab driver forgot to return change for my $50 and i did not notice till he had left, and they managed to get it back after 1 hour! Staff at the reception were also generally helpful. Right opposite Suntec City, internally connected to Marina square mall, walkable from Esplanade and the Merlion fountain, close to esplanade and city hall stations - as a tourist or a business traveler, you can't ask for more! Food - had only something from the cake shop, which was excellent! Plus good number of food options around the hotel too. The only things to watch out for - lifts were in only one end of the hotel, so one has to walk a bit to a rooms at the other end, plus very crowded lifts at 8-830am that needed a 5 min wait most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raunak12
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels in Singapore. Great staff and rooms, make sure you get the marina view from your rooms. If you don't want to stay on Orchard, this hotel is a great choice. Love the Indian restaurant across the street at the Pan Pacific Hotel

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay in a noisy room in a very full hotel that was struggling to cope with the guest numbers.”
Reviews.Author: MASWScreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina Mandarin for a business meeting spread over 3 days. A request for a non-smoking double bedded room had not been acknowleged and foolishly I assumed all would be ok. Wrong. We were offered a smoking room or a twin bedded non smoking room. Take it or leave it, the hotel was full. We were upgraded to a delux twin bedded room in recompense. This had a modern bathroom but our request for a quiet room resulted in a room on the front of the building facing a busy road, and inspection of the options indicated that all rooms faced busy roads in one way or another. The sound insulation internally is ok but the double glazing is not up to modern standards. The high occupancy rate in the hotel was testing the hotel to the limits - our room was not serviced especially well and on one day not at all - we had been in the room and the cleaners promised to return but did not. Not good for a 5 star hotel. Breakfasts and lunches were of mixed quality and the dining rooms simply too busy, the hotel was struggling to cope with the numbers of guests. We requested an extended check out and were granted this for 6 hours on payment of a half day's extra fee. Good for the hotel's bottom line no doubt but we will not be staying here again by choice as we know there are better options in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Mulledandstayed
Reviews.Content: Well below 5 star and not worth the money, there are plenty of better hotels in the same area with similar rates. The rooms are in desperate need of a refurb, sound-proofing and basic amenities you expect of a 5*hotel. There's a singer in the lobby area every night wailing for hours, which I'm sure is pleasant with a drink, but not also in your room, 7-11pm. The hollow centre is pretty but means the rooms are very noisy all the time. Service is pretty poor, nothing close to that of the excellent reputation Singapore has. I have been driven insane by the ridiculous Internet policy of locking your access to 1 device only- when I rang to complain I couldn't login on my laptop, after logging in on my iPad, I was told i would have to buy another package for a second device or wait for the 24 hrs to run out!! Seriously in this day and age??! Overall this is budget accommodation proclaiming to be 5*, and that's why they get the bad reviews. Go somewhere else if you can

Reviews.Title: “An average business Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSpecialistNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in the congress centre located accross the street, so the location we very convenient for me. The rooms are a little old but fine, the views are nice and the staff generally friendly. I hated that this Hotel charges for Internet, c'mon people, it's 2011 and internet is an essential, just like the bed and the toilet in the room!, is the extra 10 bucks really vital to your turnover? It's included in some bookings and it's an awful feeling when the reception looks it up the computer and says " Yes, for YOUR room you have to pay!" Breakfast was awful, single people being put at a large table all together gives it a Youth Hostel feel, the breakfast was chaotic, loud and the breakast choice was pretty poor and getting a cup of coffee was a nightmare! ... After 2 days I gave up on the breakfast and just skipped it. Fitness centre was however excellent, pool area was pretty grubby and service was not brilliant. A Hotel for tourists? Absolutely NOT, Would I stay again, even for business? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Marina Mandarin Meritus Club Floors”
Reviews.Author: NickyTwoHats
Reviews.Content: The best service I have ever recieved, I've spent 60+ nights there over the past five years and that in itself tells a story.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keltoshe
Reviews.Content: Great Location, stayed here before taking a cruise. Get the upgrade and stay on the top floor. Complimentray cocktails, etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Central 5 star”
Reviews.Author: kimbo25
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful lobby. The atrium is the largest of any hotels and reached 21 floors. Each morning birds are delivered in cages and placed around the lobby so that they can cheap to each other. The noise is wonderful as it echoes around the hotel. Breakfast is very good. What ever you want.... They have. The rooms have everything you cold want.... Iron and board, safe, hair dryer etc etc. the bed is very comfy and the pillows are the best. The pool is a decent size and gets some sunshine in the afternoon. Pool towels are by the pool. The spa is not cheap, but has a good selection and great treatment rooms. The hotel is connected to the marina shopping mall which has a good variety of shops. Overall, a very plesent stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lbes
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights while on business. Room was quite comfortable and had the ammenities I would expect from a five star hotel. Breakfast buffet has a wide variety of foods, from Indian, Japanese, meats and cheeses, premade pancakes and waffles, sausages and ham (no pork products while I was there - all sausages and hams were chicken or turkey) made to order eggs, cold and hot cereals, lots of fruits, pastries, breads, etc. Two minute walk to underground malls, access to subway. Very close to historical district and to marina bay. Service was good but not excellent - did take awhile to get someone to answer the phones sometimes. I lost my passport and had to re-check into the hotel. The hotel staff all seemed to know that I had lost my passport and the manager checked several times on my progress of getting a replacement and to remind me to file the police report. I wish they would have communicated with each other instead of constantly asking me/reminding me to fill out the police report. After assuring three or four staff members that I had, indeed, filed the police report, I still got a call at 10:30 pm in my room asking if I had filed the police report (call was especially not appreciated as I was asleep, having been up since 2:30 am dealing with passport, and had to get up at 2:30 am the follwing morning to catch my re-booked flight)

Reviews.Title: “way below 5*”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowEmma
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marina Mandarin for a 2n stay. After waiting half an hour to check in, we were given our room key. We were not offered if we wanted our suitcases to be taken to the room (which I expect from a 5* hotel), so we lugged our suitcases to the 10th floor to be given a room which was exceptionally dirty. The floor was filthy with big balls of hair scattered about it. The shower was FULL of black mould, the bath filthy and the soap dish isnt worth mentioning. We complained and were shown to a premier room... much improved although to my mind, way off 5*! The bath was all cracked andhad alot of enamel missing from around the plug, behind the toilet all stained and no tea and coffee, although a kettle with cups and saucers!! Having said that, the room was a million times better compared to the first. Breakfast was ok... good choice of food. Good location. On the whole, the hotel is just very run down and dated and in need of a good updating. We went into a few of the other 5* hotels around, and for similar prices they were far superior. If I was returning I would definately go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Large and somewhat impersonal”
Reviews.Author: UKaussie
Reviews.Content: We have not stayed at the Marina Mandarin for years and spent a night here before travelling on to Nikoi Island in Indonesia. We travelled with our teens and had interconencting rooms as we had requested (booked through Asia Rooms). We were on the 11th floor facing the road and we were disturbed during the night from traffic noise. The atrium is very impressive and the swimming pool area very nice indeed. The gym was on the larger side with lots of cardio machines and a number of nautilus type weights machines. Access to the shopping plaza is very easy and we decided to head to the Starbucks there for breakfast as the menu at the hotel seemed very expensive. It has aged somewhat and the decor is now retro in style. The front desk staff as well as those at the main doors were very helpful but the whole experience in a hotel of this size, is impersonal. We enjoyed our stay more,when we returned to Singapore and stayed at the Quincy. Two totally different experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoint experience”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine198
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outdated, and service is extremely bad. Although the room is decent, it takes forever for someone to answer the front desk or the Service Express line for room service when calling from the room. I had to hang up and call again because the phone just kept ringing. The staff is not very friendly or helpful when asking them questions about the area. Overall very disappointed in the hotel stay and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, underwhelming experience”
Reviews.Author: pukeko1
Reviews.Content: Architecture fans will enjoy the John Portman designed atrium... Quite spectacular and worth a look if you are staying nearby even if you aren't a guest at the Marina Mandarin. Beyond the beautiful lobby the hotel was nothing special. Arriving late at night I was told that only a twin room was available, not the double I had booked. There was no apology nor any attempt to remedy the situation for the remining four days of my stay, which is less than I expect from a hotel charging me $370 per night. The room itself was large and functional. The tiles surrounding the toilet were fairly disgusting, having fairly obviously been stained by prior guests unable to use a toilet properly. I would have asked to move had I not already been aware the hotel was full. The rest of the room was clean and housekeeping was flawless. The TV reception was poor, which would have frustrated me had I wanted to watch it. I didn't eat at the restaurants (although room service was fine) as there are many other options nearby. The hotel sits above a shopping mall which contains many cheap options for eating too. In-room Internet costs about $20 per day. Overall the hotel is adequate for a business traveller, but far from the best I've stayed in that price range. I won't be staying again, but would happily visit for a drink in the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mozilla_monster
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights here, and found this to be a perfectly good business hotel. The best part of the hotel is the central location near the Suntec area - which makes this conveniently near many offices, and other business areas. Check in was strangely located on Level 4, but otherwise, was not a problem at all. The room I had was simple, but had all the amenities a business traveller would need - High Speed Internet, stationeries, etc. Just as important - it was clean. The bathroom is where the age of the room showed - it obviously was designed for the 80s. However, it was clean, and had all the amenities required - a quick call to housekeeping to get a shaving kit resolved the only gap there with amenities. Breakfast was ok - so-so spread, and okay service. All in, I'd say this is a safe bet for a business hotel, given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't confuse Marina Mandarin with Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Bertiebertram
Reviews.Content: Ok, the GOOD STUFF - location, access to Marina Square Shopping Mall, comfy bed, feather pillows and great views. Now the NOT SO GOOD STUFF - where to start! Concierge seemed to lack local knowledge. Birds in cages hanging around the lobby. For Gods sake, set them free. They have wings for a reason. If I want to hear birds chirping, I'll go to one of the parks. The room = dire! Knackered lamp shades, when I drew the curtains, one curtain crashed to the floor - great! Badly stocked mini bar. No wine glasses, only 6 hangers, grubby bath towels with holes in them but strangely a white, fluffy bathmat = Happy Feet!!! I tried room service - mistake! How can you screw up a Club Sandwich! Worst of all - the wifi codes. You are rationed to one code per day per device! Oh that's good because we are two people with two blackberries, two iPads and one laptop! "I know let's go to the business centre instead!" Not such a good idea - they will only give you 15 mins free then it's $7 per 15 mins and $2 per printed page! RIP OFF!! Get real! In summary - this hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade; it is very tired, not geared up for the business traveller and a bit of a dump. There are much better hotels in Singapore than here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Bali_Berlin
Reviews.Content: Went there with my son and we choose the hotel because of the location, quite pricy but was fine and the service was great too. I booked without breakfast, and at the standard room. The receipsionist was very friendly and helpful. She upgrad my room and have the best view to the Flyer and Marina. I like the amenities in the room, not really fancy but descent L'ocitaine product. It would have been perfect if the internet was free :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view to the Marina Bay...”
Reviews.Author: MafArt83
Reviews.Content: The positive: - Very good location of the hotel next to shopping malls - A lot of good restaurants and international shops in the nearby shopping malls - Rooms are clean and with amenities as it can be expected of a 5-star hotel - Most of the higher floor rooms have a nice view to the Marina Bay - Breakfast at the coffee shop was good but expensive - Service personnel is friendly and accommodating - Efficient check-out and concierge service The negative: - The room rates are on the upper end - The front desk was understaffed and we had to wait a long time to be accommodated - Rooms need a refurbishment - Noise in the room from the hotel lobby (poor insulation) - Expensive hotel restaurants and bar - Expensive internet connection fee

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with the worst internet policy for travelers”
Reviews.Author: winCalifornia
Reviews.Content: 1. They charge for internet which seems increasingly ridiculous for the modern world. I got free internet 'cause I got the deluxe package. 2. You need to get an access code for internet on a daily basis. A light bulb finally went off in the customer rep's head on the second day as she proceeded to give me an access code that lasts till the end of my stay. Should have done it from day 1 don't ya think? 3. If you have more than one device let's say an ipad or an iphone. The hotel divides up the hours among your devices. If you have three devices you get 6 hrs/device. 4. I complained about the policy and the manager, Ms. Sheene Han. As opposed to recognizing the flaw in the policy she responded by saying that she will charge for the 3rd device. Stupid manager. Marina Mandarin you have lost my business forever. I am extremely well traveled and this has got to be the most business unfriendly hotel on the planet. Internet access is everything to us business travelers. I hardly post reviews but I am so offended by this hotel's backwards policy that I feel the need to post on every single major travel website to warn travelers of its stupid wiifi policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: Catinator
Reviews.Content: After listening to my mums wishes of seeing Singapore for nearly 30 years I surprised her by taking her for her 60th. This hotel is in a great location close to everything including Raffles and the sky park. Unfortunately when we arrived they did not have the room requested upon booking available so had to change rooms half way through our stay but this was made easy for us and we were happy to see our new twin room had an amazing view over the marina of the skypark. The hotel is very clean and the staff are all extremely helpful and friendly. We chose not to eat in the hotel as suntec city was opposite with a wide range of foods at very good prices, you can also catch the tour bus here which you can hop on and hop off all over Singapore. This is a great place for a short break which I am sure no one would be disappointed with, not so much a romantic place to stay but suitable for the city lover, explorer or a business person.

Reviews.Title: “Forget this one and go for Marina Bay Sands if you can afford”
Reviews.Author: GPCOSTA
Reviews.Content: First tip: if you can afford, just go for Marina Bay Sands and forget about Marina Mandarin. The location is very good. The architecture is nice. The elevators are amazing ultra-speed. But that's just it. Nothing else. For the price paid, was expecting much more. I just cried not choosing to go on Marina Bay Sands as price was too much for us. First time we were there was in middle September before our flight to Bali, Indonesia. We were on honeymoon and asked them previously 1-month in advance to give us a nice room with sea/marina view. Just got a standard room with no-marina-view, just opposite side (land). Ok, we were on honeymoon and didn't let us getting sad. A nice wine chardonnay was available for us in the room. When arrived first time, reception was ok, nice lady went to show us the room. The outdoor pool is nice, good to get some sunshine in the morning. The hotel is connected to a big shopping mall (Marina Square, one of the biggest with 65.000 SQM) and connected to Marina Link and two MRT stations (Esplanade and City Hall). It gets also connected via Marina Square to Pan Pacific Hotel and Mandarim Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location :)”
Reviews.Author: charmedmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and it was a good enough :) The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious enough. Service was ok. there was a mix up with my luggage but they resolved it in time :) Breakfast buffet wasn't the best that I have tasted but there was enough choices. Location was great because it was walling distance to most shopping areas in Singapore :)

Reviews.Title: “Good for holidaying couples”
Reviews.Author: TenRingShanghai
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin is by no means a brand spanking new hotel (that prize would have to go to the Marina Bay Sands across the bay), and sometimes looks a little tired, but the rooms are very comfortable and well appointed, the staff attentive and the beds comfortable. The very fact that this hotel is not the ritziest in Singapore makes it easier to relax, settle in and enjoy your holiday. The main public areas and lobby have had a face lift in the past few years, and the atrium design makes for a atmosphere, especially in the morning when caged song birds are hung up on the second level and call out across the lobby. The location is also ideal - being directly above the Marina Bay shopping centre and a short walk to the MTR (heck - this is Singapore and just about everywhere is short walk to the MTR!). I'd highly recommend and will stay there again when on holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcvw003
Reviews.Content: Loved the Marina Mandarin Singapore. It is in a convenient location, attached to the Marina Square shopping mall and close to the MRT. The pool was fantastic and our daughter loved it. Buffet breakfast had lots to choose from and food was quickly replenished. My husband's birthday was during our stay in early October and the hotel surprised us with a chocolate birthday cake in the room. It was a great gesture that was appreciated. Our room was big enough for us and our daughters rollaway. I would certainly recommend this hotel and look forward to going back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright but it could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Bapestatic
Reviews.Content: After staying at its neighbouring hotel, Pan Pacific Singapore, for numerous times, we decided to give Marina Mandarin a try this time around and we're disappointed. The furnitures in room which we had, are in dire need of a make over and the hotel could do with a little bit more ambient lighting, especially along the corridors. It's just too dark. The biggest bone that we had to pick was when we checked into our room and had a little difficulty with our safe and had to call for assistance. "Help" came 15mins later and with an uppity voice, the "HELP" informed us that all 5 Star Hotels in Singapore use a safe which requires a 6 digits pass-code. How are we suppose to know when there isn't any manual to inform us of such requirement. Anyhow, the safe at Pan Pacific Singapore, which happens to be a 5 star hotel, requires a 4 digits passcode. There are other instances too that happened during our 2 nights stay at Marina Mandarin, since our stay wasn't a memorable one, we have totally forgotten about them. The only novelty we liked about this hotel was the "chirping birds" in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: tikusmikus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a trip to Asia. It was clean, comfortable and well located. The pool was a bit small, but I found it too hot to sunbathe and I am normally lizard like! We didn't eat at the hotel as the shopping mall next door had a fabulous Japanese where we ate every day. One disappointing aspect was the caged birds. I would have thought that nowadays, the same effect could be produced without cruelty. But that's my personal opinion. A niggle was that in our room, the bath was unusable as there was no plug and appeared to be designed that way, which was a bit weird. The Irish pub next to the hotel shows European football matches too, which we found a bonus while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Alangibson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days on our way to NZ at the start of a great holiday. We too arrived following a night flight from the UK and checked in at 8 am. We were immediately shown to our room which was great where we could freshen up and then spend the day site seeing. The staff were friendly and the breakfast service and food was first class. The bar prices however were very expensive. Four glasses of wine $74. Don't forget everything has a service tax added to it. Overall we had a very pleasant experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD, PLEASE DONT MISS IT”
Reviews.Author: THX
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this hotel for 9 days, me my wife and 2 kids ( 10 & 12 ), my friend too he stayed for 12 nights with his family, trust me, i travel all over the world, i would say this is one of the best hotel ever. i took a suite room, god the room was so big, biggest room ever, breakfast was a dream, 2 major shopping malls just under the hotel, very clean, swimming pool hawaiian style, complete gym and massage

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PM J
Reviews.Content: During the period 23-26 spetember, with my spouse, we decided to stay at this hotel. When we arrived, everything was clean, quiet... staff welcoming you friendly. But when we arrived in the room, things started to become worst. Our room was non-smoking but we found some cigarettes on the floor of the blacony. it means noon checked/cleaned this place. A few minuntes after, we received a call because they where not able to find our luggage and asked us how it was looking. When you know that they plugged a number on our luggage and we gave to the reception at the checkin the receipt, it was a bit disappointing. Anyway, a few ,inutes later, they found our luggage and big it to our room. Later, we wanted take a nap and when we opened the bed, we saw it was not well made, had some back spot on the bed sheet and the bed sheet was too small for the bed. This last thing was a bit too much for us, especially when you stay in a hotel of that grade. We went to the reception to inform that the bed sheet was too small and that some cigarettes were on the balcony and asked for this to be fixed... when we came back in our room a few hours later, nothing was done. I came to the reception a second time and screamed to finally have someone fixing the bed... but nothing for the cigarettes. Later, when using the sink in the bathroom, it appear both of them where leaking a lot for the waste water pipe. And when we realized that, we had a little flood in the bathroom. As I was really upset and not trusting people from the hotel anymore, I fixed it by myself. They came to clean the cigarettes on the balcony only 2 days later. And that same day, when we came back in the room in the afternoon, both of our key card were disable. At that time, it was really too much for us. We came - again - to the reception to have our card fixed and to complain again, as it was many issue that we had just in a couple of days. later in the evening, someone from the hotel came to hear again our complain and apology... but at the end, they did nothing to compensate the issues we had during our stay. We stayed in many hotel 4* and 5* including Hilton, Sheraton,... and this is the first time something like this happen. We understand that some issue can occur as nothing can be perfect, but the quality of the room and the quality of the service, for 530 SGD/night (about 300 Euro/night), I think the rate quality/price is really poor. My spouse and I decided never come back in this hotel anymore and we don't recommand it unless you agree to face some unexpected issue for a hotel of this grade.

Reviews.Title: “Don't upgrade to club level”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller-f1
Reviews.Content: After receiving quite good service and extras at another hotel in Singapore we decided to upgrade from Premier to Meritus Club level for the F1 GP (this of course came at much extra cost). So far this has been a poor decision as we were only given a smoking room which we only found out after being shown to our room. We were not advised of the benefits of the club nor was there info in the room so we had to contact the club. The 1st night our room was beautifully presented with mat and slippers beside the bed, curtains drawn, pillow scented (although we couldn't tell) and tray for laundry / breakfast menu. Our 2nd night only saw the curtains drawn. Our room badly smelt of stale smoke so asked for it to be deodorized. This was to take 20 mins but after returning to our room 5 hours later their machine was still running.. Making it now smell like the swimming pool. The service at the club room is very good and the food on offer for breakfast is quite good. However for the rest of the day the food isn't great. You would expect this to be excellent at an extra $200 per night during the GP period.

Reviews.Title: “5 star price but not the service”
Reviews.Author: htwong37
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Marina Mandarin for 2 nights. The price I paid is a 5-star hotel price but the service facility is not 5-star. There is dust over the carpet on the stairs in the lobby. The room is nice but the washroom is a bit torn down. Wifi is crazily expensive and even needs to charge for using LAN (do you know what century are we in now?!!!) On sun morning, I was awaken by drilling wall noise at 9am, what a gd alarm clock. The operator was not friendly when I got trouble in making local calls. I hear her personal phone was ringing in the phone and probably I was bothering her. For breakfast, there is a wide variety of choices and the food are fab. Fruit are refilled very quickly and the pastries are great. They put some birds in in the morning and the whole hotel can hear the nice songs. Just a tip for those who would pick this hotel, exit from esplanade is much closer than from city hall MRT station!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly gloomy and annoyingly complicated and expensive WIFI”
Reviews.Author: Nordic_Mist
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by a friendly member of staff on the 1st floor and my bags quickly taken to be sent to the room. Went up to the 4th floor for a fairly efficient check-in. Asked to have my KrisFlyer card registered but was informed that unless I booked directly with the hotel then no miles earned! (How many people actually book direct I wonder? Surely "everybody" uses a booking site?). The hotel is the opposite of cosy but if you like very large spaces it certainly has lots of those with an open atrium running through the building. Still, the hotel is fairly dark (Singaporeans often don't seem to like daylight very much :-)), and has the feeling of being slightly out-of-date. Searched through every bit of paper in the room in the hope of figuring out how to log onto the wifi which requested a code on logging on. Finally called the reception and was told to call another number where I finally received a log-on code. But only for 1 day at a time!!! So had to call everyday to be allowed to pay for another 24 hours of service. If a hotel insists on charging ridiculous amounts for internet access they should at least make it easy to access! Why can't the Marina Mandarin have the standard lastname/room-number log-on like "all" other hotels?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Cyn
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 week in this hotel for a business trip during the Independence Day celebration (August 9th) and was pleasantly surprised by the service, cleanness, food, and outstanding decor. From the beautiful lobby to the well laid out rooms which included balconies, I was glad I stayed at this hotel. The room was large; bed was comfortable and clean; TV was a new flatscreen the bathroom was exceptional with marble and all high end fixtures. My favorite part of the hotel was the upstairs lobby with the magnificent view to the top of the hotel. When you are on the 19th floor looking down it was incredible. The outside pool area was quite nice with towels, lounge chairs, shade and a beautiful view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. The breakfast buffet was international and had choices for everyone. The service at the front desk was professional and very accommodating. The location is great since it is close to the subway station, attached to the shopping mall and walkable to the marina area. My favorite part of the hotel was daily at 7:30am when they brought the songbirds out to the lobby and their singing would echo all the way to the top. It was surreal. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: FemkeBas
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with great reception. Hotel is well location to subway, highway or a nice walk around the bay. Service is OK. Breakfast is very very nice. At the swimming pool you smell the kitchen. I always go to this hotel when staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a first visit...”
Reviews.Author: challenger728
Reviews.Content: We initially planned a backpacker place, but later on decided on a full-service hotel. Convenience and distance to planned destinations was a big consideration. Marina Mandarin looks aged, but with grace. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Our request for early check-in was granted and we were given a free room upgrade! We loved the selection at the breakfast buffet. The food was very tasty and the staff attentive. Our room was comfortable, even with the extra bed thrown in. We're strongly considering staying here again when we return next year... Kudos to the staff of Marina Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Great for National Day Fireworks and not more.”
Reviews.Author: Hweeps
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 1 night, paid more than 600 sgd , a premium for viewing Singapore's national day fire works. I won't recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a good view of next year's fireworks from the tiny narrow balcony. The service at check-in is slow, with such a large reception, only 4 girls at work. Yes, it is the peak hour for all checking in guests for that exciting night, all the more, a hotel of 5 star rating should have boosted their workforce at the reception. Ditto for checking out, a long long line.... I find the room in need of revamp, old carpet, not very well lit bathrooms. Only upside is the huge shopping mall under it with lots of eateries, not good for hotel restaurants though. Must also give credit to the front desk for trying to find me a bigger room, even if they did not succeed ( I found the room too small for an extra bed, impression from photo and description was bigger). I will be looking for another hotel next year 9th August.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hieks7683
Reviews.Content: We went there for 2 nights stay during the Comex exhibition. Nice location which is near to suntec and marina square mall. room is nice and clean, but the room with the connected door with other room is not recommended. The wall is very thin so u can hear clearly other people talking from other side. Try to booked few month ahead to get discount rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb view, with very own balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Nudea
Reviews.Content: Go for the Club room, you'll get an incredible view of Singapore, looking over the opera house and beautiful sky line along the coast (especially at night with all the lights on). There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. The reception and lounge area is stunning and very impressive when you arrive to check-in. Rooms are nice, very up to date, clean and they offer a great service. Breakfast is great, when you've got a Club room, the breakfast is separate from the other guests (in a different room/floor) so can't say how the regular breakfast is. Staff is very helpful and nice. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jerpal
Reviews.Content: They rate the hotel as a 5 star, but it is more like 4 stars, which is reflected in the price. If you want 5 star quality, stay at the Ritz but for a couple hundred USD per night. The pool is very nice. The location is excellent if you like shopping. Personally, I prefer the Clarke and Roberson Quay areas for the activity along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel offering everything - but a little TOO big.”
Reviews.Author: ferrisgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overwhelmingly huge with a vast atrium full of caged songbirds (not sure what I think of that). But for a stopover it was great. Located on top of a big shopping mall , good big pool, well equipped rooms that are clean and comfortable, and the day spa was excellent - I recommend the massage and facial as a good travel stress buster. Good breakfast too. For a longer stay I would probably look for something a little smaller but the service was excellent and overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual Mandarin standard”
Reviews.Author: clareanon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was lacking in Staff ,rooms were quite poorly decorated although we were told that they had just been refurbished!There is also no ambiance about the place.Such a pity as we are "Mandarin"fans.The Marina Square is a good shopping centre though and the train runs very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel with a bad service”
Reviews.Author: Dutch2721
Reviews.Content: We weren't happy at all with our stay at the Marina Mandarin. We did request a early check in, family of 3 (parents and child) But when we arrived there wasn't a room available big disappointment after a 12 hours trip arriving at 06:00 am We know that the can't quaranty this, but we're really disappointed, that they didn't inform us the days before, so we had the change to book another hotel. The room was not what we expected,we couldn't switch the airco off, hairdryer didn't work, telephone in bathroom had a problem and for checking out we requested a larger taxi at the reception, but they forgot to arrange it. So we're done wit he the Marina Mandarin and cancelled our second stay a few weeks later. So better book the Fairmont, Marriott or Fullerton!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many 5star hotels in Singapore and this is definlety not one of them,the beds are like slabs of concrete and the pillows are harder.The hotel has now been given halal certify, so now they no longer serve pork (eg:Bacon)etc.The staff need to spend time at other true 5star hotels to learn how to treat there guest in a 5star manor! If you wish to stay in a fantastic 5star hotel try the Marina Oriental you won't be disappointed. Stayed for 9 Nights August 2011

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Canboy
Reviews.Content: - Paid SGD200 a night without breakfast - NO free internet - Room size was ok - 2 single beds (literally for single person each bed) - Huge LCD TV in the room - With walk out balcony - Attached to Marina Square Mall - Good size bathroom but the shower area was small - Good size pool and well equipped gym - A short walk to subway station but long walk from station to train

Reviews.Title: “Amazing looking hotel inside”
Reviews.Author: chrismartinuk
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our last night of a three week trip in Asia. Our flight had been delayed and we were unsure about what to expect as the review for the hotel aren't amazing. As soon as we walked through the entrance, we were impressed. It was about 6pm and cheekily asked the reception if a free upgrade was available... and amazingly, it was! We were bumped up to a club room on the 20th floor, which had an amazing view over the marina. The room was huge and had a great bathroom. This made our last night incredibly special. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us advice about good bars where to go to etc. The hotel looked after our bags the next day and we happy for us to use the swimming pool and showers throughout the day after we had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElisabethM28
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet and well located. You can book this hotel with no worries. Is up to the Mandarin standards. The lobby and bar area are beautiful. The pool site is perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service was good”
Reviews.Author: Sandy L
Reviews.Content: Located at one of the prime area, near to shopping area, attraction areas like singapore flyer, merlion park. We planned for Universal Studio, so this location is relatively near too. Though the hotel is relatively old, but cleanliness is maintained & rooms are well maintained. Overall, good hotel valued for the price we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaGalway
Reviews.Content: So near everything,next door to a shopping mall with cinema and bowling alley, near underground stn, bit of a walk. A lot of the websites give prices without the extra Singapore taxes, I was fully aware of this and had budgeted accordingly, lovely hotel, newspaper each day, clean spacious rooms, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: siglo
Reviews.Content: After putting me in a room next to drilling and hammering all day long until 830pm and the smell of cigarette smoke in a non-smoking room, what can I say that's positive? Nothing. Rooms badly need refurbishment. Front desk service is below average And when you hear the same recorded sounds of birds twittering in the atrium which you heard 10 years ago, you know it's past "sell by" date This is one place to avoid

Reviews.Title: “Nice - if you choose to use Emeritus club facilities”
Reviews.Author: torbenDenmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marina Mandarin for 4 days in August during an IT-seminar. My wife joined me and we opted for an Emeritus club room - at the 21st floor. Great room, great views and very nice club facilities at the same floor. We chose to book the club room due to other reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. However the rate was rather high, 480 SGD per night. Normally it would have been even higher so I will probably not stay there next time in SGP. The reception was a bit of a mess. It is promised by the hotel that club members sign in at a special desk. However it took us a lot of time before this option was offered to us. So the staff probably needs a bit of more training ...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: aizaz_27
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin is a very good hotel. We got our booking through the internet and got a family room at a very reasonable rate for 2 nights. Though we could not get the bay view room, the city view was nonetheless entertaining. However the balcony was too small, just enough room for standing. The service was good. The Room had a comfortable feel and the bath room was also good. The check-in and check-out were also good. Close proximity to the nearby marina mart and subway gives it an additional plus. And a short walk away is the beautiful Marina Bay. However, I would not rate my stay as five-star, cuz the over-all feel of the hotel is a bit dated. I think they should hire some interior decorators to modernize their look and put some oomph factor, that special personal touch, the guests should receive, rather being received by dreary workers. One more suggestion, they should also employ some outstanding door men to give it some glitz. And there should be light back ground music like Dr Zhivago's score, Beethoven and the work of other greats to keep the people entertained through out their stay. Too Much of quiet sometimes is not too appealing to some. However some may welcome it. To the flip side, in the evenings, the live singing and piano performances in the lobby could at time be jarring for people living at level 5-8. Overall a Very Good Experience but not Outstanding :)

Reviews.Title: “Completely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: RonDunn
Reviews.Content: My one night stay at Marina Mandarin was a completely satisfying experience. Check-in and check-out were handled smoothly and efficiently. In fact, I walked from checkout at this hotel to reception at the nearby Ritz Carlton for a business meeting, and found that hotel to be in a state of check-out chaos. Big tick to Marina Mandarin! My room was very well furnished, especially for a business traveller, with a usable desk and chair. A large screen television was in place with a good selection of local and cable channels. The refrigerator was silent. The bathroom was clean and modern, and well equipped. In fact, both the bathroom and the room in general were considerably larger than many other rooms in which I have stayed in Singapore. My room was on the Beach Road side of the hotel, and there was a little noise intrusion. Oh for the good old days when Singapore actively discouraged motorcycles. I think it is time the local police spent some time calming the night-time boy racers in the Suntec/Beach Road area.
