As noted in other reviews, the hotel is very well situated with a large shopping complex downstairs, and the Singapore Exhibition and Conference Center directly across the road. I'll definitely return to this hotel during future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in CBD”
Reviews.Author: TomekWu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Marina Mandarin Hotel with 2 friends during last journey to Asia. We had a double room with an extra bad - be careful: they do not charge for the extra bed during booking and don't even inform about additional costs, but you'll have to pay for it! Rooms are OK, very comfy beds, big bathrooms. Breakfast overpriced, what is common in SIN. Great pool area. Amazing lobby. Fantastic location close to everything, MRT station is just round the corner. Absolutely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Need improvement ...”
Reviews.Author: LightWeaver
Reviews.Content: My family got 2 rooms at the Marina Mandarin for the National Day Fireworks display. I last stayed at the Marina Mandarin about 7 years ago and the hotel room seems much more tired during this stay. The hotel has renovated the rooms as you can see on the hotel website. However, you will notice that the room wall and ceiling paint are beginning to peel. The room also had a moldy carpet smell. The room air-conditioning needs upgrading because the thermostat allows you to control the temperature and not the fan speed. As a result, one of the rooms had a stronger air flow than the other. The hotel staff seems to be flustered as the hotel was running at almost full occupancy due to the fireworks display. Check-in was slow and the restaurant manager getting a table for us during breakfast was impatient when we asked for a single table indoors. Lastly, this observation pertains more to the guest than hotel. The fireworks display was at 7:45pm and this coincided with dinner time. Some of the guests had bought takeaway food from the Marina shopping centre and ate in their room. Unfortunately, some guests had tied their leftovers in plastic bags and left them outside their room or at the lift lobby. Perhaps the hotel can remind the guests to contact housekeeping to clear their bins? The food left outside the rooms can be unsightly, smell and cause a hygiene problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tedzski
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is situated in a very strategic area. The MRT station is just minutes away. There are access to Marina Square shopping mall from the hotel and then it provide access to City Link Mall which has various shops and restaurants. Merlion Park is within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel lobby and reception are just fabulous. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. However, there was a slight problem with the toilet in the room that I stayed. There was always uncomfortable odor from the toilet and we called three times but no successful action was taken. It took away a bit of the excellent feeling that we all felt when we start staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the cold concrete metropolis which is Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyTST
Reviews.Content: Was at first apprehensive abt the booking when many said there are nicer n fancier hotels in the Marina Bay area... No fear at all! From the time the airport transfer ladies greeted us 4, we were awed by their sweetest of demeanours and desire to please. The awesome greetings continued to the arrival lobby where no less than 7 people said welcome to us!! Then the real lobby at level 4 where the elegant cavernous atrium was fled by a sophisticated selection of tunes from the pianist playing on a lighted platform!... Beathtaking! The same joy we had on the same day stayed with us thru the 5 nights we stayed there... The view of Marina bay and the silhouette of the cityscape of Spore, the mineral water swimming pool( no gimmick!! Ultra clean n fresh!!), the immediate covered links to 4 shopping malls and food courts.. Almost a km in diameter..., a guy called Ravi, who bent backwards to make sure my 18 and 19 yr old sons had the time of their lives while we did our shopping, my husband did all his business at the executive lounge (we weren't even on the club floor!), and he organised us to see all of the Real Singapore!!.. Not just Orchard Road and Sentosa, people!!! Anyway... Giant thanks to Marina Mandarin and an elegant GM who introduced himself to us as Kurt Wehinger... It was the grand finale to our 3 week Asian adventure from Europe!!!

Reviews.Title: “National Day in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nsingapore
Reviews.Content: Booked in to the Marina Mandarin as a very last minute decision. Singapore National Day was celebrated August 9th and I had heard many people say the parade and the fireworks are spectacular. Marina Mandarin had a Fireworks Special package so we booked. Our arrival to the hotel was extremely pleasant, staff were very friendly, check in was great, the gentleman who served us went through all the details of the package, free internet for the duration of our stay, free parking for both days, a late check out of 3 pm. Our room was ready even though we were 2 hours before official check in which was great The room was amazing, a fantastic view over marina bay and all the festivities. We had a balcony that we could go out on making our view even more spectacular. The rooms have been refurbished with a more modern feel. The bathroom is very spacious and a cool design. It did lack a few amenities, like a sewing kit, which was of course needed when one was not there. There was very little local information in the room also. I like when hotels provide magazines in the room. We had an amazing time, and the food was excellent also. Over priced I thought at the pool but then I guess most hotels do over charge at the pool. The pool is great, very clean and pool towels are supplied. Our checkout experience was not as great however, We got charged for internet use, apparently it was free for only 12 hours per day. Also the Valet parking of the car was not free either, it is free if we parked in the car park ourselves. No one told us that. They also checked us out of our room at 2 pm and not 3 pm as advised. They did allow us to stay until 3 however again another mis communication. Now the charges for the internet and parking were not high and this is not my issue, my issue is the mis communication of information and than the lack of understanding when we question it. So over all its a shame that a wonderful stay in a beautiful hotel left a bad taste in our mouths as we drove our car out of the hotel driveway. Oh and the fireworks, they were awesome. so if you happen to be in Singapore for National Day, I highly recommend you hang around for the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel but Reasonably Priced!”
Reviews.Author: pinoy_fahrer
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late reviews but i was hoping to share our experiences during our stay in this hotel. We might again go back to Singapore this November and still stay at Marina Mandarin (if the price is still reasonable) ... Myself, my wife and my son went to Singapore coz our son participated in the Anime Fest Asia 2010 at Suntec Convention Center which i think they will again get this venue for this year's festival. I scouted for the best but reasonable priced hotel near the venue. I started to go online and browse every now and then the rates of hotels in their respective websites and also in online travel agencies ... every day i go online, checking room rates and promos ... but i ended up buying directly thru the website of Marina Mandarin because it is the lowest rate during that day that i decided to purchase. So I ADVISE YOU to be patient in getting the best possible rates. We arrived there before noon but then there are no rooms yet available for us so we stayed and bought some drinks and pastries at lobby bar of the hotel. Good food and healthy drinks, a little bit pricey but reasonable. Because of non-availability of rooms yet, they apologized and we were ushered first to their business center so we can relax, watch TV and read newspapers. and maybe because we waited for more than three hours, we were upgraded to the next level of rooms - premium rooms. The room that we stayed is directly facing the Marina Sands Hotel and Convention Center, thus, i have all the time and the view to click my new Nikon D5000 all throughout the day. The night view is very spectacular! SO I ADVISE YOU to get rooms with the view of The Sands. Although we did not avail of the food or eat at the hotel restaurants during our stay, there are so many restaurants at the Marina Square Mall just adjacent to the hotel, and one can enter the mall without going outside the hotel first coz they have a 'secret' door to the mall. Infront of the mall is the Suntec Convention Center where restos and shops abound. The biggest fountain in the world (?) is also in this area. I prefer this hotel because it is not within the city center but shops and scenes are within reach ...

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: gollyoz
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay and convenient location close to Suntec Convention Centre and linked to shopping malls. Room was good size and pleasant view from floor 18. Staff at check in effiecient but keen to sell me a breakfast deal as I was room only. I tried breakfast once but nothing like as much range and quality as the Mandarin Oriental right next door. So my tip is to take a short walk for an outstanding breakfast at the Oriental. My other issue was internet access which was expensive for Singapore and so slow it made doing some work difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: FrankDLaw
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we checked into the Marina Mandarin with some trepidation. However, from the get-go, it was a pleasant experience. The Desk clerk was extremely polite and upgraded us to a Club Room on the 2nd highest floor. What a view! Contrary to other reviews, we found the room to be extremely well-appointed! There was an espresso machine in the room with a selection of genuine espresso capsules. This is the first hotel that we've stayed in that had an in-room espresso machine and we've traveled extensively to more than 180 cities worldwide! The room was tastefully furnished and had a long bath as well as a multi-jet shower stall. I enjoyed the hot multi-jets of water after a long day shopping although the pressure was so high that the drainage could not cope with the massive output of water - the water sipped out of the shower stall and we had soggy floor mats, which was promptly replaced the next morning! Service was good but we were denied free internet which was a bummer. In this day and age, one would think that such facilities would have been gratis, especially in Asia! Compared to the hotels in Europe and the US of A, this hotel though, would take some beating if we factor in the great room rates!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - food - ambience!”
Reviews.Author: elzyech
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Great service and high quality staff. Great breakfast - great restaurant - great room - everything great! highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and world class hotel”
Reviews.Author: yssunil
Reviews.Content: * Absolutely city centre. At rafflle's avenue. The place to be * Breathtaking views from rooms - Merlion, Flyer, Marina Bay sands, the lake etc * Amazing buffet - variety of cuisines to choose from * Courteous staff - Not even a single instance of mis behaviour * High speed internet * Spacious rooms and bathrooms * TV Channels were boring * Clarity of reception was bad * Rooms cleaned once in 2 days

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but definitely not the best in the area”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLikeBernie
Reviews.Content: Good: Clean. Excellent location if you are working near Suntec. Easy to get to the metro. Restaurants are decent. Nice architecture and design. Really feels like a 5 star hotel in the lobby. Near Starbucks. Cheaper than Raffles or the Fullerton, actually one of the less expensive hotels in the area. Bad: Concierge is uninformed. You request a good restaurant to go to and they give you a chain from a book of suggestions. Rooms are small and cramped, feels more like a business hotel than a hotel you'd go to for either/or. Food is extremely expensive but of average quality at the restaurants. I liked the Asian restaurant but not for what I paid for it. Overall: Stay at Mandarin Oriental/Conrad Hilton if priced similarly, and if you are splurging, go with Raffles or the Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “Pales in comparison”
Reviews.Author: Roberto275
Reviews.Content: when put alongside the ranks of mandarin oriental, ritz carlton, conrad and other hotels in the same district. large lounge area and good for a drink but somehow seem a tad too dimly lit and there is a sense of an aging building. not my first choice but guess it is a function of how much you pay

Reviews.Title: “Old lady”
Reviews.Author: Scheni
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a spectacular lobby and it's right in the center of the action. We had a room with a view to the new Sands hotel and that was a treat. The rooms are ok but a bit tired. If you can make sure you stay at the Club level, you can have a high quality breakfast and delicious food and drink at 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit but very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Paolo19661
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Marina Mandarin and our first in January 2010 had been a positive experience. Our disappointment began at check in which took 20 minutes and there was no queuing system so it was a free for all. We eventually got to our room only to find that we had been given a smoking room when we had specifically requested a non-smoking. We then had to return to reception and wait another 25 minutes for the mistake to be corrected. Although they admitted their mistake and apologized, no effort was made to placate us even though we had by now wasted the first hour of our vacation when we were already very tired. The rooms themselves are nice but the bathrooms are tired and there are quite a few midges that live in them. The public areas of the hotel are well presented but the open plan design means that you will be kept up by the resident singer until the early hours of the morning. The pool area is very nice, particularly if you have kids but there is no-one serving drinks in the the evening at the pool bar. The gym is well equipped. The location is good for shopping but not great for the MRT. Buses can be caught from the Esplanade though.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Located over a shopping mall and 7 minute walk to Merlion.”
Reviews.Author: TNJP_Explorer
Reviews.Content: Hotel feels a bit dated (but has plasma tv....with bad reception) Elevators are not very efficient and shower stall is too small. Balcony is good but no furniture to be able to stay out and enjoy it. Lobby on 4th floor, a bit awkward to use. Breakfast buffet is below average..not great selection. Location is not bad. Just two minutes to the waters edge (through the mall) about 10 minutes to the river area (Boat Quay, many places to eat and drink).

Reviews.Title: “We came back and enjoyed it again!”
Reviews.Author: Calypso2
Reviews.Content: Oue second visit to this wonderful hotel, great loaction on Marina Square for shops and restaurants adjacent to the Esplanade on Marina Bay where it's all happening, walkable to the Marina Bay Sands and maginifcent Sky Park, Marina Bay Shoppes and the Art and Science Museum. Rooms great as was the breakfast, which are 2 reasons we came back to this hotel, and the pool area is certainly one of the best in central Singapore.Only draw back is cost of drinks in the Atrium Lounge, though they are trying to offer Happy Hour Specials. What a spectacular and ever changing city Singapore is, everything is done so well, service wherever we went was always great, other tourist city pretenders in the world please take note. Thank you Marina Mandarin and Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for acces to city attractions”
Reviews.Author: alanmoore1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, would not call it 5 star but it was nice. The architecture of the building is really interesting and all the rooms have a balcony. Best thing however was the close proximity of all the local attractions! Raffles is literally round the corner with a shopping mall filled with places to eat etc attached to the hotel by some stairs through the main lobby!! If your looking convenience then this is the place for you :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fine business hotel - well-located”
Reviews.Author: Werckmeister
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin is a perfectly acceptable business hotel - clean, decent-sized room, a large selection for breakfast, and decent service. Location is also quite good - it's connected to the malls and the opposite Suntec. But the entrance to the mall is rather weird and finding one's way was at times not easy. Overall a pleasant, if unremarkable, stay. But the excellent view from the room helps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: anindyasen
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here with my wife & daughter & it was one of the most wonderful stay in a hotel for us. The hotel is situated opposite the Suntec Exhibition & Convention Center & just beside a MRT Station & the Marina Mall. The rooms were large with a balcony & the washroom was almost half the size of the room with a separate shower enclosure & a bath tub. The rooms were done up very well & you could easily see that these guys knew how to keep their guests comfortable. The service was excellent & the behavior of the hotel staff was the very best that you can expect anywhere in the world. Infact the only problem that I personally felt was that both my wife & daughter felt so comfortable staying here that they did not want to get out to see the city & I really had to coax them to get out of the room!! The location of the hotel is also very good & you can walk down to Esplanade & further down to see the Marina Bay or walk a little further down to the place where the Merlion is kept (good for a photo op). The only drawback if I may say so was their breakfast services was costly & felt that should be made more reasonable. However, if I am to rate this hotel, it has to be a FIVE STAR in every respect. They are just too good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in SEA”
Reviews.Author: MilanAndrea
Reviews.Content: My secretary booked me three nights at the hotel. Arrived at 0:25, they gave me a smoking room without asking for. The room smelled really bad and was really noisy. I went down to the reception to ask for another room, no room available. Fine I can bear one night, but they assured me I would have been moved to a non smoking room the morning after. I leave to go to the office (btw the breakfast is more like an airport lounge type of food than a 5 star hotel). I come back late in the night. I expected to be moved to a new room, so I go to the reception to ask my new room number. They didn’t do the move for me. I asked for the room, 10 min and the room pop up. Fine, I’ll go in my room, take my stuffs and go to the new room. Honestly in a 5 star hotel I expected my stuff to be already moved to a new room and be all at their place. I open the door of a new room and a Chinese lady yelling at me. She was just moved to the same room. She also refuses to call reception to have someone to help me. I pack in the corridor, I went down to the reception (I forgot, the elevators are the slowest I’ve ever seen in a hotel), and I say to the guy at the desk. I’ve enough and to book me a room at Conrad. I didn’t do, so I called on my self, ask the bill and moved there. They tried to charge me the second night (the one I was battling for), I looked at him and complain again. I took off one night. I moved to Conrad and had a good night of sleep. Still asking myself how a hotel in Singapore Marina can be so bad.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad & the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveller33433
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: Decent sized room & bathroom. Concierge ARIS was very friendly, enthusiastic & helpful. The BAD & the UGLY: Unresponsive, nonchalant front & managerial staff. Unwilling to add an hour extra to checkout extension which would have been so very helpful. Caters to mass, business clientele & doesn't care about individual attentiveness. Cramped, small shower stall. From reading internet, thought it was in same class as Conrad Hotel...definitely not, from contact with locals & my experience. Conrad is in similar location & can be priced very similarly. TIP: I booked thru hotel website, though 3rd party website price was better, thinking service would be better.... NOT true. Don't bother with this...just get the best available price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with Fantastic View and Great for Retail Therapy”
Reviews.Author: LeeTina
Reviews.Content: tayed a night in this hotel and overall is great except for the air conditioning which we have set to max coolness and is still warm to us. Amenities provided but strangely no shaver for the guy. The view from our room great which faces Marina Bay Sand. Hotel is link to Marina Square Shopping Mall and great choices restaurants and cafe. A short walk away is SunTec for more retail therapy. To do your check-in the reception is on the 4th Level. For late dinner/supper there is this outdoor food place "Makansutra? which serves local food . Short walk from the hotel and their friendly concierge would be able to show the direction. Food is of average in taste, a little higher in price compare to some others. May try for the experience. Is rather humid so wear comfortable clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: GuptaDebjani
Reviews.Content: Marina Mandarin is the preferred hotel due to its proximity to Suntec Towers where our office is located. Have stayed there quite often, however, this time round I felt that the rooms were starting to look tierd. The bathtub in my room was chipped and the rubber padding in the shower cubical door was also not quite firm. The service as usual was excellent and the breakfast served was as good as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: JetAceLogan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. The location is great. In walking distance from the center and a subway station is just around the corner. Connected to three large shopping malls via underground passageways. Service was great, room was large, clean and nice. Paid extra 30 s$ per night for a harbor view room upon arrival and it was worth it. A great hotel if you're on business but still a basic huge five star chain hotel with not much personality. If you are on a holiday and want something more personal go for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Compares Well With Other 4-5 Star Hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Mupple
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Singapore, usually just a few nights at a time, I've tried most of the 4-5 star hotels here over past few years. Marina Manadarin measures up well, even if this time was just a 1 night stay with little chance to sample the facilities. The soaring atrium style of the hotel is to me a great draw, gives a nice ambience to it. The hotel has been around a few years, not that anything looks worn though. Service was fast, efficient and friendly. Rooms were reasonably sized if not large, perhaps some of the newer or recently refurbished hotels may have an edge here. Very large breakfast spread, plenty of choice. I'd stay here again, hope a bit longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but far from Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_w_kids_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel just for 2 nights on a business trip. I got what I think was an upgrade to my room, since I had a provate balcony. The room was lovely and of high quality. The hotel break fast was OK, but not as good as insome other Singapore hotels (not as good a selection of fresh fruits).

Reviews.Title: “Old time classic”
Reviews.Author: AhHwee
Reviews.Content: I and my wife checked in here over the weekend as part of my celebration for my wife's birthday. I reached there pretty early at about 11am. As expected, the service person at the counter allowed me into the room without any question. Upon knowing the purpose of our stay, the person at the counter arranged for a birthday cake to be delivered to our room - courtesy of the hotel. On top of that, he also granted a late checkout time at 2pm. My wife and me were of course thrilled. We spent the rest of the day in the room and shopping in the vicinity. We also had a pretty good time at the pool, which was quite different from the normal ones - there seems to be minimal chlorine in it. We were later told that the water was that of mineral water. In terms of location, this hotel was good - near to some major shopping areas, though a bit of distance to Orchard road. Service wise, we cannot find any major shortcoming. Just one thing which I feel needs to be improved - the pay TV. They have some in-house "Adult movies" for viewing at $19++ per show. I actually chose one of it and to my horror after selecting, I realised that it was a very outdated, 1970s, possibly 1960s production. Moreover, the contents in it can hardly be classified as "Adult" in today's context. I switched off the TV after 15 minutes. It was a big turnoff. And yes, I was asked to pay for it when I checked out. Perhaps something should be done to this. If this is free, nothing to say. But to pay almost $20 for an old and uninteresting movie, it is a waste of time, let alone money! If not for the movie experience, I would have rated the hotel as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A long awaited visit to family”
Reviews.Author: the_taffs
Reviews.Content: Well situated, lovely hotel. Extremely friendly, helpful staff. Excellent accommodation and facilities. It made a visit to family extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, I'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: ChangOne
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel for business trip. Very nice location. The connection to the Marina Square mall at the 3rd floor is so convenient, you don't have to go outdoor to do shopping or catching the train. Also it is close to the Clarke Quay and Boat Quay, walking distance. Breakfast is great and room service is prompt. I will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love to come back”
Reviews.Author: FebrynaW
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the Marina which was wonderful. Very nice decor and comfortable beds. Love the bathroom. It is connected to a mall and the City Hall MRT which was very convenient. Staff friendly. Everything is within a walking distance. Have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love coming back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: ainosIndia
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel, blend of oriental and modern, its always great to be back at the Marina Mandarin, Singapore. The rooms just keep on getting better and better, the views of the Marina Bay are breathtaking, the lavish buffets and celebrations during festivals are outstanding. Celebrated our new year's eve at the party thrown by the hoteland it has been the best of our new year's eve so far .Would not at all mind going back again to get pampered by the excellent hotel staff. Also the spa services are not to be missed. A little heavy on your wallet but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: KylieH88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I researched for weeks trying to find the best high star and well recommended hotel in Singapore for our 7 day trip away, I can honestly say I'm extraordinarily glad we chose the Marina Mandarin!! From the first moment where the porters relieved us of our luggage, to the ease of check in with the friendly, polite and flexible staff (and we did test the poor lady, requesting upgrades,daily breakfast, earlier check in and late check out!) we knew we were in excellent and capable hands. We were in a Premier room on the 19th floor and the view of the Marina Bay Sands and the bay we were given was breathtaking. Our bathroom was pristine white and modern with separate shower AND combined shower/bath. The room itself was spotless, comfortable and had charming decor, the bed was large and comfortable. The room service staff were practically on first name basis with us through our time stayed as we ordered food and dessert once or twice, chose contour pillows off the pillow menu and requested ice and internet codes almost daily. Not once did we find a cause to complain and it was never too much trouble for any of the staff. The highlight of our stay in the hotel was definitely the 3rd night in. It was my Partner Tims birthday and i'd taken him out for a dinner on the Singapore Flyer. Concierge (Arjay i believe the name was?) had eagerly helped me arrange a limo taxi to chauffeur us there and back. When we returned around 9pm at night we'd found that the room had been freshened again AND a beautiful birthday cake had been left for Tim with a candle. I was taken aback with how thoughtful and kind that small gesture was and it really hit home just how high the quality of the hotel we were staying in was. Other highlights of our stay include: -The daily buffet breakfast (i was dubious at first considering it was $30SGD a day p/p, but even now a fortnight later my mouth waters over the plentiful offerings and I can say it was worth every penny) -Ease of getting taxis (our longest wait was around 3 minutes) -Excellent location -Amazing Day Spa -Sound of live birds singing throughout the atrium-couldn't ask for a better wake up call! Im struggling to find a negative thing to say about the Marina Mandarin Singapore. Maybe the wait of the elevators to your room? Or that one day that we didnt have our soap replaced? Which goes to show that if they are the only petty things I can pull them up on, it's well worth anyone making the decision to stay there. The first thing I find myself saying when people ask me how Singapore was, is how fabulous our hotel was and how much i'm looking forward to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel, 5 star food, 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: IONM
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin in Singapore: Very nice hotel, very nice room, very polite staff, but completely useless as far as resolving problems. We actually had a full size german cockroach in our room and which I trapped to show the staff, when I called downstairs all I got was a "I'm sorry sir, I'll send someone up" So they sent a young boy with a can of bug spray to my room who sprayed the roach I trapped and started spraying around the rest of the bathroom. He was going to spray around the bedroom too but I didnt feel like sleeping with bug spray. I told him the room needed to be cleaned thoroughly the next morning. I had trapped the cockroach in a drinking glass and made note of the glass's distinguishing features, and sure enough when the room was tidied up, the same glass was there on the sink. I don't expect miracles but at the very least a change in rooms after A) I catch a roach in my room and B) someone starts spraying poisonous fumes in my room. All I could get from the 5 star staff was "I'm sorry sir." Other than that we enjoyed our time in Singapore, but I do plan to write a letter to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shobhitnigam
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks. Prime location, good Chinese food. Almost same breakfast daily. No choice for vegetarians. Spa (Steam/Sauna etc) not included in hotel facilities. If you are from India, and prefer Indian food, you should better stay at Pan Pacific, which is on the other side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I will surely be back”
Reviews.Author: sajjadqadir
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my stay in Singapore mainly based on its rating on TripAdvisor. And it is a unique little gem, really. I have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. Price-wise Marina Mandarin is on par with these better-class hotels but the experience was awesome. I’m sure I will still fondly remember the stay I had there.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tiffanytan80
Reviews.Content: This isn't the first time we've stayed at the hotel. We usually come every year to celebrate birthdays or anniversaries. We usually also book the suite to accomodate the two of us and our 2 young children. I've always loved the suite layout. The living area is big and great for the kids. The bedroom has a lovely big fluffy bed. And the espresso machine is a nice touch. We had dinner at the Aquamarine which had the best seafood buffet spread. It had everything from fresh oysters to all sorts of different crab dishes. Usually the front desk service is excellent. Especially since those who book the suites get to checkin separately. This time checkout took a while because no one was at the desk. And the doormen chatted away ignoring us when we stood outside waiting for the valet. And compared to the neighbouring hotels, this one was excellent value for money. And the location is fairly central, with shopping conveniently located next-door.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: The room in the Marina Mandarin are large as is the bathroom, which is modern and modern with a stand-up shower. The king-size bed was comfortable, and the AC worked almost too well, sometimes keeping the room chilly despite the heat and humidity outside (my only problem with the room was that it was somewhat difficult to regulate the temperature- it either seemed too cold or warm, but rarely just right). The balcony was a nice touch, although I rarely used it during my stay. As others have mentioned, the atrium is large, which sometimes meant that the common space in the upper levels stayed warm during the night, but the in-room AC more than cooled the room. Two minor issues kept me from giving the hotel a higher rating: the breakfast was more filling than delicious. Both Western and Asian breakfast was available, but I can't say that is was very good. The gym was also a bit dated, with limited room for exercise that did not involve exercise machines or weights. A decent sized pool looked nice, although not really big enought to swim laps. I was on business, so I cannot comment on the location of the hotel, but it is connected to a large mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, near new singapore attractions”
Reviews.Author: kerlicterus
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby is big and impressive and makes you feel like you were entering the ship in starwars, the rooms were a little worn but clean. Service was good. The good thing about this hotel is the location as there is a connection to the marina mall and it's walking distance to esplanade, marina sands, helix and the singapore flier. With the new marina sands mall nearby you don't really need to go to orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: whitemountainman
Reviews.Content: The building itself is quite stunning with an enormous open interior. Rooms big and well-appointed. Modern and spotless. The breakfast was exceptional and was included. Location is great. Right around the corner from the Merlion. Malls up the Wazoo (this is Singapore after all) and more dining options then you could ever need. Service top notch. Good place.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Dee082
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel while visiting Singapore. This hotel is ok, the public areas like reception, the bar etc are really nice but the rooms are a bit dated, especially the bathrooms, they really are in need of refurbishment. The bathroom is not very inviting, it's one of those bathrooms you want to get in and out of asap, not the type of bathroom where you'd like to take a nice long bath etc. The beds are very comfortable though and the views are nice. If you are doing lots of sightseeing and plan on using the hotel for a bed & shower it's absolutely fine but if you plan on spending some time in the hotel and want some luxury I'd recommend staying somwhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - love the detail”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a Deluxe Room (booked on agoda for AUD$180 incl tax). The price was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel. The lobby is exceptional and it's the first time I've ever seen a lobby like this (not that I stay at 5 star hotels often!). We were on the 13th floor and had a beautiful view of Marina Bay Sands from the balcony. The birds chirping in the morning and piano music at night was lovely as it echoed through the hotel. It's central to everything so very well located. The bathroom was very spacious with separate shower and bath and two basins. Bed was a bit harder than normal but got used to it after a night. Rooms were very spacious. The pool is gorgeous and there's a nice view from there. Beware, it's 2.5m deep! The gym is very well equipped. Service: could have been better.. we had to ask for water 3 times before it got delivered. Internet was very expensive. They offer you 6 hours for free and then charge you $16SGD for every 6 hour block afterwards. So.. if you're on the internet on and off all day, you're better off paying the daily rate (approx SGD$21).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent / Huge Hotel.... Super value for money”
Reviews.Author: RohitL
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore to attend a conference in Suntec City... Someone suggested Marina Mandarin as a convenient locale. On 1st arriving here, I was amazed at the sheer size of the hotel. The reception on the 4th floor is also an different concept. The room was probably done-up recently and was comfortable. I spent 4 nights here and was very happy only having to walk across through the mall into work. The swimming pool is good, although could have done with a couple of more showers. The breakfast, which was included in my room, was elaborate and a great way to start the day :) All in all... it was great value for money (considering I got a deal through the conference)

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service.”
Reviews.Author: coorparoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice last year, on our trip to the Uk and again on our return, We were travelling with Singapore Airlines and this is one of their stopover hotels. On our first visit we were greeted at the reception by very friendly and curtious staff. I asked if the room was non smoking (as we had had problems previously at another hotel). As the room was not classiefied as non smoking I was assured that there was no problem but if I was concerned I was welcome to see the room first and if I was not happy they would try and move us even though they were heavily booked. The receptionist was very curtious and arranged for us to be taken to the room. We were also accompanied by the Duty Manager. The room was excellent with a great view over the bay and to the new Casino. There was no smell of smoke and very clean. We took the room and our bags were delivered promptly. We were very surprised when an Ioniser was delivered and plugged in the room, just in case we were still concerned about the room. We spent a pleasant night there and left for London the next day. We completed a questionaire that is left and thanked the hotel for the service and that we were very pleased. On arriving in the UK I was surprised to find on my e-mails a reply from the General Manager thanking us for our comments and saying if we ever wanted anything again to let him know. As we had not booked our return hotel we contacted Singapore Stopover and booked this hotel for our return. I took the Manager up on his offer and e-mailed him to say we were returning in a few weeks. As we were arriving from London early in the morning I asked if would be able to book in early, and how much we liked the room we had previously. I had a very quick reply saying he had arranged that for us and also we would be given the same room, I also noticed that he had sent copies to other staff members. On our return in October we arrived at the Hotel at 9am and hoping to be able to get in the room early (which I thought might be an hour or so before normal booking in) we were very grateful to find it had all been arranged and we could go straight to our room. The receptionist said she was sorry but we could not have that same room as we had before as it was booked, but they had moved us up to the executive floor in an identical room and position in the hotel. How lovely it was to be able to collapse straight into bed and have 4hrs sleep to recover from a tiring flight. We spent another very enjoable stay in this hotel and found all the staff attentive and very helpful. This Hotel is situated in a lovely area overlooking Marina Bay with the Merlion and the new Casino and plenty of places to eat. On the lower leval below the Hotel is a very nice shopping centre with a wide selection of shopping available if you want it. The Hotel itself has a good range of restaurants and a lovely swimming pool, all you need for a very relaxing stay. As we were with Singapore Stopover we are taken to the Hotel and returned to the airport. Another bonus we found is that even though we were leaving late in the evening way after booking out you can leave your baggage there securely in the Hotel and collect it just before you are picked up. Really great if as with us you want to explore Singapore without having to trail cases behnd you. We will certainly return to this Hotel when we are next in Singapore and thank the Genaral Manager and his staff for making our stay very pleasurable. as I said Service, Service, Service

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Lulubelle75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Meritus Club room (modern, very clean and comfortable) for a night only - wished our stay had been longer. Had a personalised check-in on the 21st floor. Despite checking-in early our room was ready and they even gave us one that had a fantastic view of Marina Bay Sands. Upon finding out that our flight was only at 10pm the next evening, they extended our check-out till 6pm and even allowed us access to the club lounge (evening canapes + cocktails, etc.) right up to the time we had to get to the airport. Information and assistance was always provided professionally. Now, that is what I call service! (Thank you, Cassendra!) Security is good - security personnel are stationed discreetly around the hotel. I tried to enter my room whilst housekeeping was doing its nightly turndown service and the lady made sure my room entry card was valid and that I wasn't just any Tom, Dick or Harry up to no good. Staying at the Meritus Club accords one host of privileges including free Wi-Fi (though for one device only) as well as access to the Meritus Club Lounge for breakfast, evening cocktails and all day snacks and refreshments. Unfortunately we were misinformed by one of the staff that the breakfast buffet spread was better and much more varied downstairs at Aquamarine - this is where the hotel loses one point off its rating. I've had much better breakfasts at both the Pan Pacific and Hilton Singapore. Needless to say we didn't enjoy our breakfast, and when we went up to check out what was available at the Club lounge, we found that the quality of breakfast was much better, although less choice - there were however some items served that were not available at Aquamarine. The location can't be beat. Just a few steps away from the lobby and one is in Marina Square. Everything is interlinked, no need to walk under the hot sun or in the rain. City Hall MRT, Suntec City, Citylink Mall, Esplanade Mall, etc., and even my favourite German restaurant in Singapore - Paulaner Brauhaus - are all within easy walking distance. All in all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: carbostar
Reviews.Content: No more than an average hotel, rooms very poor for the standard purported; black mould sticking doors, quirky bathroom fittings, fixtures furnishings lost in time,

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: We travel to singapore every year and this hotel was really nice. Close to all services, shopping and transport. The hotel has lovely restaurants and bar area. The decor is beautiful and clean. Rooms are a little small but very modern and comfortable. there is a balcony but very noisy as the it faces the large air-conditioning towers of the shopping centre.. Bathroom is clean and NO MOULD. The hotel sits on top or the Marina Bay Suntec shopping centre. There are many eateries in the shopping centre to enjoy Breakfast, lunch and dinner and everything in between. To sum it up we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Lobby”
Reviews.Author: hawardTheHague
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims to have the largets lobby in South east Asia and I can believe that. It has about the same area as a football pitch and towers many storeys above the bars. The buffet dinner is excellent as is the Italian restaurant just off the lobby where the food felt very Italian (no fusion nonsense there).

Reviews.Title: “Dated expensive hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Hang10CA
Reviews.Content: Spent a night on a last minute trip to Singapore at Marina Mandarin. The first room has a strong new paint odor. After I complained they gave me a new room and told me that my room has been upgraded. To my surprise the new room has the same layout but instead of the smell of new paint, I had to deal with cigarette smell since they didn't have any more non-smoking room. I was not impressed with the room. It seems to be too expensive for what you are getting for. I'd rather spend my money at Conrad, located across the street from Marina Mandarin. For about the same price, you will get a much better room and a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Polly018
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was really good, the staff were friendly and helpful, the accommodation was very clean and comfortable, breakfast was buffet style with lots of choice. The only criticism that we had were the shocking drink prices at the hotel bar - we paid just under £20 for a beer and G & T!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Met all requests to a very high standard”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: Jackie and Elizabeth from in house reservations arranged great rate as a last minute requested late check out which was very helpful as re routed around Tokyo, they even upgraded us to the executive floor thank you I called over 10 quality hotels in Singapore in a rush and this was the only one that offered a special rate & the extras required for free Room service was quality was first class close to shopping ect

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MM on business and was happy with what I found. The hotel is well located being about a 10 minute taxi ride from the main Orchard Road shopping area and the business CBD. Unless you spend all of your time in the connected Mall you will need to use taxis or the subway to get out and about, but taxis are plentiful (when its not raining) and cheap in Singapore, so its very easy to get around. The hotel is connected directly to the large Marina Square shopping mall which incorporates all of the shops found in most of the malls in Singapore.The mall also has plenty of eating options ranging from western style casual dining restaurants through to a large food hall that sells the full range of local dishes (in fact there is an up market and basic food hall). There is no supermarket in the mall however there is a 7 Eleven and a very large supermarket can be reached in the adjacent Suntec City mall which is about a 20 minute walk through connected malls. The Marina Square mall also has direct access to the subway (a part of the Suntec City mall) which is about a 10 minute walk, although you never need to go outside into the heat to get there. Alternatively you could also take a 20 minute walk to the City Hall subway located in the Raffles City mall via the CityWalk underground shopping arcade. The hotel itself is large and typcally Singaporian offerring good service and reasonable food. But as with most Singapore hotels they do a far better job at cooking up local dishes than western. I found the quality of room service food adequate at best. The rooms are pretty much as they look on the hotel web site but I didnt think they were as new and fresh as the pictures indicated. But they were of a good size and quality and unlike many comparible hotels, the air conditioning in the room actually worked well. A little warmer out in the hotel atrium but still quite comfortable. My only complaint was that I couldnt get internet access to work and had to head down to Starbucks everyday to get connected. No-one in the hotel appeared to know how to help, so glad I didnt pre purchase the internet. But overall the hotel offers a very good cheaper option to places like the Pan Pacific and Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hygiene wise”
Reviews.Author: Zhang2011
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was filthy and walls and crevices covered in black mold I was afraid to inhale while showering lest I pick up some fungal airborne lung disease. If room change is still disappointing might move hotels. Can get much better for same price we know as we visit Singapore often.

Reviews.Title: “service is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Janicehu
Reviews.Content: Service is pretty good Room is clean but not designed well The bar at the 1st floor is nice Good jazz performance at night

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a little outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I've been a guest at the hotel in March 2011 for a short business trip and I can summarize my experience through the below points: 1- Hotel: Marina Mandarin is definitely a great hotel, it is huge in size and this get clear once you step at floor 4 where the lobby is located. Hundreds of rooms located all around you in a fabulous atrium design. 4 panoramic elevators located in the center of the atrium takes you to your floor and an an additional 2 or 3 minutes walk is required to reach the room. the view from the inner atrium floor balconies is really nice when you look downward. You automatically notice the colored design of the magnificent reception area.You won;t notice that as you would be standing on it, you have to go up. One very negative thing about all this is the heat. Temperature is very high throughout the hotel common spaces and you literally sweat while going from your room to the lobby. At the end of the journey you just run to the indoor space where breakfast is served because you can't take the heat or even the humidity. 2- Location The hotel is definitely located at a great location at the Marina in Singapore. It is just a short walk away from the Marina Bay Sands one of the best locations around Singapore. At the Marina Bay Sands, you can find the huge brands mall from Prada to Louis Vuitton. even if you are not a buyer, you can definitely enjoy that luxurious place from window shopping to a stop at one of the great restaurants on menu. All of you gambling lovers, make sure you hit the casino just a short walk away fro some really nice fun. Entrance is free for all foreigners upon showing your passport. Just 30 sec away on foot to the East of the hotel you will find the Marina Square mall. a great place to shop all brands you can expect.. The west side is filled with cafes and pubs where one can enjoy the great tastes of south Asian fast food or the soothing drinks of the Irish Pub. 3- Rooms The rooms in the hotel are spacious but old. You can automatically see this through the design of the walls and the colors used: mainly brown, beige and white. Rooms are definitely clean and get cleaned in a great way while on service. I have not noticed any dirt even in the corners or in tight places on or around beds. My view was magnificent on the marina bay sands and the surrounding area. A great way to wake up in the morning looking at that view. But the balconies are tiny and you can barely fit yourself outside. the doors to the balconies have a hook which keeps them locked. Going back into the room, I was surprised to see that my TV remote was completely torn apart and it was held together by pieces of adhesive glues. Rooms and appliances needs update or renewal. 4- Staff Can't comment much on staff as the friendliness which I experienced is a cultural fundamental in the country. Everybody is very friendly and civilized. Everybody smiles to you and greet you even strangers on the street. Our chauffeur from the airport was great in greeting us and showing us around.the staff at the reception were by far better than the best hotels in Europe and the US. Compliments to a great spirit and wonderful faces and smiles you get surrounded with. 5- Price From a price perspective, I was paying SDG 340 for a deluxe room/nigh inclusive of free internet and daily breakfast exclusive of taxes. Not a very reasonable price, but payable taken into consideration that it is a 5 star hotel with great service. The hotel is recommended for short stays and business stays.

Reviews.Title: “excellence”
Reviews.Author: Linna1437
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Marina Mandarin for two nights. Our 1st impressions wear very very positive. The Atrium is absolutely huge with check in on the fourth floor. The staff were very courteous, smart & polite. WE love this hotel very much ..

Reviews.Title: “Let us have 2 cots in the room”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Travelling with 2 young children (1 and 2 years old) and was pleased that they allowed two cots in our room. (we stayed at the Pan Pacific on the way back and the would only allow 1 cot in the room). The pool was great and had a shallow childrens pool which our children loved. As mentioned before this hotel is attached to Marina Square shopping centre and not too far from the MRT. We found the staff to be very helpful with bags and organising transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: fozboz
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Mandarin for two nights whilst on our way to Australia. First impressions were very positive. The Atrium is absolutely huge with check in on the fourth floor. The staff were very courteous, smart & polite. Our room was on the 11th floor and overlooked an amazing structure of a ship on a plinth in the harbour. We were told that this was a casino. The room itself was nice and clean, spacious and airy and the beds comfortable. Breakfast was good. Overall no complaints whatsoever, definately recommended. We also loved Singapore, such a clean friendly City. Had to go to the Long Bar at The Raffles Hotel but not recommended if you are on a budget. 15 English Pounds for a Singapore Sling but the place oozes class.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it on the whole!”
Reviews.Author: lovesusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over the Chinese New Year on our way to Bali. We couldn't fault the rooms or the staff in any way at all and our experience with the Concierge staff was entirely different to that of a previous reviewer. We found them to be extremely helpful and they also checked with us later each time to make sure we had enjoyed their recommendations. The position is ideal for exploring - The Esplanade stops are accesible through the mall and opposite the hotel, ideal for the hop on/off buses. Its close to the Singapore Flyer where lots of tours depart so we found it a good spot. The hotels New Year celebrations got off to a very good start when we ate in the Chinese restaurant -fantastic choices- and, again, the staff were very helpful despite being very, very busy. Our room was very comfortable and had everything, plus a few more bits, that we needed. The accomodation cost for the hotel was just over £300 for the two of us but it was expensive to eat-or drink- in the hotel. We had coffees which cost S$15-very nice coffees but still pretty pricey, cocktails were expensive and, again as per a previous reviewer, the breakfasts very expensive for what they were. There was a good choice of coffeeshops locally though as an alternative. We would book to go there again-don't miss the very relaxing pool area which I think was on the 5th floor- and we would definitely recommend it to others. One other thing - if you are thinking of booking the night safari take into account whether you have been on a safari before or visited really good zoos as it is very tame with one or two of a limited variety of very unthrilling animals. Great if you or your children haven't had much contact with wildlife but otherwise I would give it a miss. If you do go book the optional dinner as it is a very, very good buffet and well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are excellent and location brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Blue10122
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the suite room. It was spacious and very well furnished. The food was good at the breakfast spread. Even for vegetarians the choices were enough and well done. The front desk staff was cooperative. Good location of the hotel. Everything you need is at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Faultless”
Reviews.Author: JohnboyH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 2-night stop-over at the end of January. A very good start began with our taxi driver who was keen to know about our own country and way of life and who gave a very good running commentary on the sites from the airport to the hotel. On arrival, met by very helpful porters and the most charming receptionist who advised that we had been given an executive upgrade. What a start. Got to our room and on entry....wow...what a view of the harbour. Suitcases soon followed. After shower, checked out the hotel facilities which included a huge foyer area with several restaurants and bar. Also checked out pool area, which looked most inviting (but with only approx 1.5 days, never got the chance to use it). Following my spilling red wine all over clothes on the flight from Dubai ( I nodded off with the glass in my hand....what an idiot!) I called housekeeping and gave them jacket and trousers.....it was returned that evening and was absolutely immaculate! We only ate at breakfast in hotel which had quite a variety to choose from to satisfy all tastes and cultures (including curries) and eggs cooked to order. Drinks at the hotel were quite expensive, so apart from first evening, we drank elsewhere (Durty Nellys around the corner is worth a try). There is quite a large shopping mall at the base of the hotel which has a food court and I would certainly recommend the "Hotpot". We arrived fairly late and the owner himself sat us down and explained what and how to eat. Basically we were given a stockpot on a burner with a selection of raw meats, fish and vegetables. The owner helped us and placed the food in the pot to cook at different intervals. It was absolute heaven and reasonably priced. The hotel is a very short walk to the harbour and for the Hop On/Hop On bus tour stop at the Singapore Flyer. Overall, we were well pleased with our choice of hotel , the standard of service and the charming hotel staff and would certainly stay here again. The only (slight) criticism is that our room furnishing and bathroom fittings was a little dated (but absolutely spotless). Other than that we would have awarded top marks.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: mucun
Reviews.Content: spotlessly clean hotel with tastefully done up rooms. rooms not very roomy but well done up. some rooms have amzing views. food is ok and nearby marina is good for food and select shopping! overall pleasant experience but for the time it takes to check in and check out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with poor concierge”
Reviews.Author: couple06
Reviews.Content: Actually we have no complains about the hotel,the room was very clean and comfort with spectacular balcony but it was really a pity that the concierge couldn't give us the correct information about the free shuttle bus from the hotel to rsw. They told us that there weren't any free shuttle bus,but we saw one when we already got into a cab in front of the hotel. the house keeping was also annoying when they knocked our door in the morning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Lock_yan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and well situated for sightseeing and shopping. If possible get a club level room - the extras that come with are well worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Japonicastar
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here as a stopover for two nights but found it a very pleasant, clean and well situated hotel. There is a mall underneath the hotel which is where we went for breakfast as the hotel fare was extremely expensive for what it was. If you head for the mall and leave the hotel that way you will be facing the river and there are plenty of eateries open on a night time with beautiful views. When we visited there was live music being played under a canopy and the weather perfect for sitting and listening. We used the spa in this hotel and enjoyed it very much. The facial was so relaxing I feel asleep several times. This is a lovely hotel, with a nice pool, grand atmosphere and friendly staff. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Listen for the bird song in the morning”
Reviews.Author: Superplus
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed several hours and I telephoned to let the hotel know. When I eventually arrived at 2.30 in the morning the receptionist was fantastic. She had an aura of calm about her which made me feel easier. The room was fabulous as was the bathroom. The hotel rooms are situated on balconies around the main atrium which looks amazing. There is a recording of bird song which was very relaxing. From the hotel there is access directly into Marina Square Shopping Mall. An excellent location, couldn't be better

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel and a nice business stay”
Reviews.Author: Shaymur
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be a very nice place to stay on my business trip. I arrived in the middle of the night and the front desk had me checked in very quickly. The Deluxe hotel room was quiet, spacious and very nice. The breakfast buffet offers many kinds of food and I certainly did not walk away hungry. I did get out and walked around and didn’t find too much of interest but the Raffles Hotel was within easy walking distance. The location was convenient for business and I’d stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay6635
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lush, grand and unique. The staff are friendly and the rooms beautiful. The breakfast buffet was utterly amazing with such a wide range of cusine- all delicious. The facilities are very good with the outdoor pool and and Gym. The birds outside the chinese restaurant on the 4th floor sang and the notes could be heard echoing through the hotel which was nice. The hollowed effect of the hotel was interesting and it was lovely to be able to look down over the all the floors. The drinks are pricey but that is a constant in Singapore all round. We had a wonderful time in Singapore and found it very clean and beautiful- where is could be a concrete jungle the amount of greenary made it feel lovely and well manicured. We really enjoyed Singapore and would happily go back and stay at the Marina Mandarin!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient & good value for Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Wunderlust78
Reviews.Content: Really have nothing bad to say about the Marina Mandarin Singapore & can only really echo what others have already written! The rooms are very nice with comfy beds, good showers etc and the hotel staff extremely attentive & polite as you would expect from this kind of hotel. It therefore (for Singapore anyway!) offers good value for money in our opinion. The atrium looks fantasic, especially at night when looking up from reception & as others have mentioned, one of the hotels biggest plus points is it's location & the fact you can exit from the 4th floor straight into the 1st level of the Marina Square shopping mall with all of its shops & restaurants galore. It is also just a short walk to the marina where the new Marina Bay Sands Skypark is located & also within walking distance of the colonial district & Raffles hotel. We loved Singapore & the Mandarin Marina hotel and cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Bird song - What a beautiful way to start the day”
Reviews.Author: green_grassMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I would stay a Marina Mandarin just to wake there in the morning. At first I thought the hotel was piping the music into our room but later that morning I saw little birds in wooden cages that had been brought in and hung up in the mezzanine - and we heard them in our room on the 21st floor! Wonderful way to start our day.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: darren2712
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in great location, near to casino, shops, restaurants and Raffles Hotel, good transport links. Rooms have small balconies which give a great view of the City. Pool area good. A good central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Nance80
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights before moving out to Hilton (we deliberately booked two hotels in our 5 nights stay in SG). The location is very strategic, it's connected to the shopping mall Marina Square and can be easily accessed from the 4th floor. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. Taxi fares are very reasonable to anywhere since it's basically located in the centre, so trip to Orchard Rd, USS, Night Safari, Airport, Sentosa, etc quite cheap. The bathroom quite spacious. The only downside was they didn't provide complimentary wifi, not even at the lobby. But it's quite fair since cost of internet is very expensive everywhere in SG. Overall, I love this hotel and would love to coming back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: Darghan
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin is situated in a great location in Singapore. Only 15 minutes walk to Raffles and located adjacent to the Marina shopping centre. There are a number of train stations close by, so public transport is easy and inexpensive. The hotel has an amazing foyer which is the full height of the building. Service is fantastic. Although check in isn't until 2 or 3 in the afternoon, we arrived at the hotel at 8:30 am and were given our room immediately. We had also arranged a late check out at 3:00 pm for our day of departure. Our room contained a large size bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom was very large with a full size bath and separate large shower. The toiletries supplied were first class. The pool is on a lower level and quite large and very deep. The hotel is expensive to eat and drink in, but there are plently of restaurants, cafes and bars in the vicinity. The hotel also has a half price happy hour in the early evening. The concierge was extremely helpful with useful advice on what to see and how to get around Singapore. The stay was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A positive experience”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night in February 2010, having made the booking through the airport hotel reservations service for a deluxe room, where the rate was quite good. Upon arriving at the hotel by taxi, it was still necessary to go up by elevator to level 4 to get to the reception area for check-in. The reception area seemed quite large and grand and the attendant was friendly with the right approach and generally the experience was professionally handled. I was upgraded to the next class of room, which was the executive deluxe room. I found the room to be quite modern and not dated at all, as suggested in previous reviews. Firstly, the furniture was new and in good condition. The wardrobe was also new-style and the carpet was also clean. Perhaps the executive deluxe rooms look quite different from the deluxe rooms. The room had a balcony which in my case was reasonably large but there weren’t any places to sit. My room had a nice view over the Suntec area and the other hotels within the area. The room was around medium-size, not the largest room I have stayed in within Singapore but still quite generously proportioned. The room was clean and the bed was also comfortable. The TV was an LCD-type and modern. The bathroom was large with a separate shower and bathtub. It was the only area of the room which could be described as being slightly dated. The granite or stone on the bench was also chipped or else worn. However, it was still maintained in a very clean condition. The toiletries in the bathroom were quite standard and perhaps not the best that could be expected in a hotel of this class. The public areas of the hotel were perhaps slightly dated but this wasn’t an issue for me. The open atrium was appreciated and it contributed to the feeling of spaciousness within the hotel. I was located on quite a high floor, being in an executive deluxe room, so I didn’t experience much noise from the atrium or externally. The location of the hotel was good and convenient, as is often the case in Singapore. There was a large shopping mall connected by a door to the hotel area, which I took advantage of. I thought the Marina Square shopping mall was quite an upmarket one and had a good foodcourt as well. At the time of stay, the MRT stations nearby for the Circle Line weren’t open but I can imagine how they would add to the convenience of the hotel’s location. I had dinner through the room service, which was just the standard burger with fries with a drink and soup. The meal was definitely above-average in quality and not too pricey. I caught a taxi twice from the hotel and the staff helping with that didn’t seem particularly friendly. They didn’t come across as being the most approachable or pleasant in getting me into the taxi car and out. The check-out was a good experience, there was a management member on the reception level who offered to help with my luggage. Overall, the hotel offered quite a satisfying experience. NOTE: You can find videos of the room on my Youtube hotels page located at: http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: bnecpl
Reviews.Content: Excellent Stay & great value for money. Good location. Room was a good size and really well appointed. Ate in both the Chinese & Italian restaurants and both meals were fantastic. The bar has evening entertainment and is relaxing. Hotel sits on top of a good size shopping centre. Really nice swimming pool on a deck. Concierge was very helpful and booked a couple of tours for us and gave good local advise. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “shocked!”
Reviews.Author: magoo29272
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this impressive hotel on the 28 Dec 2010, staying on a family break over new year. Booked a harbour facing room, to see the firewrok display..then got asked to pay an additional $300SGD for the room, as this is what they charged for that particualr room for new years eve..after explaining a few points, they showed the quality of a great hotel and relented, proving customers comfort is more important than money..( I will come back to money later) You want this hotel to succeed on so many different level, but fails miserable on the rooms..the staff were excellent, the hotels impressive reception, bar area and swimming pool....but the rooms let it down. it was like stepping back into the gloomy rooms of the 70's carpet and decor. pillows were like rocks, and uncomfortable. Now back to the money side of things...went to the hotel bar for three pints of Tiger beer..what a rip off, soured the whole experience..$67SGD...now I know why the bar was always empty, along with the restaraunts, told the hotel reception manager that I was dissapointed that the hotel choose to charge so much money for beer, at which point he shrugged his shoulders and said that other hotels charge it, so that makes it alright! if they were to have realisitic prices, the hotel reception and bar area would be buzzing and vibarant, restaurants full and bussling. what a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loacation but showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: adventurous40s
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a three night stop over at the end of December on our way to Cambodia. The location of the hotel is excellent and within easy walking distance of China town, Fort Canning & Raffles but it and the neighbouring hotels Pan Pacific & Mandarin Oriental, are now starting to show their age when compared with the new developments of the Marina Sands resort. - bedroom decor & failing shower seals are evidence of this. Quiet bedrooms & undisturbed sleep which are rare in a large hotel, go some way to address the deficiencies but still leave you asking if there was somewhere better to stay for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Singapore stop over”
Reviews.Author: Soccermad135
Reviews.Content: My family and I Went to Singapore for the stop over special that Singapore airlines offer. We chose this hote because of it's location. When we got there we were quite supprized how fancy and big the hotel is. The reception is amazing with a couple of restaurants next to it. The rooms are a bit small to what I am use to but they were still great and kept very clean. The beds are very comfortable. We had a lovely view of Marina sands but unfortunately it was to hot to sit on the balcony. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Will be back next time for another stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover!”
Reviews.Author: trevorrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin overnight for a stopover on our way to Los Angeles. The location in Marina Bay was great for access to the hop on - hop of bus tours, the Singapore Flyer and also the Metro! Our room was large, well equipped and the bed was ultra comfortable! The decor is a bit dated but we were only in the room for a few hours, so who cared???

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel that was kept spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: clairerose1977
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel with all the luxuries you could want for a stopover in Singapore. It is next door to a large shopping mall and via the mall you can also access the Esplanade MRT station. So, even though it wasn't right in the centre, it was within easy reach of Orchard Road etc. Our only gripe was that our sleep was disturbed by an extremely hard bed and other guests slamming their doors. Minor points but ones that unfortunately left us a little tired for our onward destinations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brenlees
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a Meritus Club Room. First of all walking into this hotel you feel lost, you have no idea where reception is until someone comes to your rescue. Reception is on level 4. Upon checking in at the club we were escorted to a smoking room, disappointing when neither of us smoke, the room stunk, of course we had to ask to be moved. The room we moved to had great views of marina bay. Our room was well equipped, with a lovely Nespresso coffee machine, a small balcony to open the door for fresh air, L’occitane bathroom products. The shower was funky and had all these other water spouts that were like water massage/pressure point things to your body…. Only downside for us was the service in the meritus club, the ladies in there were not friendly at all and it was a struggle to place an order for a drink. English language was also not spoken very well throughout the hotel. Great location attached to a huge shopping centre (marina square) with internal access direct from the hotel. The pool was wonderful as it’s filled with ‘mineral water’ and makes your skin feel great. The rooms were quiet, however they hang birds in cages on level 4 every morning and because of the layout of the hotel, you can hear these from your room and wake to the sounds of these birds every day. Oh and the beds are so so hard, it hurts..

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy6364
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on New Year's eve to view the fireworks show at Marina Bay. We stayed in an executive deluxe room. Bathroom and room was a little dated. We did not get a full view of the Marina Bay, only had a partial view which was disappointing. Had to lean forward at the balcony to get better view and photos of the fireworks which can be dangerous. Buffet breakfast was included in the package but the spread was quite limited. It was noisy in the morning as there were children running about in the corridors and making a rukus. Wonder whether their parents remembered they were in a hotel. Next year, will pick a different hotel for the fireworks show, maybe the one next to it :)

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service - poor English and slow”
Reviews.Author: alestar79
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a early morning flight arriving at Singapore, hence we intentionally booked an additional night stay for two rooms such that we could rest at the hotel in the early morning. When we got to the hotel at 8 am, we were told that only one room was available, and the other room won't be available till 10:30 am. As the checked-out time is 12:00 noon, we were actually paying for 1.5 hours stay at one room at a full day's rate. Also, as we upgraded our room to club level, the hotel staff didn't inform us of the additional benefits such as inclusive breakfast. Hence we didn't get to enjoy the additional benefits that we paid for throughout the entire stay. We only found out when we checked out. Whenever we tried to ask for anything from the hotel, they were slow and didn't understand our request. We originally chose this hotel because of its convenient location, if we could choose again, we would have taken Swissotel for their impeccable service and dedication to customers' delight.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: cajoeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5nights in Marina Mandarin for business and leisure, at first i was hesitated to booked the hotel because of the not so great reviews, but we were pleasantly surprise. We arrive at noon and have prepared to have to wait for our room, but we were immediately given a room with superb view (we did ask for a quiet room, thus given a room in a far corner - very long walk from the elevator - but the view more than make up for it). The location of the hotel is not the easiest to deal with if you don't know your way around Singapore, but if you're there for a leisure or shopping trip, do not worry, as every nearby mrt station is link by shopping malls (though it could be quite a bit of a walk). All in all not a very suitable hotel for elderly as it can be quite a walk everywhere with a lot of stairs. The room is very comfortable though the bed is not the biggest we've ever seen. The bathroom perhaps a bit dated but still very comfortable and very clean. We also ask for several items through the housekeeping and they're always prompt with our request.
