The room service is very hard to get hold of (we tried calling several times and always getting a busy tone - in the end my partner decided to call the operator and problem solved - there's always someone to take our order if we placed it through the operator). The food of course like any 5stars hotel pretty expensive, but not outrageously expensive, and the quality and the size pf the food was very good. All in all, i would recommend this hotel if you have things to do around marina or you know your way around Singapore well. I don't recommend travelling with elderly or people with physical challenges (i did make the mistake quite a few years back by taking my dad here when he injured his knee - boy was he not happy with the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “fair ok”
Reviews.Author: jakrapop
Reviews.Content: we are from thailand first very slow when checking in we wait 15 minute many guest very slow and we have book non smoking room but when come in the room I can smell smoke but the location was ok bathroom very nice room is big staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great service but rooms need improvements”
Reviews.Author: wate49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at marina mandarin for 4 days because i had a meeting there. Overall service staff were very good however the room is quite dated, stains on carpet and i heard noises from outsude the room, be it, cars from the street (even on rhe 11th floor), music from the atrium lounge, the worst was the sound of the party from the room next to mine at six am!! Good thing i had my earphone with me and my wife and my son didnt wake up otherwise that would be my breaking point. the location was good though, youcan walk to the malls nearby and the esplanade mrt is within walking distance. I would consider staying hete again if they promise to do something with the room and noise insulation or the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dustymiller44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, you can walk to Raffles City MRT station via an underground shoppping mall. There is a food court in the attached shopping mall and a very good hawker centre just across the road next to the concert hall. The rooms are a good size and the service is very good. We had a problem on check in as we had been given a smoking room, despite being assured by the receptionist the room was non smoking, but it was sorted immediately. We have stayed in this hotel a few times over the years and always found it to be a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Quality”
Reviews.Author: 7AENG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a long haul stopover.The hotel staff were excellant .The atrium provides a lounge and bar and the food here is generally good and service crisp.Breakfast was up to a good standard.The Italian restaurant also produced a good meal. The room was of a good size and well presented.The bathroom is perhaps a little dated but well proportioned and clean.We faced the road but did not notice excessive traffic noise. As a stopover hotel it ticked all the boxes.There is direct access to a shopping mall and we could see the roof of Raffles Hotel from our balcony.So its a short stroll via the under road walkway to see this landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a long way out”
Reviews.Author: Oldbolter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week on business. Up to 19th floor are standard rooms with 20/21 floor being executive "club". I was on 19th floor so quiet. Room was clean and everything to high order - couldn't really fault it. I note a previous review which was scathing over cleanliness, toiletaries and room service - all were 100% during my stay. Restaurants in hotel were good but expensive (as usual) but there are at least a dozen good restaurants/ eateries within 5 minutes walk. This hotel is good for a business stay (and I will stay again) but if you are sightseeing then i would suggest the sister hotel on Orchard Road is better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marina Mandarin for one night at the tail end of a three week vacation through the far east. The hotel is atrium style, with a large open space in the middle which the rooms circle. There is a small reception/concierge desk on the first floor and the reception desk is ont he fourth. The staff were very nice and helpful and seemed to go out of their way to make sure that our check in was smooth. Since we got in at around 1:00 p.m., our room wasn't ready, so we just opted for a smoking room. The room itself was very large. Again, we paid for a run of the house room via expedia and were wowed with what we got. The room was spacious and very tastefully designed, modern and chic at the same time. There was also a huge balcony. The bathroom was huge with a bathtub and an adjoining shower and his and hers sinks along one huge vanity. Since we only had one day in Singapore, we didn't spend a bunch of time in the hotel, but enjoyed it nonetheless. One of the great perks is that the hotel is linked to the Marina Square Mall. So if you go down one flight of stairs from the fourth floor lobby and go through a side door, voila! You're in the mall. The nearest stop on the MRT is Esplanade and it is a very short walk from there, all underground. In summary, I felt that the Marina Mandarin was an excellent value in a pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Costly hotel with Nasty Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Salbakuta
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY IN THIS HOTEL! The price per night is very expensive, you naturally EXPECT 5-star quality of service but NOT IN THIS HOTEL! The hotel staff from the front desk down to the concierge are downright rude and nasty to all their hotel guests. The rooms are very dirty (full of dust and the carpets smell) the toiletries are incomplete and have to always call housekeeping to replenish, it takes 10 rings before housekeeping answer your call. The room service is lousy, the food came in very late and cold already when I asked the server to re-heat the food, he refused.

Reviews.Title: “Double glazing would help”
Reviews.Author: 4leaf1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the road from the Pan Pacific, where we usually stay, but chose this one for a 15 hour stopover because it was about 15% cheaper. Should have spent the extra cash on Pan Pacific, because this hotel was dated and oh so noisy. Our room fronted the road and when we went to go to sleep, it sounded like our room was on the road itself! The location is great because it joins onto the Marina Square mall and from there you can walk through malls to Raffles Centre. But I'll definitely pay the extra $40 and head over the road next time.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Finendandy
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel built in the 80s and definitely needs a major revamp very soon. Everything was done well in a cookie cutter sort of way and I felt like just one amongst hundreds of other guests. The location is great as you're right in the heart of the Marina Bay area with the financial district a 5 minute cab ride away and a few shopping malls all around (it is also connected to the Marina Square shopping mall). My biggest bugbear was the elevators in the morning. They stopped at almost every floor on the way down (I was on the 17th) but there would never be anyone coming in. I believe the system did not 'reset' when a previous car made a stop but kept the call button on. Overall, a pleasant stay with nothing outstandingly good or bad about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: TandTSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: I had a very good deal (USD 170 per room) - and this is a very reasonable rate for a hotel in the centre of Singapore. I would not be happy had I paid the normal rate, as the hotel is OK but the service is relatively basic. The rooms are OK, the location is also OK. But just OK, on a 4-star level, same as other big chains (Hilton, etc.). So nothing very negative, but nothing very positive to report. I have not tried the restaurants in the hotel as I know a lot of very good restaurants in the city and prefered to go there. Again, if you get a good rate, this might be an option, but do not expect luxury 5-star level.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable but fine”
Reviews.Author: Back_to_Sandringham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marina Mandarin because I was attending a conference at Suntec City next door. From this perspective the location is terrific. It is a large and busy hotel, but overall it is pretty good. The decor is looking a bit 1980s and could do with a refurb at some point soon. I upgraded to the Club Floor, which only cost an additional S$50, which was good value considering that you get two pieces of laundry and free coffees and cocktails. That along amounts to more than S$ a day. The hotel has a nice swimming pool and a small but functional gym. There is internal access to the very large shopping centre next door. The Esplanade harbour-side area is only a 5-minute walk away, and there are plenty of nice restaurants and bars there. Overall there is nothing wrong with this hotel; it just doesn't have any "wow" factor.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly the impossible perfect”
Reviews.Author: beancounter69
Reviews.Content: From arriving to leaving the staff were courteous and helpful. We could not in all fairness single any one out for praise, they all were good. Two exceptions to this would be 1) The piano player in the bar early evening is brilliant, and 2) The porters made a minor gaff in that we sat for half an hour in the lobby in view of them when we were departing, after informing them we were expecting transport to the airport. Only by chance I noticed a man making enquiries and went to have a listen. He was the driver asking for us and the porters were telling him we had already left! (We later found out the driver had been waiting for more than half an hour for us - before we had even collected our luggage from the porters store room from a porter - and he had previously been told we were not there). Another minor grumble was that the wine list in the chinese style restaurant had only about half the wines available (for me the better wines were not available) which is a management issue, not a staff issue as the staff were very apologetic and attentive. The rest of our stay was sublime and very recommendable, with the subdued lighting being very welcome after being outside in the bright sunlight. And the design of the building, even if dated is still very eye catching. An ideal hotel positioned for easy access to many of Singapores attractions. We particularly enjoyed the leisurely stroll through the underground shopping malls to get to Raffles for the traditional Singapore Sling. We cannot comment on value for the hotel as we had paid our travel agen "en bloc" for an Around the World package - some of the drink and food bills were more than expected - but with service like that, what should I expect? We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: toddles18184
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in a great location!! The Marina Mandarin kind of comes accross as an 80's style hotel but i think that that is the worse you could really say about it. Its an atrium style hotel with the atrium housing the lobby, restaurants and a nice but expensive lounge bar. The rooms are big and airy and most have a reasonable view of the city or bay. Housekeeping did a great job ofter replacing towels etc that didnt really need to be replaced. The pool area is nice although not too fancy. My main compalint would be that the restaurants and bar a bit too pricey. However you cant beat the location, it's in easy walking distance of the Singapore FLyer, Mrina Bay sands, Raffles and Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, value and location”
Reviews.Author: jdek270891
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights October/November. We found the room we had requested to meet all of our needs. We had arrived early after a long overnight flight from London via KL and wanted to sleep. We were awoken by the duty manager advising that a leak had been reported and we needed to change rooms. We were upgraded to a Premium room for the duration of our stay for the inconvenience. We had an excellent view from the 16th floor of the Marina and The Marina Bay Sands.The staff were very pleasant and courteous. We did not use any of the restuarants as there are numerous places to eat and drink in Singapore. We though a nice and different touch was the birdsong in the morning. The hotel put 4 or 5 caged birds out and can be heard throughout the hotel. Singapore is a fabulous place to visit, will definitely return and to this hotel (if the price is right)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EllyN_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days for both busines and leisure and was impressed with the room size for deluxe considering my experience with othe Singapore hotels. It was a massive hotel and is located in the hearts of Marina Bay. The hotel is attached to Marina Square and there basically you can walk from one mall/building to the others without going under the sun. Esplanade is just within walking distance as well as MRT station although it can be quite a long walk. Food wise, had breakfast there everyday and it quite dissappointing as they don't rotate the menu that much. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was so-so, so I suggest while you were there, be sure to go out as Singapore has plenty of good restaurants you can choose from. I love the seafood at One Fullerton, it is the one at the corner facing the Merlion, but it is a bit pricey. I don't mind staying there again, as I love the fact that the room is quite spacious and it is at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay, will not return”
Reviews.Author: Pinkynana
Reviews.Content: Our stay is for 4 nights. I am still here in the hotel whilst writing this. Arrival We arrived in a private car at about 10pm with some luggage. There was no doorman nor porter out to help us, we had to unload everything ourselves and drag it through the lobby. It was only then that a Porter finally noticed us and offered assistance. But it was too late,I rejected him as he wasn't there when we needed him most, so we continue to drag everything to the 4th floor reception and to our room. Check in process was quite smooth. Room We were given a corner room with a balcony, the room is ok, the bathroom is quite dated, but clean. It was quite noisy in the morning and afternoon as it is near the exit and maybe the housekeeping storeroom, I can hear the staff talking and the opening and closing of doors. We were very disappointed to find that the TV wasn't working, and two of the sockets on the wall were also not working. It was late and we were tired, so we didn't let them know till the next day. In the morning, we had to move the kettle and the iron to other sockets in order to use it. The position was awkward and very inconvenient. However, when we told them, the problem were fixed and I was happy again. Until this morning when I woke up to no electricity. Something tripped the power overnight. I immediately phoned the service line and they sent a someone immediately to fix it. Internet PLEASE Be careful! They charge per device! Its $20+ per device per 24 hours, which i find quite ridiculous. As we had a few devices, the internet charges came to $88 per day. so that will mean that 4 nights stay, internet will be $352????!!!! We went straight to reception on the 2nd day after realizing this, after much haggling and waiting, they finally decide to give us a discount, but told us firmly. "We are only doing this this stay, not for the next one, you have to pay for everything the next time". Made it sounded like we were begging them... not handled well at all. I don't think there will ever be a next time. On a good note, this hotel has a great location, very central and accessible. It has the MRT nearby , linked to a big shopping mall with lots of shops and restaurants. Even though they did fix the problem every time, it has already left a negative impression on me. These problems shouldn't be there in the first place. I am very disappointed with the service. Lastly, I can't wait to get out of this hotel to check into the next one the day after tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “arrived late at night and put us in a 'smoking room' did not ask for preference, were moved until next lunchtime, poor.”
Reviews.Author: Lindylou1955
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night and had been allocated a room on a Smoking Floor (17th) immediatley requested a move but were not moved until the next lunchtime, spent an awful night in a stinking room. Ruined the stay.. The hotel is otherwise good, clean and the rooms are well appointed, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , convient location”
Reviews.Author: Str1ke
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a convent marina bay location. Rooms are decent sized with small balcony some have nice views from room. Nice large marble bathrooms. Bed was comfortable, WiFI available at $20 per day which I thought was a bit steep. Staff were all helpful and friendly. Hotel is linked to nearby shopping centre and from there you are able to walk to the MRT without going outside which is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: catinthesun
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with some good views – one of our rooms looked on to the water and Marina Sands. Lovely swimming pool. They charge you for WIFI – always find that irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Aussi
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel close to Bay /River area. Staff meet you at door and take you to reception on a higher level. No free internet although that may vary with price paid for room. I gave this feedback to the hotel on checkout and received a reply via email promptly to say this is something they are looking at in future but is a feature of other room types. Nice rooms but very pricey restaurants. Not for the budget concious. Great pool and surrounds to relax in quiet as we had no noisy children/families in this style of hotel. Was able to exchange foreign currency easily at the reception desk, even Norwegian Kroner! Would definately stay here again if wanted to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel with everything”
Reviews.Author: WineloverMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a chill out stopover on the way back from four weeks away in Scotland and Ireland. The hotel is located in a shopping and hotel precinct and like most of Singapore ,convenient to everything. We travelled with friends and I don't think they actually ventured out of the shopping centre attached to the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and the staff efficient. On arrival we had a few drinks at the lobby bar. I think $15 for a beer is a bit steep although at the time I would have paid almost anything. There is not much not to like about the hotel, its position or the staff we encountered. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RamblingMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in March and enjoyed it. Very large hotel, close to City Hall MRT station making it easy to get around. Large shopping mall very nearby (just like anywhere in Singapore I guess). Comfortable stay. Room clean and quiet with nice view of Marina. We had breakfast included as part of the deal, and it was one of the largest buffets I've every seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SwissGlobalTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We had a great price for early booking in this hotel. Therefore, we had a great value for the money, which was absolutely unique for Singapore. I did a lot of research and there was by far no better deal in Singapore than at this hotel. Breakfast was not included and it would have been way overpriced. This was no problem, since there is a Starbucks located in the shopping mall located below the hotel, which is accessible by the stairs close to the lobby. The location and the view give the perfect Singapore experience. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and in fair size.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanshah
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin's service is good and quick. The staff is eager to please. The rooms well appointed, large, and comfortable. Its a large hotel that is well connected through internal walkways to the neighbouring hotels and shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance to many sites”
Reviews.Author: NorthFLJAX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MARINA Mandarin Oriental which is right next door and virtually identical to the Mandarin Oriental. Brace yourself - Singapore is hot year round. I'm from hot and humid FL so I'm used to hot and humid summers. Well, Aingapore has them down to a art year round. So dress appropriately. You'll love these hotel locatio s. You can walk to everything. Be sure to take the Singapore River Cruise which takes off right by the statue of Merlion (a beautiful must see). The river cruise only costs $12USD. You cam ride the famous Singapore Flyer (also walking distance) for about $30 USD. PACK MONEY though for drinks. It costs about $12USD for a beer & $20USD for a glass of red wine. Check out the Raffles Hotel Bput 2 blocks away- worth the "hot" walk. Have a famous and deliciious drink: ten Singapore Sling in the famous and beautiful Long Bar. The mall (4 stories) iz attached to the hotels (both). Follow the signs in the hotels. The staff at both hotels are top notch! I would visit again no doubt. I LOVED MY TRIP TO SINGAPORE. Fly Singapore Airlines. If you can afford Business Class. I did and know now why both Chiangi Singapore Airport and Singapore Airlines are number one. THEY DESERVE IT!! A+++

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a convenient location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Maridel0716
Reviews.Content: My BF and I picked this place because of the good reviews. I'm glad we read the reviews and were not dissappointed. To start, the staff were very gracious enough to give us our room before noon. We were willing to leave of bags on the Concierge but we were told that we check in right away. Plus (+) : - For those of you who likes to shop, this is a good place to stay since it is connected to a mall. It even has a staircase that only hotel guests can use - There's a lot of bars and places to eat around the area where the hotel is located. - The staff at the Concierge were very helpful. - Easy to get taxi from this hotel - we never waited for taxi to arrive Minus (-):

Reviews.Title: “Excellet location with comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: vorpex
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four night stay at the Marina Mandarin for our vacation to Singapore. The best part of this hotel is its location. You are within walking distance of the Sky Park, Singapore Flier, and the the river fronts. There are also shopping malls and a series of underground shopping passage ways that connect you to near by areas like the City Hall. We had a delux room facing the bay with a relatively good view... though the bay was partially blocked by Mandarin Oriental and another hotel. The room was comfortable, and there is a choice of pillow to choose from. The carpet is a bit dated, but the furnatures and the LCD TV have been updated. Typical bathroom amenities that you would find in an upscale Asian hotel are available, but there was no comb. The service is excellent, and the staff tried their best to allow us to check in early (we got there very early on a red-eye flight). Interor design of the hotel is very pretty with lots of intricate shapes in both the architecture and the decore. Birds placed on the 5th floor during the day can be heard (pleasantly faint) even from our 14th floor room. The breakfast is okay, maybe not worth the price. I'd rather go to the corner kofe shop to get nice kaya bread breakfast set at only S$3. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: June088
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin Hotel in Singapore is absolutely fabulous. We stayed there for three nights before travelling to Thailand and honestly wish we had booked for much longer. The rooms are beautifully furnished with lovely views (we were overlooking Raffles Boulevard) The restaurants are excellent - the outside restaurant where we had breakfast each day is very pretty and the food is first class. The pool area is beautiful and the fitness centre very well equipped. The staff are extremely helpful and I cannot say what we enjoyed most as everything was excellent. s centre

Reviews.Title: “Bit dated, but still a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VinceDarwin
Reviews.Content: This place would have been top-shelf in its day (80's), but parts of a it a getting a bit tired. The bathrooms have been reno'd and are looking modern, but some of the public areas have an old early 80's look about them. Nevertheless, was still a very pleasant stay with excellent service. The hotel recieved a big tick when willing to negotiate a 6pm late check out due to a late flight, and at a very reasonable price. That sort of flexibility would see me coming back again. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the club room's cinematic experience but service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Proudnewparents
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Marina 3 times over the last 2 years - twice in the club room and one in the suite. Club room- Lovely modern decor with large comfortable beds, well equipped with a nespresso machine, large screen TV and surround sound system. There's a free DVD rental service at the club lounge with a decent selection of movies. Dim the lights, turn up the sound, and you lying down in your own cinema. Cocktails at the club lounge provides a good selection of finger food and the staff are friendly and courteous. Toiletries were high end- crabtree and evelyn on one occasion. They leave chocolates/ sweets on your bed which was a nice touch. Room service was good - they acceded to requests to whip up items that were not on the menu. The only negative thing that I had to say about the club room stays was this - We unintentionally left 2 pieces of clothing in the hotel closet when we checked out. These items had been laundered at the hotel and were still in their plastic covers tagged with our hotel room number. I only realised this two weeks after and called the hotel up. The hotel staff then confirmed that our items were in their store and we had to go down to retrieve them. I was quite surprised that there wasn't a service to call us up to inform us of the items that we had left behind, considering that we stay in Singapore. Suite- Somehow we had a very disappointing experience during this stay. Firstly, our room was not ready till 2 hours after check in. So we were lodged in a club room initially. This was inconvenient because we were travelling with a baby and we couldn't unpack and fully unwind in the temporary room. The non-smoking suite, when it was finally ready, reeked of smoke and we had to keep the balcony doors open in an attempt to clear the air. When we complained, housekeeping brought in an air ioniser which helped a little. The decor of the suite was rather simple and did not have a DVD player and surround sound system. Housekeeping staff had a tendency to knock just once and swipe open the door without waiting for even a second for a response. Perhaps that was our fault for not keeping the DND sign on all the time. Overall: We'd still return again because the club rooms were THAT good. It's location is great for shopping and dining out. Just a few steps down and you have access to 2 large shopping malls and the subway. Service could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, immaculate hotel - perfect for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RichieThomas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - we were upgraded on arrival to a Deluxe room (pays to book ahead) and the room was huge and immaculate. The air-con was incredibly powerful - exactly what you need coming in from Singapore's hot streets! The bathroom was enormous, with double sinks, comfortable bath and powerful hot shower (separate large cubicle). The piano playing in the lobby was just audible (we were on the 11th Floor) which was lovely, but could have been annoying if you;re on a low floor. You can enter the MRT from beneath the hotel, so you can avoid the hot and sweaty humidity or tropical rainstorms, and the shopping mall under/behind/around the hotel was perfect for starting the day. The hotel room also overlooked the GP track (between turns 6 and 7 for the petrolheads) so over the F1 weekend prices go mental...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms getting old”
Reviews.Author: shopgirI
Reviews.Content: This is my second time back here. First time was last year and got a free upgrade to the executive deluxe room. Was very impressed hence came back the second time. Wasn't so impressive anymore. This time the executive deluxe room wasn't as good. It is in need of maintenance. The bathroom's grout was black and didn't feel as clean. The carpet has stains in it and the balcony was very narrow compared to the first time we stayed. Found the bed and pillow to be relatively firm. It is in a great location though. Catching the MRT from the Esplanade now is much closer to the hotel than catching it from the City Hall MRT. Plus less crowd at the Esplanade MRT.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to go shopping”
Reviews.Author: alexfromastrakhan
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location. It is very convinient to do some shopping near by, as it has an easy access to the Marina Square shopping mall. My wife adored it very much. Besides, our room had a wonderful view over the bay and harbour. The staff of the hotel is helpful and pleasant. The pool with mineral water is really nice, and the food and drinks and overall service is good. I would recommend the hotel to all my friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: melosc
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much. The unique architecture, the location, and service was prompt. Cannot comment on breakfast since I book room only. easy to find taxi, next door to marina square shopping mall. I had deluxe room with double bed (very comfortable bed) with spectacular view to the Marina Bay Sands. Great bathroom, very clean, with separate bathtub and shower room. and there were two separate sinks. Price was very good, since I got weekend promo. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stopover”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a one night stopover.. courteous reception and smooth checkin, luxurious room with a view from 20th floor over bay and harbour. Shopping plaza at the doorstep with Orchard Rd a 10min taxi ride. Birdsong was filtered through lobby and floors from tropical birds in tiny cages.. this l thought was tacky, cruel and definately not necessary. But overall l would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerdkl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Exec. deluxe room - this guarantees a high floor but does not guarantee a marina view. That can cost an additional $40 per night. I requested the marina view and that was granted at no extra. Room is wonderful and bathroom was very impressive and spacious. Spotless as well and fast wireless internet. Flatscreen TV, quality fittings and nice workbench with swivel chair was good for me. Hard beds but not a big issue. Rooms have a balcony but dont expect to sit out there as there is no space for a chair. Just enough room to stand and enjoy the view as its only about 1/2 meter wide. Hotel itself is exceptional inside with the impressive elevator column housing 4 lifts - 3 of which you can look out of as you travel up and down. Some really nice open bars. Pool is nice and the food and drinks and overall service is good. Staff are wonderful and all doormen remembered my name each day. taxis are easy from the hotel. Short walk to marina side cafes although the current grand prix fencing makes it a little longer late at night when you cant access through the shopping centre. Marina Square mall is 2 mins walk and loads of eating places in there. As i travel singapore a lot, the only downside to this wonderful country is getting a taxi at busy times or at busy locations....such as Vivo city. As usual, i give up and walk for 10 mins and try catch a taxi from the roads nearby...its easier and so much faster!! Would like to highly recommend a visit to the new show "voyage de lavi" - showing at the venue beside sentosa casino. Its spectacular. Get the green seats for around S$100 each. Just ask the taxi to take you to sentosa casino, walk in and you will see the signs to it. Showtimes on weekends were 7.30pm and 9.30pm for memory. Although i still prefer the clark quay area, the marina manrarin is a super hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: wonderwend
Reviews.Content: We spent the final night of our trip at this hotel in Singapore. Check in was speedy and we were upgraded to an executive room. We found our room and were very disappointed when we entered. The room was quite shabby and some of the furniture had scuffs and scrapes all over it. The bathroom was also very average and a little grubby with mould around the sink! The view from the room was nice...this was about the only plus point about the room. I just hate to think what the non executive rooms were like! Overall we slept ok but considering what we had paid for our room and the reputation of this hotel we were left feeling that we will not return!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: HB83100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 2 night stopover on our honeymoon. We had a warm welcome and received a great room. Breakfast was included which was excellent as its probably very expensive. It tasted good and there was food from all over the world from sushi to cheese to curry. The only problem was that they tried so hard to cover everything imaginable that there were bits missing. The hotel is in a fairly good spot but it was tricky to get anywhere with the youth olymic road closures. Avoid in September as its on the grand prix route and all the pavements are fenced off. When we were leaving, we found a door leading under the hotel via the shopping centre to the harbour which would have made everything a lot easier but its kind of hidden! The concierge was great and we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tanabanana87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 20 month old daughter. The staff were fantastic, we found the mall attached to the hotel was invaluable. Drinks are overpriced, as is the food. We found the comfort level unbeatable, though there is live singing in the lobby until about 11pm which you can hear very clearly in your room. Luckily, we were up til late anyway so that did not affect us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: I have to hand it to this hotel, the location is great. It is about 100 meters from the escalator to the subway and Suntec City Mall is just across the street and the Marina Bay Mall can be reached from the lobby. This is unfortunately the only positive point I can come up with. Some things I did not care for: - The rooms have very poor soundproofing and I could hear everything going on in the neighboring rooms. The same was true for street traffic. - The room had a balcony but there was no furniture so I am not sure what the intended use is (except for perhaps smoking). The balcony door only added to the poor sound proofing. - The staff was not unfriendly but was obsessed with telling us what was included in our room rate and what would cost extra. Considering the room rate I was surprised there was things not included. - Internet was of course not included in the price. This made this hotel the one place in Singapore where internet usage was not free as we could otherwise get on the excellent Wireless@SG service. - The breakfast buffet (of course at an extra charge) was not bad but considering you could feed a family for a whole day for the same price at one of Singapore's hawker centers it was poor value. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and really nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maltese_meatball
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin from the 7th of July till the 11th of July.It was my partner and my 1st time to Singapore.The Hotel was great ppl was nice and the Rooms had a great View.When we got there the room was not ready and they wanted to put us on a smoking floor.Seeing that we dont smoke i said we where not happy with that so they moved us to the 11th floor and they where very helpful.The guys and girls in the foyer where a great help and they organised travel for us to Universal Studios.So a big thank you and when next in Singapore will be stayin there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ive been to in a long while”
Reviews.Author: varuunn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are exceptional at a very affordable price. There spacious as well as luxurious, and the best part is they have a balcony attached to each room. Once you get into the room, you never want to leave! highly recommended for couples !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant”
Reviews.Author: ahparker
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot with work and have to say that this is up there in the Top 3 of all time. From the moment of getting out of the taxi from the airport to leaving three days later, I have nothing but praise. Clean and very pleasant. I was always greeted with a smile and an efficiency that was very impressive. I was offered an upgrade to a Premier Room without asking too. I will definitely stay here during my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel & Fantastic Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ellie_asher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of a round the world were trip and were absolutely delighted with the whole experience. From the moment we walked through the door to the moment we left we were made to feel so at home. The staff were super friendly and the check in process was a breeze. We had a booked a Meritus Club room and were located on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the city which offered a beautiful view both day and night. We managed to get a great rate through the hotels own website by booking well in advance. As we had booked a Club room we had access to the club lounge which offered complimentary cocktails and hor douves between 5:30 - 7:30pm every night. You could have as much as you liked which ended up being well worth the extra few dollars we paid for a club room as alcohol is very expensive in Singapore (cocktails are around $25-29 SGD and standard drink will cost you $15-17). Breakfast was available in either the club lounge or downstairs on level 4. They both offer an extensive buffet and also have chefs on hand to prepare anything you like. Everything was hot, freash and very tasty. The location of the hotel is close to everything and is also located right next to 2 massive shopping malls which offer hours of shopping paradise for a bargain hunter. They also offer a very well equipped gym and have a great pool area with staff that go out of their way to help you. The room itself was well equipped including a Nespresso machine and very clean. The only negative thing I could say is that the mattress was too firm so if you are sensetive to that kind of thing you might want to look at other options. But this one bad point was far outweighed by many good ones. We will definitely stay here again when we return to SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to the Conference”
Reviews.Author: TravelHappyOne
Reviews.Content: While attending a conference at the hotel it was the obvious choice. The service was efficient - check-in quite slow with only a couple of people on reception at evening check-in. The hotel is centrally located in Singapore, although anywhere in Singapore is close and easily accessible. I had an evening flight out of Singapore and was happy that I was able to use the gymnasium facilites to have a shower before departure. Internet also available in the business centre as I chose not to take a laptop for this quick two night stay. Would stay at the hotel again while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in Singapore! The...”
Reviews.Author: Aftrbrn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in Singapore! The large room is excellent and spacious toilet. The ateium is fantastic as well to hang around. Good location as well and I think all rooms have a balcony. LooK out for their promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware of price”
Reviews.Author: HEDGERhog
Reviews.Content: I've stopped in this hotel with my wife in September, 2008 during our honeymoon Of cource, it's nice to stay in such a hotel, but you should remember that Singapore is rather expensive city and the price you pay there for accomodation is one of the highest in Asia. The hotel is situated in one of Singapore top spots near Esplanade, The Suntec City and The Singapore Flyer at Marina Bay. It's also good that it faces the skyscrapers of the financial district, which is located on the other bank of Singapore river mouth. So, you can get the spectacular view from your balcony, especially when you're on the top floors. The rooms in the hotel are rather big which is not usual thing in most of Singapore hotels. If I'm not mistaken, now after the opening of circle line of MRT, the subway station is also several minutes on foot from the hotel. 2 years ago it took about 10-12 minutes to get the City Hall station, but all the way you could go by the underpass with a/c. Nevertheless, I think that it's usual for Singapore when you spend in the hotel only nights, so, booking an expensive hotel may pay the cost when you can really afford this or when you have a good reason as honeymoon:) If I remember, we've payed about US$180 per night for standard room, but we had some benefits, because we booked the hotel by the Singapore Airlines programme "Singapore Stopover Holiday". In other cases I think it's better to find a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was! no way a 5 star any more.”
Reviews.Author: Bobarooo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel several times before and found it very good I was very dissapointed to find standards could slip so quickly. The first room I was given was disgusting the floor was matted with hair and other dirt I even found toe nails! It could not have been cleaned properly for a long time to be so dirty.I complained & was given another room but this also was un-acceptable. I complained again & was given a room upgrade, this room was acceptable. The staff were very appologetic & they took my complaints seriously & acted imediatley but the whole experience was very dissapointing. Also for Hotel in this price range the sunbeds are just not good enough, most of were ripped or broken & realy quite dangerous let alone giving a bad impression of the hotels slipping standards!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tsemaa
Reviews.Content: Good location very close to Merlion and Singapore river, right next to Sunset Plaza mall and 5 min walk from Singapore Flier. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL FOR SUNTEC CITY”
Reviews.Author: jayeshashar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and good rooms. Not a good location for leisure travellers. Close to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Decent four star hotel - though would not rate it five stars.”
Reviews.Author: BondFan
Reviews.Content: We were told this was a five star hotel - i would disagree and say it was more four star. The rooms themselves are OK - if slightly dated (with the exception of the flat panel tv). The bathroom certainly could do with an upgrade - and certainly not of the standard expected in a five star hotel. That said the hotel is in a brilliant central location - certainly for shopping with several shopping malls on the hotels doorstep. The Singapore flyer is also within walking distance. If you don't mind walking, other attractions area slo within a long walking distance. Free shuttle buses come regularly to take you to Sentosa. Reception and check in were fine as were the cleaning arrangements - we never had any problems. The breakfast was of a decent quality and sufficient variety to satisfy a vegetarian! There was a gym and rooftop pool at the hotel - though we did not use these facilities. Overall, not a five star hotel, but decent four star.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLynda
Reviews.Content: I'm a Singaporean and my house was under minor renovation and i choose to stay in a hotel for couple of days with my husband. 5 star hotel but 3 star service. The reception staff is soooooo snobbish. The rooms although they did furnish with new furniture but once i stepped into the rooms, it smelt mouldy and beside the new furniture and work desk, the bathroom is HORRIBLE. Stained and mouldy everywhere. Very disappointed for staying there and i checked out the next day, not worth at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Great situation”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer65
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel - get a river view room if possible. Very helpful friendly staff, lovely breakfast in the Aquamarine restaurant. The hotel is situated in Marina Bay - access to the shopping centre directly from the hotel is very convenient. Also a few minutes walk to the river, night food market, many restaurants and bars, plus the concert hall. Much better than having to take a taxi everywhere. We always stay there when we break the long journey to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: jainneha
Reviews.Content: I just love Singapore. Beautiful and extra ordinary. Marina Mandarin is truly a classy place. I got to see some celebs as well. (LOL). Suntec City is conveniently located and a great place to shop. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dull and uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: qzqj7zSydney
Reviews.Content: Like many of the other reviewers I found this hotel didn't live up to expectations. This place is quite literally dull - only about a third of the walkway lights on the Executive Floor were working. I stayed for 10 nights and, when I asked for late checkout, (which is supposed to be one of the executive floor perks) I was bluntly told that it wasn't available. The breakfast was just ok, the lobby bar is ruinously expensive and the housekeeping was very hit and miss. The food at Peach Blossoms (the supposedly Cantonese restaurant on level 5) was nothing short of apalling. If you need a Chinese food fix try going next door to one of the restaurants in Millenia Square or to Crystal Jade in Suntec - much cheaper and better. As an alternative for my next visit I made a point of viewing the rooms at the Pan Pacific next door. They were much more cheery and I'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - from housekeeping to conceige”
Reviews.Author: KatGrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Marina Mandarin for 3 nights at the end of May with an 8 month old infant and a 3 year old toddler. The room was large enough for our luggage and the hotel's baby crib which was great. But what made the Marina M stand out in our memory was the terrible service esp from its housekeeping department. We noticed a trend in Singapore's hospitality industry in recent years. Mainland Chinese have taken over most of the menial jobs. While I welcome the influx of cheaper labour, what Marina M doesn't realize is that they bring along tardy service standards and a poor command of English. On 2 separate incidents with housekeeping, it took an hour and 3 phone calls with each incident. #1. I requested for a hot water flask to hold boiling water as I have an infant on formula milk and I'm against leaving hot water in a plastic jug. It didn't arrive. On calling back, I was told that they didn't have it. "What? Don't the restaurants downstairs have them?" "No... the restaurants and housekeeping are separate units." "I don't care about your hotel's bureaucracy, just get me one". By then, my baby was screaming. They called me back 15min later. "the flask in your room is made from metal (when I told her of my aversion towards plastic & boiling water)" "$@%! the freaking kettle is made of plastic!!" I was positively livid by now. Finally, after 3 calls and nearly an hour later, lo and behold, a little thermos flask was delivered by a staff without so much as a word or smile. #2. (There was a nice Hitachhi flatscreen tv in the room. Not bad. Except that they have either streamed the hotel channels with analog cables or the settings are totally off. The picture quality was totally awful & pixelated. The in-house remote control was also crap as it doesn't have a numeric keypad - which means that one has to scroll through 20 channels to reach number 21. But that's not the point.) There was something wrong with the control, so I thought batteries had run of juice perhaps. I called service desk who then relayed to Housekeeping my request for batteries. 20min later, I called again. Where's the guy? and then 30min again. Finally, a mainland Chinese staff came up. When I asked what caused the delay, he asked if I spoke Chinese. Sure, I'm ethnic Chinese. Even then, I got no satisfactory answer on why housekeeping took a whole hour in a late afternoon to respond to my needs. The last incident was regarding Conceige. Checking out, my husband called for a trolley as we had 8 pieces of luggage. It took 30min(!!) to arrive in our room. The buffet breakfast was below average from a so-called 5 star hotel's standard. Everyday for 3 days, the smoked salmon wasn't replenished once the little plate was emptied. Lattes or capuccinos came from an automated machine and because of the crowd and noisy Chinese tourists, the restaurant felt like a canteen. Thank God it was only a 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very slow and arrogant reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Shah_2012
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. The only reason I selected this hotel is that it was cheap for other 5 star hotels around the Marina Bay. The reception staff are very slow and arrogant. While I went down to the reception to checkout, there was the longest que. They have over 8 computers in total but only 3 staff. When I went and asked if you could call some other staff to ease the que, I was replied by one of the staff who was wearing a red dress saying they are in a meeting. The best part was their office is just behind the reception and you could see the staff come out and go back in and laugh, may be it was a laughing meeting. I requested that I have a flight to take and if I could be attended first, guess what they said?? - You should come early. How early do you want one to come down. Have been waiting for 35 minutes in the que. I approached the duty manager and guess what she says, everyone is waiting to be served I cannot help you. A gentleman who was in a hurry went and requested and he was bluntly told by a red women staff that they cannot do anything and just wait for your turn. The staff are very rude they dont have any sense of manners or ethics at this hotel. The concierge are really dumb too. When I asked where could I find a good Indian place to eat, I was told try the marina square mall they may have something in the food court. I have stayed many times at this hotel and this would surely be my last stay at Marina Mandarin Hotel. If you are someone who does not mind waiting for checking in/out then go ahead. In room dinning food quantity very small compare to the heavy price tag you have to pay. Food is good but takes around 45 minutes to come whether busy or not.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: globetravelerNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, since my preferred hotel had no rooms avaiable. 1 night Deluxe Room (MMS) and 3 nights Premier Room (MMS). The lobby, interior and exterior of the hotel are impressive. The breakfast is OK. The staff engaged. The Rooms however are just average and not meeting my minimum requirements for comfort and sleep-quality. The upgrade from Deluxe to Premier was only upgrade in price but not for comfort (except for the view). All in all think not to stay here next time

Reviews.Title: “old sad & bad”
Reviews.Author: Drhlime
Reviews.Content: like being shrunk & injected inside a 1970's bone coloured wall phone every thing is beige & faded includung the food & service . on arrival we missed lunch, fair enough & enquired about an aternative to the usual chubby club sandwich burger menu at the lobby lounge . "sorry only caesars salad without bacon "...so we opted for two flat glasses of Champagne & returned to our room where the all day menu had many salads & vegeterain alternatives ?????? so if they can deliver it to the 19th floor why not 20 minutes fresher in the lobby? we paid extra for a view of the marina but alas all we could see was the Mandarin Oriental & Carlton Ritz which depressed us even more because we have stayed at both previously & guess what... Swimming pool area dirty & unatended. room pretty below standard in the cleanliness area also.as I write this we havnt checked out yet oh dear. the upside is that its situated in a great area with easy access to restaurants & other hotels

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice with a great location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: admorph
Reviews.Content: From my hotel located across Marina Bay from the Central business district, it’s a short walk through perfect parks and convenient (and cool!) underpasses to everything the city has to offer. I picked the Marina Mandarin Hotel for its central location and excellent city/Marina views. Fantastic hotel, with an odd design (more on that in a moment), outstanding rooms and world-class service. However, the whole room-with-a-view thing I didn’t really need to worry about, because there are hundreds of perfect vantage points to photograph and experience this city while walking around. What’s odd about the design, is the direction the windows are facing, none face the perfect photo opportunity of the central business district, you choose either harbor/marina or city view. It’s quite a lean off the balcony to get the shot above! The Marina Mandarin Hotel was a good deal all-round, rates high on my list. Food prices very reasonable, room outstanding, amenities and location could not be better, then again, it’s hard to go too far wrong in Singapore. I’d recommend any of the hotels in the Marina, Riverwalk and Central Districts based on location, though prices can get a bit steep with many of them. This review is adapted from my full travel blog at http://www.travel.spinfirst.com : 48 Hours in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel in such a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: SeatonCNorthEast
Reviews.Content: On holiday with my sister who had never travelled to Asia before. We had previously visited Bangkok, and Phuket and were finishing our holiday with four nights in Singapore. Other than the beds being made up with clean sheets on our arrival, the standard of housekeeping was very poor. During the four night stay the room was not cleaned adequately - we slept there, the room had a super view overlooking the harbour, the swimming pool area was particularly jaded and the staff kept apologising for the poor standard of the sun loungers. The ONE member of staff that is! This poor boy was doing everything with an occasional hand from the security manager. Shame on the Meritus Group. The star rating is undeserved and I was glad we were only there briefly. Singapore itself, and it's people were 6 star plus. Give this Hotel a wide berth unless you are on expenses and can afford to upgrade to Club - perhaps all the staff were working on the higher floors because they were certainly conspicuous by their absence on our floor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate place”
Reviews.Author: SeresM
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for business: excellent lunch buffet, sensible meeting rooms. Good gym.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Housekeeping standards”
Reviews.Author: JaimeScotland
Reviews.Content: Rooms & Bathrooms not cleaned properly. In Fact the bathrooms were so filthy, we bought disinfectant from a nearby hardware shop & cleaned them ourselves. The loungers at the pool are not what you would expect of a 5 star hotel- more the standard of a students hostal.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing experience”
Reviews.Author: puchi33
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Marina Mandarin on Tuesday morning, it was my wedding anniversary and I made sure we told the travel agent about it as we wanted to be special. The bad experience started as soon as we got to the rception to check in, the receptionist told us we had been booked into a twin bed room, when we especified we wanted a double bed room. when going into the room, we find a filthy room, mouldy tiles, dusty, dirty curtains and carpet, faulty tv..... basically I can find anything positive to say about this hotel! I asked to be moved to a different room as the room I refused to sleep in such dirty room, they moved me down 3 rooms, the room was slightly better but still not at the standard of a 4* and a half!!!! I tried to ignore the room and make the most of Singapore as I was already there and you don't get that opportunity twice. When night came, it was a nightmare as my room faced the main road and you could hear every car driving down. The windows are not noise proof..... I was up until 4am trying to sleep but was so hard to get a proper night sleep. If you go to Singapore avoid this hotel as you will regret the experience, it is expensive and it doesn't show for it.

Reviews.Title: “An average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kuteboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with nice views, wonderful buffet breakfast, beautiful lobby and very good Chinese restaurant. Conveniently located; not too far from the river and China town. The design of the hotel really epitomise luxury. and i like the bathroom, although not very new, it is spacious and generally clean. Room had balcony with nice view. It's also in the heart of the city. Hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good Stopover”
Reviews.Author: thepearofus
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 day stopover on our way to Australia Stayed in the Club rooms on the 20th floor,which included all the perks of club Loved the Spa shower in the bathroom The staff were very attentive and friendly The outdoor pool was very wellcoming and refreshing Will stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “looks better from the outside”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks good from the outside but its just about ok. there are several better options at the same price in singapore. the hotel has a good location with lots of shopping around but this would not be my first choice. the rooms are decent but for the same money you'd get a better room elsewhere in singapore. the breakfast is good though!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but room was not very clean”
Reviews.Author: HansRotterdam
Reviews.Content: The location next to Marina Square mall is good. Impressive atrium. Breakfast is very good. Room nice, big, but not clean (dust everywhere). Service is OK but we have experienced much better in the Far East. Overall it is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bring 2 Credit Cards”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I haven't returned to the Marina Mandarin since 2006. The main reason being I've got enticed by other hotel chains, and I am not a member of Meritus Hotels. But this time due to some last-minute factors, it meant I had to find another hotel on short notice and since I have stayed here before, I was looking forward to returning. I was disappointed on checking in to find that the hotel had trouble accepting the credit card that I used to book the reservation. When I booked the reservation online, there was no problem accepting the card. But when I checked in and they put the card in their machine, they asked me if I had another credit card. Luckily I did, although I was not planning to use that card for this hotel. Later, I used the same card at another hotel in Singapore and there were no problems in accepting the card. So the problem was with MM's machine, not with my card. It was generally a very comfortable stay. The room was nice and had a balcony, although it was still not high enough to have a decent view. The bathroom was neat, with a bathtub, and shower that had the greatest water pressure. The bathroom also had 2 sinks. The hotel is right above the gigantic Marina Square shopping mall. It's also not too far (walking distance) to the new Promenade MRT station on the Circle Line. Everyone working at the hotel was friendly. It was nice to return to the MM again, although I hope next time I don't have to deal with a problem with my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: layang-kangen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in executive floor, the room was great and was recently given a facelift. Bathroom was a little let down since it looked pretty old but it was still clean. 6 jet shower was nothing extraordinary. Upon arrival I was greeted by charming lady with sexy cheong sam (it seems most of their female staffs wear this uniform). taken to the executive floor for check in. club room was mediocre, but their room rate also significantly lower than their competitior so no complaints. breakfast was okay, location a bit far from City Hall MRT, 10 mins walk through air conditioned walkway. But in a few month there'll be a new MRT station within 5 minutes walk. Overall I would stay here again. PS: We stayed in 25th floor but we still could hear the music from lobby if we stand near the door. I hope the management can tone down the volume a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Agfox46
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed for 9 nights in a Meritus Club Room on the 21st floor of this hotel. Actually, we stayed in 2 rooms as the first, 2103, became infested with small ant-like insects & we were moved to 2106 for the rest of our stay. The hotel has several strengths: first, the staff are wonderful &, without exception, were helpful, friendly, courteous & very obliging. Second, the hotel is well-positioned in relation to shopping (Marina Square, Suntec City, Raffles Place & Millenia Walk), attractions (the Singapore Flyer), culture (the Theatres on the Bay) & transport (2 stations on the new MRT loop & City Hall under Raffles Place). Third, the Meritus Club lounge with it's free breakfasts, cocktails & computer access is a restful spot at most times of day. On the other hand, my wife & I thought that the hotel is in need of a general refurbishment. The Club Rooms are really not all that special & not overly large with fairly ordinary fittings - although the shower with its 6 jets, rain shower & rail shower heads & theNespresso-type coffee maker were nice touches. Nonetheless, we've stayed in non-Club hotel rooms in Australia, Japan & Malaysia that have been of a superior quality for less cost. In the rooms we occupied, there was enamel surfacing missing from the bath in one & discoloured & missing grout around the shower in both, while both doors to the niche where the room fridge was located were loose on their hinges. In general, the hotel is painted & has carpets & fittings in dull browns, beige, grey etc &, combined with low-level lighting, tends to be a bit gloomy on the accommodation levels. I think there may be better quality Club hotel rooms available elsewhere in Singapore for a comparative price but we would be happy to stay there again if some extensive refurbishments were made.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel but make sure your Company is paying !”
Reviews.Author: chocice60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days whilst awaiting a cruise to Vietnam. Centrally placed for getting around - built above a shopping arcade with a few restaurants and the trolleybus tour of the city leaves from a bus stop only a few hundred yards away. However you'll be charged a fortune for breakfast, around UK£11 for a beer and over UK£5 for a glass of coke. We found all staff we had contact with extremely helpful. On many nights there is a live cabaret in the central atrium, and the noise will keep you awake until 11p.m. even on the 20th floor, since the atrium goes all the way up to the roof and is a giant echo chamber.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: coath
Reviews.Content: stayed one night in club room on 21st floor at marina mandarin. excellent hotel, staff friendly - club room includes free wifi, lovely breakfast and free cocktails and nibbles early evening in the club lounge. we paid for a late checkout til 6pm and when checking out were invited to cocktails and nibbles again which was lovely as we weren't heading to the airport until about 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Forbidden_apple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina for 6 days in August of last year. Check in was a breeze and I was allotted a standard room. When I reached the room, the bed was unmade, being restless and sleepy after a overnight flight and having just 2 hrs to relax before going to office, I contacted the reception. They immediately upgraded me to the next room level (Cant remember if it was Club or Deluxe). The view from the room was amazing. The best thing about this hotel is that its so close to Temasek business district as well as shopping areas. The breakfast was very good, albeit a bit crowded for me. All in all, a very good hotel and experience. It also has its own shopping mall underneath.

Reviews.Title: “MARINA THE MAGNIFICENT”
Reviews.Author: Atrebor13
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the MM on two previous occasions but during this last stay it was AWESOME!. When I entered the (Premier) room all I could think to say was "Oh my god". That was it! It was the most stunning, beautiful room I had ever been in. On entering, the room presented even better. The bathroom alone was nearly three times the size of mine at home. The bed - fit for a king/queen - was too inviting to even lie down in or ruin. I just stood and stared. The TV, the excellent range of room facilities, the separate shower and bath, the slippers and robe they had set out for me, honestly it just took my breath away. The view was to die for. Seriously! The service at Reception was fast, efficient and accurate. The concierge, bell boys and everybody were helpful and good guides. Congratulations to the Marina Mandarin team. I can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: drjoeng
Reviews.Content: I'm penning this review as I sit in the hotel lobby, ready to leave. I stayed in a suite on the 17th floor. This was a pseudo-suite with the connecting door between 2 STD rooms being unlocked. The carpets appeared worn and felt dusty to the sole. The showers and bathroom were clean and neatly appointed. Standards that I would have expected of a single room but certainly not of a suite at a 5-star hotel. When I called hotel staff to inquire about breakfast, I was put on hold and then given the wrong information regarding the operating hours and staff remained unsure of the age-related restrictions for breakfast at the Meritus Club Lounge. Doorstaff in the evening appeared to be indifferent and were busy chatting and being convivial, speculating on when traffic congestion might abate. The absence of attention by doorstaff was made all the more obvious as I had just returned a wonderful stay at the Sofitel Metropole in Hanoi Checkout proceeded at an unacceptably slow pace in the line that I joined because I was told there was no "easy checkout" option. An adequate lodge that you might comfortably use as a base for exploring Singapore, but there are less expensive options even along the popular Orchard Road stretch.

Reviews.Title: “A dark vibe going on...”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights following Pan Pacific stay (Pan Pac full). Big atrium style hotel, but main lobby/bar/restaurant area on 4th floor but all is low lit and is dark once sunsets, ok during the day. Room on 10th floor could hear lobby singer a little but only if near the door. Balconies on rooms are good, albeit a little small, and give good views of Bay area. Construction of huge new Sands Casino Resort nearby is not audible. Room is ok, tv signal was poor with terrible remote control with only channel up and down not numbers to select channel (yes, I'm fussy!), and if you want a phone by the work desk, you must transfer the single phone from the bedside table. Free internet, but need to connect by LAN to activate, so couldn't connect iphone to wifi. Good buffet breakfast. Mix of business travellers and families staying here. Pool are is nice, gym is small. Concierge and bellboys very helpful. Location is good with Marina Square attached for shopping and food, Suntec 5 mins, Raffles 5 mins, MRT 5 mins, Esplanade and Bay 5 mins. Nice hotel, but Pan Pacifiic opposite is much superior.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: TodgeProvence_France
Reviews.Content: On arrival taken to club room check in on 21st floor. Room was spacious and well equipped with great view. Ideally positioned for Suntec & Marina Mall which we preferred to the glitzy newer malls in Orchard Road . The canapés and early evening drinks were excellent. Jess & colleage gave extra help to get my computer working on the internet - thanks. I left my wallet in the downstairs lounge bar and it was returned with all contents safely intact. Also a cake was delivered for our anniversary something I had mentioned in early correspondence showing they listened ! A nice touch demonstrating the personal service exists even in a biggish city hotel. We would return next time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: SSK77
Reviews.Content: My first business trip stay at this hotel. Very nice and spacious room. Staff was very helpful. Food is OK. Very close to the Suntec City, so good for shopping. Little bit downside was the conference room arrangement. Air-cond was freezing cold despite complaint to the staff and our conference get moved around to suit other event and it was noisy. Overall, the hotel is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: SBawa
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel and facilities, except that gym was too small for the hotel. The gym instructor was not helpful, though all others were very helpful Good value for money, though the design is old n needs interior overhaul

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Kokwan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days with relatives and had 4 rooms booked. All in all, it was good. Toiletries were plentiful, rooms were cleaned and linen and towels were changed every day. We used the pool a couple of times and noticed that workmen were hammering away doing repairs to the poolside. Not very safe for my young daughter running around. On our second night, I was kept awake with loud music playing until 4am which was not pleasant. Buffet breakfast was good but choice of only 3 types of dim sum which got a bit boring for us after a couple of days. Not very near to the nearest MRT which I was told was Cityhall. It took me about 15 minutes to walk there and only after going through a car park, then down the escalators which led me to a mall. Not very well signposted too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed With Service”
Reviews.Author: lanjiaolang
Reviews.Content: The Good: Nice location in Marina Square, making it walking distance to other malls such as Suntec City and Millenia Walk. Toiletries were plentiful with shampoo, conditioner, bath foam, body lotion, ear buds, toothbrush and toothpaste etc. Asked for ice in the evening which was promptly delievered, a tiny bucket of ice but sufficient for 3 drinks. The Bad: Showed my Meritus dining card to the receptionist but she did not want it...... she had to call my room later to ask me for the membership number because she forgot to take it down earlier (this promo is for the Meritus dining card). Supposed to get welcome chocolates but there were none in the room. Called the receptionist and she said it will be sent up later as they are arranging for it now. Waited a while and called her back, she said the chocolates will be sent up during turn down service in the evening. Chocolates did arrive at 8 plus pm but there was no turn down service. I was entitled to an upgrade to a premier room but the room i stayed in did not seem all that "premier" to me, just that it was on a higher floor. Rooms are spruced up but the balcony looked so old and tired, they haven't done anything to the balcony since the hotel opened. Deck chairs at the pool were poorly maintained, the one i saw had some sort of insect nest on it, while another had bird droppings and the fabric was torn. Parking is limited to one parking coupon per stay (according to both the telephone receptionist and the counter receptionist) but when we asked the conceirge, he said it was one parking coupon per room per day, so i managed to get 2 free parking coupons instead. Wanted to ask the chamber maid a question but she was non-conversant in English. Asked the restaurant captain on the charges for breakfast (my room came with breakfast but we were having a friend join us for breakfast). The restaurant captain told me they have a buffet breakfast for $40 and a continental breakfast for $28. So of the 2, which am i entitled to for my room? He could not understand my question, and so i started from the top. He told me to have a seat while he found out. He walked away and spoke on the phone, returned to me 2 minutes later and said "yes, i have found out for you that if your friend is joining you, you will have 2 free breakfast and 1 paid breakfast". I had to point out that that was not my question. I have another discounted room coupon to use, but will probably throw that away.

Reviews.Title: “All you really need”
Reviews.Author: AMH007
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Singapore, the Marina Mandarin provided everything you could ask for. Although we arrived very early in the morning from Melbourne, early check in wasn’t a problem, the hotel gym and spa offered everything you could ask for and there was a wonderful selection for breakfast. Entering the hotel it’s easy to be swept up in the vast expanse of the foyer/lobby area, all of which gives a great perception of space and room. The hotel maybe looked a little “tired” from one of two angles but it definitely meets all a busy travellers needs. Our stay was a very busy one (just 3 days), so the room served its purposes well, the bathroom was a nice size and was very clean had everything we could ask for although there was a minor issue with the dual sinks. An added bonus was complimentary water restocked daily. The staff were polite, always warmly greeted you were very helpful with directions and advice. We ate one night in Ristorante Bolgna and the food and service was delightful, although on the expensive side, cocktails and in fact any alcohol in Singapore proved expensive also. There is an MRT station very near the hotel providing access right across Singapore, it does take some finding but is clean and efficient too. What doesn’t take finding is the Singapore Flyer and that was walking distance from the hotel. Although I have no immediate plans to return to Singapore if I was I would definitely consider returning to the Marina Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Music all night, roof dripping water...”
Reviews.Author: MinniMari
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights and had to change rooms two times! I was with my 1 year old daughter and first they gave us a room without a bath, even requested one. The next room was quite all right, but we stayed awake listening to the music until 4 o`clock and next day the water started dripping from the roof. The third room was up up and finally we slept the night. The laundry was missing two times and I had to call for it. Also we had to wait for our luggage for over 30 mins when we arrived and even after calling twice, we still didn`t get them to the room! After flying and travelling 18 hours with 1 year old I really needed them. All in all, never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: woody72Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on our way to Korea. Booked a club room, so can only comment on that. The room is modern and tastefully decorated. Bathroom is large with good quality products. Being able to open the sliding door to a small balcony is very welcome for a city hotel. Internet was fast and included in the rate. We found the staff in the club lounge to be very friendly - drinks (Mumm Champagne) flowed freely and breakfast was more than adequate. The pool is very large, though the pool area is not particularly attractive. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SurreyHenny
Reviews.Content: Our room was described as De Luxe and was on floor 15. It was a very comfortable, pleasant room and the space was very well planned. We appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities and the daily provision of complimentary bottled water. The bathroom was spacious with a separate bath and shower. There was a lovely pool, though the loungers were a little "tired" and sometimes in short supply. Pool towels were provided. Breakfast was excellent, with an amazing choice. We preferred to sit outside, although this delightful area was sometimes full. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. My only criticism would be that the cleanliness of the bathroom on our arrival was not 100%.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel in a deluxe room. Internet and breakfast was included in our rate and both were good. Room size is fine and room well appointed. the atrium design of this hotel is very appealing and sets it apart from others we have stayed at. Location is good with airconditioned linkages to a variety of shopping centres and the MTR. Perhaps the only negative to the location is that after a long day on your feet the walk from the MTR is a long one. A new station is being opened some time in the future that will solve this problem. Of course you can catch a cab when you dont want to walk from the MTR. Only had breakfast and drinks at the hotel so cannot comment on food available. the views from the room at night are quite spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but lacks attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: fjve
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from the perspective of a local. Stayed for one night with my partner to celebrate my birthday. We were efficiently checked into our Club room on the top floor from the club lounge. The room was overall modern, spacious and well equipped (but I've heard from friends that the regular rooms were rather dated and small). The Nespresso machine and free cable internet access in the room were nice touches.
