However, we were disappointed when we entered the bathroom and noticed that there was bits of hair on the vanity top and hand towel that was hanging off the vanity top edge (from the last occupant who did some hair trimming persumably). There was also a personal bottle of leftover shower gel that was left in the shower. The bathroom had obviously not been thoroughly cleaned. Called the club lounge staff and they promptly had it re-cleaned. Complimentary cocktails at the club lounge was overall pleasant, with a moderate variety of canapes, bread, cheese and drinks (inc wine and champagne). Was pleasantly surprised with a birthday cake during the cocktail, and as we were already full by then, the staff kindy helped to deliver the cake to our room later that night (was a very delicious and generously sized chocolate cake by the way). Also, the free parking coupon was much appreciated. Downsides to the hotel (other than the initial toilet mishap) included a queue to Aquamarine for breakfast (which did not take longer than a 10 min wait, maybe they were fully occupied as it was chinese new year?), and overall lack of attention to detail. This being said as there was no bed turndown service at night, despite the "make up room" sign being lit up (in fact our room was not attended to by housekeeping at all during our stay - less the re-cleaning of the bathroom); the pool was a little dated and water looked murky with brown plant-like elements within when I was swimming in it; and when I had requested for some wine glasses and cutlery, it took about 30 mins for it to arrive. The stay was thus overall enjoyable (which was largely due to the fact that we had stayed in the club room rather than the regular room). However, having stayed at the Fairmont just a couple months back, and with the better deal I had received there with my Feed At Raffles card (with AMEX platinum), and more importantly, the impeccable service and attention to detail they provided, would prefer to go back to the Fairmont in future for a short local getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sualsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over Christmas and thought it was wonderful. The service was outstanding. The International buffet breakfast was a great way to start the day. Drinks were expensive but then Singapore on the whole is. Would recommed it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Quality but soul-less”
Reviews.Author: crustycrutch
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Marina Mandarin and it was a quality hotel no doubt but it lacked sparkle. Some might say that you don't want 'sparkle' from a hotel but personally I want a hotel where you get a feeling of community especially if you're staying for more than a few days. I left the hotel feeling that I hadn't been able to penetrate it's veneer of commerciality. The staff were all fantastic and couldn't be faulted in terms of service but they were never genuinely friendly. It was almost as if they had been trained in customer service using a specific manual and they stuck to the script religiously. I'm a fairly gregarious guy and will try to strike up conversation with most people to get an insight into their lives - thats what travel is about for me. However, it was just too damned difficult to get past their reserve - perhaps its a Singaporean thing. Facilities wise the hotel is top notch - everything you'd want is there and all is quality. The pool area I found especially attractive especially after a sweaty stroll round Singapore city! The pool attendant was helpful and attentive but, again, somewhat remote. If I had a criticism, it would be the prices of food. I was on a room only deal and having been to Singapore several times before, I knew that the best food is available cheaply at Hawker centres, so I didn't use the hotel facilities. However, for the traveller looking for hotel food, it was pricey but there again they are catering for a specific market.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: scarlett345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin for 2 nights on the way home to Sydney from Europe. We were very tired after a long journey and looking for a relaxing and comfortable hotel to stay in. The Marina Mandarin met our expectations. We arrived in the late afternoon from the airport (taxi around $S25 from the airport) and check in at the hotel was fast and efficient. We had booked a triple room but found on arrival that there are no triple rooms in the hotel which was disappointing, although it was only a few minutes after arriving in our room that a roll away bed was brought in. It was only just big enough for our teenage son but quite comfortable. More calls to reception to fix a problem with the TV and the safe were responded to very quickly. The toom was comfortable and quiet. The huge hotel atrium is awesome, with birds singing each morning and piped music, it sounds like you are in the jungle and is actually very relaxing. Breakfast was included in our package and it was one of the best breakfasts we had during our holiday, with extensive choices to suit all tastes. I can highly recommend the day spa where I had an excellent massage and the pool was also particularly good, with a large, clean pool and plenty of sun lounges. Other travellers have mentioned the location of the hotel- it is next door to the huge Suntec shopping mall, and maybe 10 minutes walk to the Merlion. Really nothing in Singapore is very far away, although the heat often makes the idea of getting a taxi more attractive. Taxis in Singapore are inexpensive and plentiful. While in Singapore we very much enjoyed the Night Safari ($S25 by taxi) and dinner at Clake Quay ($S10 by taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolidays044
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of December on a Singapore Stop over holiday on our way to Phuket. The hotel entrance/reception area and Atrium are really lovely. Staff at the concierge level were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. We arrived at 5.30 in the morning and the gentleman at Reception booked us into our rooms straight away which was a huge bonus being very tired from our flight over. We were on the 7th floor which we requested, the rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms are a little dated but they served our purpose. The hotel is very central especially with the shopping mall that is connected to the hotel and also with the Suntec mall right opposite, we were spoilt with choice for places to eat. There is also a lovely pool on the 5th floor if you just want to relax and always someone available to help you with towels,sun loungers etc. Overall we were very impressed with the staff at the Hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Cornish
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on our return to the UK from Australia. As we payed the same rate as we did for our room at another hotel on the way out, we had expected the same quality of rooms/service etc. Unfortunately we did not get it! We arrived late at night between midnight & 1am. There was no one to meet our car or to take our cases to the concierge desk until the bell boy saw us a few minutes later after appearing from somewhere behind the scenes. Our room was disappointing for a deluxe room - carpets were not looking great and the dust & dirt behind the entrance door was not acceptable. We complained the next morning and were moved to another room with an apology. Unfortunately the new room was as bad, in fact the dust and dirt behind the bedside tables was as bad if not worse! Towels were worn thin and our sheets had holes in them. The hotel has obviously lost its sparkle and is getting very tired as some other reviewers have mentioned. We are not people who normally complain but we did have to mention our concerns on leaving. We have had an email on our return saying that "they were sorry that our stay was not entirely satisfactory, and have shared our comments with the respective teams for their improvement. They hope that we will give them another opportunity to be of service again and look forward to welcoming us back". I think we will give it a miss next time.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and comfortable accomodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: Eleena
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed three nights at the Marina Mandarin in December 2009, including NYE. The staff were always friendly, efficient and obliging. The deluxe room was fantastic with all the amentities most business and leisure travellers would want. A late check out was no problem. The breakfast buffet was extremely varied and well presented - easy to overindulge! The hotel enjoys direct access to the shopping mall and main attractions can be accessed on foot, by subway (nearest is City Hall MRT) or by taxi very easily. The concierge is knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel has very good amenities overall and operates in an effortlessly smooth manner. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Save up if you want to get drunk here”
Reviews.Author: AustinsNottingham
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel is fairly grand, with reception on the 4th floor (you enter at street level with lift access). There are bell boys waiting to take your luggage. Check-in was handled fairly efficiently and we were pleasantly surprised to see not only our room had been upgraded, but our booking now also included breakfast. I’ m not entirely sure why or who was responsible (could have bee our tour operator back in England, as we’d had to change out booking on the day of travel due to their mistake). However, don’t look a gift horse in the mouth… Out flight from Australia meant we’d be checking in around midnight. Incidentally, there were plenty of taxis outside the airport, which got us to the hotel for around SD $20 including tip (£9.30). I seem to remember our travel agent quoting us at least £60 return for a coach transfer, so if ever I were to return I’d get a taxi on spec at the airport again. Anyway, after our check-in we were a little dusty from our Oz flight, so decided to use the voucher for a free drink we’d been given on check-in – 1 voucher per room, not per person. I’d heard Singers was expensive and our bill came to about SD $18 (£8.37) for half a Tiger beer – lucky we got a free one. After our drink we went to our room, which we were very pleased with. Our room was on the 17th floor and was spacious with a large super king (I think) bed, modern furniture and tastefully decorated. The large bathroom was lovely, with Jack and Jill sinks and powerful modern shower. The breakfast was included in our rate. I seem to remember it was around SD $40 pp and I assume that doesn’t include a service charge, which seems to be a pretty standard thing in Singapore. There was a decent selection of Asian and European food on offer and something to suit most tastes. I had cheese omelette, followed by some fruit although on the second day the selection was a little more limited. I guess this was because we arrived closer to finishing time. The location of the hotel was pretty good for our needs. Raffle’s Hotel, where we stopped to do the tourist bit and had a Singapore Sling, was about a 10 minute walk away. On the way, we found roadside restaurants where we had chicken and rice for a couple of Singapore dollars. The hotel is right next to a shopping mall, but then again it seems you are never far from shopping in Singapore. We had a great night with some friends that live in Singapore at the Marriott Hotel. The Hotel offers a buffet in its Marriott Café (http://marriottcafe.singaporemarriott.com), which is very extensive with a fine selection of seafood and meats. The cost was around SD $65 pp for the buffet, or you could upgrade to include wine and beer for around SD $90 pp. Getting around in Singapore by taxis is fairly cheap and easy. We caught a few taxis and everywhere seemed to be no more than SD $10. Apologies for the approx. SD amounts mentioned above, but I didn’t get around to writing this review sooner and November seems a long time ago now. They are on the whole fairly accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Its an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt a few days before moving to this one so in comparison this hotel is really old, has a funny smell, maybe because its got old carpet and not very many windows to bring in fresh air, the room is average, the bed is big and the room has all the things you need, ironing board, dressing gowns, slippers, hair dryer etc. however it doesn't have free wifi. We ordered room service but they got the order completely wrong but they weaved the charges as they realized they got it very wrong! The hotel itself is just a little dated and needs a revamp especially the swimming pool! The Spa is good value but the spa rooms are tiny. Wouldn't stay at this hotel again but still a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller99Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin twice in December 2009 on a one night stop-over to and from New Zealand. On the outward journey we landed at Singapore airport around 6am and although check-in at the Marina Mandarin was not until 2pm they allowed us to check-in at 7am at no extra cost. This was great seeing as we were all shattered, it allowed us to have a few hours sleep before venturing out to see the sights of Singapore. We had 2 rooms with interconnecting doors, both rooms were spacious, very nicely furnished and had great views from the balconies. The hotel is close to the Singapore Flyer and several shopping centres. Our second stay at the hotel was 31/12/09. On checking in at around 5.30pm the hotel was already buzzing with the New Years Eve atmosphere. Singapore on New Years Eve was absolutely fabulous and the hotel could not be better located very near to Marina Bay which was where everyone was congregating for the countdown to the new year. The hotel's pool, on the 5th floor, affords a great view of Marina Bay so we watched the fireworks from there. The firework display went on for about 10 minutes and was fantastic. Inside the hotel at midnight they released thousands of balloons from an upper floor down into the atrium. The hotel was noisy but no more than can be expected on New years Eve and we were warned in advance by a note left in our rooms. Fortunately we were very tired after our flight and with the time difference so we were able to sleep through the party which went on until 2am. The Marina Mandarin was recommended to us by someone who had stayed there previously and I am so glad it was. I would definitely recommed it to anyone staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the Hygiene”
Reviews.Author: HopeCocoa
Reviews.Content: The floor carpet in our room is probably vacuum cleaned, but carpet shampoo is desperately needed. I got bitten in the leg probably by some kind of mite but cannot see what kind of mite it is. The cushions they put on top of the bed (and in front of the pillows) were dirty. Upon closer examinations, we saw dried liquid stains on its brown colored cover cloth. It needs to be washed after every new guest as we don't know what each guest will use it for during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Slow Internet”
Reviews.Author: t-puk
Reviews.Content: Did a speed test and it showed 0.9 mbps, I'll be fuming if its chargeable. Room amenities are somewhat dated, and the bed isn't king-sized. Club Lounge amenities can be improved. The sight of Khong Guan biscuits actually make the place less desirable. However service was prompt and genuine. We were there on NYE and they were running a full house but even with the lounge packed, the ladies did their best by acknowledging the guests and got everyone seated. The pool area should have more chairs and sun-decks, at the moment its just spartan, and with the large crowd its difficult to get any seating or table.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Troy92120
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: Marina Mandarin (Meritus Chain and NOT Mandarin Oriental) DATE OF STAY: 24-27 December 2009 ROOM CATEGORY: Meritus Club Suite AVG PRICE PER NIGHT: 220 euros nett (190 for suite + 30 for guaranteed city view) RATE TYPE: Advance Payment While looking for a pleasant, well-located and reasonably-priced hotel for my recent stay in Singapore, I came across the Marina Mandarin. I looked into the Conrad, the Four Seasons, the Ritz-Carlton, the Grand Hyatt (who never answered my e-mail queries), the Mandarin Oriental, the Stamford and the Swissotel Plaza and finally chose the Marina Mandarin. Not only was I able to book a Club Suite, which are on the top 2 floors, they could guarantee a particular view (for which they charge 30 euros in a suite and 15 euros in a room). The only other hotels who offered this were the Mandarin Oriental and the Ritz-Carlton. The price was very reasonable and included Club Lounge access (2 pieces of laundry/room/day, breakfast, cocktalis, free in-room internet access, late check-out/early check-in, if available). Arriving early in the morning from Paris, I decided to take a shuttle from the airport (very convenient and only 4.50 euros, though a taxi is only around 15 or 20 euros) as I had plenty of time to kill. Upon arrival at the Marina Mandarin, I was swiftly taken up to the Club Lounge and checked-in. My flight landed at 6:45 a.m. and I was in my room at 8:30! The hotel is located on top of the Marina Square shopping center, which is convenient but, ultimately annoying. You can avoid this, however, by exiting the hotel on Raffles Blvd. Unfortunately, this isn't the most pedestrian-friendly part of Singapore, though, as a rule, Singapore isn't teribly pedestrian-friendly with labyrinths of under- and over-street passages. Anyway, the hotel's well-located and the new MRT line will have a station closer than the current City Hall station (which to access you have to walk underground through various shopping centers. My suite was large, around 65 sqm, with 2 balconies. I paid for a Central Business district view but could only really see this from one of he 2 balconies. From the room I could see the cityscape, which was fine. The hotel's at odd angles so I'm not really sure what the views are like from the other rooms. This is an "Atrium Hotel" so the sound does resonate a bit and you can hear the piano on the 4th floor and the Christmas festivities were loud but bearable. PROS: Nice lounge breakfast and cocktails. Prompt room service of high quality and inexpensive (around 25 euros for an appetizer and main course). Very effecient and couteous staff. CONS: Children were allowed in Club Lounge even though it's supposed to be reservered for over-12s. Lounge service disorganized and understaffed at breakfast and cocktail hour. Complicated lighting systems in rooms. Seemed to be a fair number of package tourists, even at the Club level. RECOMMENDED: Yes, if you get a good deal. Wouldn't pay rack rates or equivalent prices to other 5-Star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Elegant, Beautiful...but a bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: semuaputih
Reviews.Content: Been here to attend a 4 days seminar at Suntec Spore. The rooms are clean & spacious, beds are comfortable, the view out windows are great; you can even see the famous Merlin and Esplanade from here.Situated just across the Suntec building, it isn't that far from the nearest MRT station. The food? Well, judging from the price it cost, its kind a average.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_was_a_horse
Reviews.Content: I plan never to stay here again. The service was poor. I booked a room for Christmas Eve without knowing there would be a DJ and a party so loud you couldn't think straight in your room. No problem then; we'll just go to the 5th floor lounge. Cost is $48 per person to be able to sit down on Christmas Eve in the lounge floor. What? I don't fault the hotel for capitalizing on the opportunity but I would not have booked the room had I known. Further, in the club lounge my girlfriend was singled out for a minor dress code violation and kicked out while many many British women were allowed to stay in spite of minor dress code violations. Thought it a bit racist and I don't throw that around lightly. The club lounge was not very good compared to others. Nice view, poor service. The AC broke our last night and after one hour a repairman showed up, declared he could do nothing and we should change rooms, left, and that was it. In the same room, got a couple hours sleep and headed for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and worth the upgrade to the Executive Suites”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early after our flight from Rome so the standard room we had booked was not available until 2pm. Jetlagged and looking very worse for wear we were happy to pay the upgrade fee to the executive suites so that we could check in straight away. The executive rooms are much nicer than the standard room we stayed in on our way over to Europe and I would gladly pay to stay in them again. They are more roomy, have free wifi, an amazing bathroom with a rain shower or massage jets and best of all a super comfy bed. Plus you can have free cocktails and nibblies in the cocktail lounge - provided you dress up a bit (no denim for guys). The location is great - it's a bit tricky to work out but you can access a shopping centre underneath the hotel. Easier though to get a cab to Orchard road as this is where the mega malls are. Would look forward to staying here again. And a further tip - go to Jumbo seafood restaurant at Clark Quay for the BEST chilli crab in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: possumpal
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to Singapore we have stayed at a number of hotels but this is our new favorite. We stayed for 5 days during APEC so security was incredibly tight (anti truck bomb barriers, lots of police and military, searches on entering ) and that was just for entering the hotel . They were all very pleasant and professional. The hotel staff were excellent from meeting us at the security check, taking us to the elevators and to check in staff. We had a Deluxe room on Floor 18 overlooking Suntec. It was large, spacious and well maintained. Flat screen TV, good air conditioning,c bus lighting and electrical system and 12 hours of internet / day included in our rate. The bathrooms were also large with walls of frosted glass, separate bath and shower and plenty of hot water. Lots of towels and quality bath amenities. Plus you could not hear any showers, toilets flushing etc. from other rooms. We ate at the Hotel buffet 2 nights. The food was of a quality expected in a 5 star hotel and the staff very professional but friendly. The hotel is situated close to the Singapore River (good for morning walks), plenty of restaurants and shops, and is a ten minute walk via the underground mall to Raffles Place MRT. We really enjoyed our stay and hope to stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: marinerCoventry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in an Executive Suite for 12 days Nov/Dec 2009, purely on vacation, and enjoyed our stay immensely. We would return to the Marina Mandarin without hesitation both for its location and the level of service we enjoyed. The Executive Suite on 15th floor was really two adjoining rooms, one arranged as a lounge and the other the bedroom, so there were two bathrooms, two TV's, two minibars etc. In truth we did not use the lounge room much, but I guess it was nice having the additional space. However, the really big plus was that we enjoyed Meritus Club benefits. The best part of this was the Meritus lounge on 21st floor. The breakfasts there were really good with a wide selection of hot/cold dishes and eggs made to order. In the evenings there were complimentary drinks and canapes, all delightfully presented and served. The Meritus Club staff were superb under the leadership of Jess. Nothing seemed too much trouble to them. They were always attentive and charming and helped greatly in making our stay so enjoyable. Possibly, for a future stay we would not take a suite, but definitely take a Meritus Club room on 20th/21st floors. Our room was well cleaned by the housekeeping staff, and any small requests were quickly attended to. The maid who serviced our room was always smiling and welcoming and did a great job. I was sorry that she was not around on our last day when we wanted to thank her for all her efforts. We didn't eat too much in the hotel, only because there were so many places to eat close to the hotel. However, the odd meal we did have in Aquamarine Restaurant and in the Atrium Lounge were all excellent. In conclusion, we found all staff at the Marina Mandarin to be superb and the hotel generally was a great base for our Singapore vacation. Our thanks to everyone who made our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Ethical Policy”
Reviews.Author: Ubascuba
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 2 night stop-over on our way back to the UK from Indonesia. The hotel (as the reviews here confirm) is lovely. However, there is one very big issue which I'd like to make everyone aware of. The hotel actively promotes that ii is the first hotel in Asia to support wildlife conservation with the WWF and adds a S$2 to your bill for each night that you stay (see attached photo of their statement). However, that is the contribution from the guest. The hotel's contribution to wildlife conservation is to serve shark fin products in its Peach Blossoms Restaurant. Had I been aware of this, I would never have booked to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the interiors of the room and quality of services they provide.”
Reviews.Author: anirudh22
Reviews.Content: Date 01.06.2009 I booked my trip by the travel agent creative travel shoppe for singapore and cruise. I was with my family enjoyed a lot in singapore and cruise and the hotel marina mandarin very much i love the services they provide and even the architectary of the hotels and it was even qite near to the city so everything was nearly close so it good pleasure to stay there i really like to appriciate the architectury of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with easy access to malls and eateries”
Reviews.Author: MrsJJosiah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the long weekend from 27/11-29/11. We experienced some unhappiness during our check-in. Check-in time was 2pm and even though we had requested for early check-in it was subject to availability. Nevermind, but when we checked-in at 2pm, we were told that only one room was ready and the other connecting room was being cleaned. Nonetheless, we collected the keys to the readied room and waited half an hour before going to the reception to enquire about the other room. On my way down, I saw the cleaning staff and enquired when the room would be ready. Was told he needed half an hour. Which means to say the room would not be ready till 3pm! All our plans would need to be pushed back. So I went to the reception and asked for the keys as they would release the keys only when the room is ready. We stayed on the 19th floor facing Suntec City, Conrad and Pan Pacific hotel. Not much of a view but being on a high floor and away from the noise is a plus as we have a year old baby with us. Room size is ok for 2 adults or max 3 adults with a single bed. We have 3 children with us so we felt a bit crowded with the baby cot and a single bed taking up space. We did not dine at the hotel as the rates are high. There are many options nearby. Food courts at Suntec city, Marina Square or nearby Makansutra hawker centre. There are many restaurants along the stretch of the river. Other than the episode on checking-in, we are quite happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! just not too crazy about their cleaning lady!”
Reviews.Author: dlfn78
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marina Mandarin for 2 nights which got extended to 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location. Tons of places to eat downstairs, connects to suntec mall and marina centre. If you dont mind walking, you can walk to the sites at raffles centre area, singapore flyer, marina and merlion area and the 5 different malls.. its a SGD5-10 cab ride to everything else. Alot of bars, restaurant and live jazz music by the esplanade. just behind the hotel. Apparently the mineral pool is good, unfortunately didn't get a chance to try it. If your going to be spending time at the hotel, ask if its possible to be upgraded to a higher floor say 18 or 19 (definitely worth for the view), if they have the rooms they would accomdate you. Book the Festive Getaway Special they have on their website... if your staying for 2 nights. There is an irish pub downstairs, kinda pricey though for a pint. Poor cleaning lady though, the counters were still dusty, Basically she made the bed, threw out garbage and changed towels and soap. Breakfast if not included in your reservations can be pricey. So make sure its included. Food is good and HOT! Concierge was a great help for booking our tours. There is a bus stop about a minute walk east of the hotel, just past carl's jr., where you can grab a hop on hop off bus. This is great way to go about seeing the city... Hop off when you like what you see and just hop on and go to the next place. 12SGD worth it. Overall definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: LakshmiCologne
Reviews.Content: Big, modern and stylish room with a great view covering the Merlion and the Raffles Hotel and any amenities you expect. Add a Five-star staff and there you got the Mandarina Mandarin. A great experience, even for the experienced and serious business traveller. By the Citylink Mall, there is a convenient air-conditioned access from the hotel to City Hall MRT station. Just one thing to know: as an atrium hotel, you are likely to hear the piano music of the lobby in your room since the doors (and windows, too) are not sound-proof.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveler60
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I have to agree with the disappointed reviewers below. I believe that you have to go for their Executive Floors to enjoy the experience - in a regular standard room you simply don't. First letdown was my room assigned on the 6th floor - to get to my room I had to walk past several meeting rooms! Later on realized that the noise traveling up from the 4th floor restaurant would drive me crazy, and was able to get a room higher up. The staff, by the way, were great, very helpful and very accommodating. I was mainly disappointed by the room itself - it is small, noisy and the bathrooms, though clean, clearly outdated. The ceiling vent had probably not been cleaned in months, but other than that, no complaints about cleanliness. However, the towels are very thin and worn, as was the bathrobe that even had holes! I had not expected this in a five-star hotel. I have to admit I did not try any of the F&B outlets in the hotel as I found them extremely expensive and chose to eat out. Oh, and if you are sensitive to cold, don't go for this hotel. The aircondition knows only freezing cold or warm and the speed cannot be adjusted at all. I did not have a terrible experience in this hotel, but simply a very disappointing and felt it was definitely not worth my money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: squirrel2203
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the way to New Zealand and were very impressed. We'd booked a city view room and when we opened the balcony doors there was the Singapore skyline before us! The room itself was great and had plenty of room with good quality fittings and furnishings - it seemed to have been recently refurbished although I suspect the bathroom hadn't (much orangey-red marble and the strangest red grouting around the floor!). Saying that, it was still very clean and spacious with a separate shower cubicle. The breakfast was good with a huge choice of cooked and continental, both Western and Chinese. The only real negative is the prce of the drinks in the hotel bar - a pint of lager cost S$20! Admittedly alcohol is quite expensive in Singapore anyway but around £10 a pint is pretty steep! The staff were great too - they waived the intenet usage charge so we could check in online for our onward flight and the reception and concierge staff were very polite and helpful. Location wise the hotel is excellent - a 10 minute walk from the nearest MRT station through two (air-conditioned!) shopping malls and again a 5-10 minute walk from Marina Bay with bars, restaurants and a great Hawker Centre (food stalls) where the beer and food are cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Angeljkk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. We booked a club room, so had access to club areas. The food was excellent, the service was excellent. The rooms are decorated to a high spec, very asthetically pleasing, the reception areas is also very attractive, as the rest of the hotel. Excellent display of art work. Some may think it's a little expensive, but we found it to be good value for what you get. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever....”
Reviews.Author: Oxforshire_Leejones
Reviews.Content: From the moment we landed at singapore airport we were treated like we were the only people there. We were met by a driver who took us to the hotel, we had to pay for this service but i think it is worth it. When we arrived at the hotel we were met by melanie who took us straight to our room to private check in. Now we did book the presidential suite so the service i thought was for that reason but we saw them doing it with everyone which was great. All i can say about the room is wow, we had a dinning room table that sat 18 people which was a little excessive but hey. We had 6 balconies and a massage chair which i could not get out of so all in all amazing. The concierge was amazing very helpful and if you speak to paulo who is the manager of this he is great. Now to the bad parts which there always is. The restaurants at the hotel.. We ate at the italian which advertises there chef as this amazing cook which im afraid he isnt. We had lasgne and i had the chefs fish selection. On this there was white fish, scallops and longastine. The white fish was not deboned the scallops were over cooked and the longastine i could not even eat. My partner lasagne was over cooked as if it was done in the microwave. I told the waiter and to be fair he took both off our bill. The next night we thought we would go to the buffet which had a great selection but even though it was a buffet and you could have as much as you wanted we came out of there still hungry very strange. So i would recommend this hotel to all of you but dont eat at the restaurants go into the city we tried raffles the next day for lunch in the long bar and it was great i love the whole throwing your monkey nut shells on the floor. Also you have to have a singapore sling there to there are great as i found out after 4 lol.

Reviews.Title: “Briallant hotel, great location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Kash_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel it has the biggest atrium in South East Asia, location was great as there is a door on the third floor which leads directly into the mall. Soon as you walk in you are greeted by someone & they take you for the check in & into your room. Rooms could be slighlty bigger as we booked the club rooms but that's Singapore for you. The views of the marina are not really worth it as the shape of the hotel the rooms don't really face the water. Service was great but the club lounge was ok, not really that much choice for food especially if you are a vegetarian. The weather in Singapore is always humid as it sits right on the equator, even at night so be ready for the heat & humidity when you travel. Would definitely stay again beautiful hotel highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All the exemplary service you expect from a Far Eastern 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GoodLifeForMe
Reviews.Content: A super quality hotel. Go for Meritus Club rooms – worth the extra (got a very good deal on Expedia). Rooms spacious and on top floors. Means you get free breakfast in Executive lounge on 20th Floor, and also free drinks/cocktails (anything you like really including Champagne) plus endless canapés and even some hot food “nibbles” between about 6pm and 8pm, so having arrived on a long flight and well fed, we didn’t even need Dinner. Meritus Club includes 2 free items of laundry a day – hubbie sent a shirt off with his key card in the pocket (!) – it was returned immediately.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeson28
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Singapore and stayed for the first time at this hotel. We have visited Singapore many times and stayed at hotels near to this one and others in the city area, but will definately return to this hotel. Upgraded to the Meritus club lounge which included breakfast and dinner drinks. The staff were fantastic, the room was one of the best we have stayed in and we have travelled extensively around the world, very comfortable, great beds, and ameneties, bathroom was large and well fitted out. The cocktail lounge at night was comfortable with soft music, and well worth a visit. Views from the hotel room were terrific right out to sea and over to the river, at night it was bueatiful. The staff could not of been more helpful, and were waiting to greet us on our arrival. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to be spoilt and somewhere to relax in on your trip to Singapore, I will not be staying in any other hotel when we ruturn to Singpore but this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous service.”
Reviews.Author: Jawsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October 2009. We were supposed to stay here for 3, but had to delay our flight to Singapore by a day due to my having contracted food poisoning in Kuala Lumpur. As a result, I didn't see much of Singapore, but did see a lot of the hotel! We were upgraded, which was very pleasant. The room was comfortable, fairly average size for a hotel room, with a lovely, big and comfortable bed. The bathroom was a good size, and very nice. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, really tall and with lots of fountains and comfortable seating etc. Lots of places to have a drink, and lots of places to eat. They have birdsong playing, which is a little odd at first, but quite relaxing after a while. The service is fantastic - everywhere you go, people literally can't do enough for you, and are really helpful. We definitely weren't disappointed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly noisy, a very disappointing stopover”
Reviews.Author: otisness
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night on the way home from London to Sydney, to break the trip and get some sleep. The design of the hotel, although very striking, means that the atrium acts as an ampitheatre, which meant that the noise: live music and large crowd in the lobby, travelled straight up through our door and kept us awake for hours. Once that stopped early in the morning, the neighbouring disco continued until the wee hours. The whole purpose of the visit was negated, with no-one in the family getting more than an hour or so sleep.

Reviews.Title: “National Day 09 @ Marina Mandarin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D3vilicious
Reviews.Content: National Day Parade has been a yearly highlight for every Singaporean. This year, I and my family wanted something different and since we can’t get hold of the free tickets, we went out looking through hotel rates that are near the floating platform. After surveying between top notch hotels around the Marina Bay area, we booked Marina Mandarin Premier Room 19th Floor exactly 2 months from the actual date. And it was definitely worth it. Not only was it affordable (around SGD450 per night) we managed to catch the parade minus those crowds in our comfortable hotel room!! Do look thru the pictures aite!!

Reviews.Title: “Good 5 star hotel at Marina Square”
Reviews.Author: DamienOfSydney
Reviews.Content: During our stay in SIngapore we stayed at both Grand Mercure Roxy (my review: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g294265-d299850-r45205293-Grand_Mercure_Roxy_Hotel-Singapore.html#CHECK_RATES_CONT ) and Marina Mandarin. Overall, we preferred the Grand Mercure for its location (and very easy city access), room and general atmosphere/feel despite its 4 star rating. We preferred the staff and bathroom at the Marina Mandarin. The positive: - the room has a balcony - the bathroom had two sinks and separate shower/bath tubs - it is conveniently located for those who want to be in Marina Bay. The City Hall MRT is close by and #36 bus (to Orchard Rd and Changi airport) is just downstairs - the hotel looks impressive (especially the atrium) - ihe swimming pool looks nice and big enough to swim (towels provided at pool) - Peach Blossom chinese restaurant offers great food and excellent waiting staff - great jazz singer and pianist at the bar - staff was proactive and prompt to answer queries (concierge did his utmost to get us at the airport in early morning, reception organised for cleaning staff to turn up within 15 mins and reception manager/supervisor genuinely seems to care). Aspects which could be improved: - whilst not exactly small, rooms were smaller than at the Gd Mercure - the shower had mould which cleaning staff could not get rid of - noisy: from the 13th storey, we could here traffic noise through the single glazed windows and jazz duo through the door (although to be fair I had no problem sleeping) - TV signal was quite poor. Whilst we would consider coming back to Marina Mandarin, we thought our first hotel offered more value due to room space and location (#36 bus takes you to Marina Square in 10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Splendid finale to a memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandSascha
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from the Greek Islands to Singapore at 6 am feeling shattered - as we had booked a Meritus club room we were able to check in early and fell into the very comfortable bed (and wonderful pillows) after a superb shower. Loved the Meritus club facilities - breakfast with a view and lovely service, cocktails and canapes were a treat, and the staff very helpful and discreet. Even at the pool, when we visited for a swim in the rain we were escorted with a large umbrella by the pool attendant to a cabana and he then proceeded to lay 2 towels for each of us on the loungers - great service and charmi. We immensely enjoyed our two night stay at the Marina Mandarin and, as we enjoy Singapore as a stopover when longhauling, we will want to return. Book online at the hotel website and check out the deals. A good thing to do , if you don't mind the height, is the Singapore Flyer - the views are mangnificent and we took great photos. As it rained during our 2 days we took the underground shopping walk to Raffles City and exited to Raffles for lunch at their coffee shop and a browse in their gift shop - just love the ambience and the rickshaw driver outside. Sad to leave and could have stayed another day or two at the Marina Mandarin. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Melvin0822
Reviews.Content: My advice is stay at the Club Floor if you got the time to enjoy the Lounge and amenities. It is most likely the best value for money Club Floor (or Executive Floor, whatever the hotels may call them) in the Marina Bay area. Offers a great view of the Night Race for F1 fans during the Singapore F1 Grand Prix.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: marinautama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very strategic location, linked to Marina Square and 3 minute walk to City Hall MRT. The room we stayed in was great, with an open air balcony that looked out to the Singapore Flyer and the Esplanade. We got a fruit basket and candies to welcome us, the check in officer gave us a fuss free late checkout till 1 O'clock. The service was fabulous, couldn't find anything wrong with the hotel really.........Love it love it love it

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, a truely memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional, a real five star plus hotel. All acolades go to the staff and management. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough for a luxury stay. I would encourage you to upgrade to the club room which is way beyond expectations. This is the best hotel we have stayed in. On entering the hotel we were immediately greeted and attended to. We were escorted all the way from check in to our room and shown all the amenities in our room. We were given a cooling towel at check in. We were so delighted to be allowed in our room well before check in time as we arrived early. The hotel foyer with its atrium is something else. Everywhere you look there is such attention to detail, really equisite. The views and location are ideal. Going up in the lift that overlooks the atrium is fun. With a special coffee maker in the room and a fantastic shower, which was more like a stand up spa we were spoilt all the time. The turn down service with a little treat left on the bed was a lovely touch. The bathroom amenities were top quality. The staff are very impressive, they are very professional but without being robotic. They really make you feel at home and comfortable. The club room was awesome, you couldn't want any more and even surpasses expectations. They serve Mumm champagne at evening cocktails with a wide choice of food available. The choice of cocktails was very good. We tried the Singapore Sling whilst there. During the day the club room even has a wide choice of snacks available including chocolates, chips and even cashew nuts. There was a separate room for internet access and plenty of computers available. This hotel is perfect and if there was anything to be a little negative about it would be the size of the room which is not exactly spacious. But the soft colours makes it feel very comfortable. Again, I thank the staff for making it a very special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed three weeks and had an exceptional time.”
Reviews.Author: MrAWG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one we remember from the 1980s and chose it because of the many positive reviews on trip advisor. The hotel is spectacular to look at from the outside even though it is not one of the tallest. The wide open atrium is very impressive and everyone gets a balcony room. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall which has numerous restaurants, but, best of all, is the food court/hawker centre where you can dine for next to nothing. Choices would be the roti prata or fish ball mee for breakfast, Katong laksa for dinner. There are many other choices each a delight. The hotel bar and restaurants are a little pricey. The staff were very attentive to all our needs - although a better command of English by the greeting staff might be an adavantage (but they are so very beautiful it hardly seems worth mentioning). Check in staff and concierge excellent (especially Mr Rafi).

Reviews.Title: “disappointing stay - building work - severe 24/7 noise”
Reviews.Author: FlopsyUk
Reviews.Content: It's not the fault of this hotel that they have building work being carried out a short distance away. This means that the view from one side of the hotel is of a buildings work and the noise is disruptive 24 hours a day. The worst part was from midnight onwards and is very audible in the room. Even ear-plugs made no difference and it makes the whole experience very unpleasent. How can one enjoy the room and the view with loud drillings and banging? Spoiled the stay for us. Other noise problems come from the design of the hotel and because of the atrium design noise from the bar (such as the pianist singer) comes through to the rooms even on the higher floors at night. We had a late checkout as part if our room rate but the hotel claimed not to have received our request then would not honor it fully. I had it in print clearly. Took pressure to get this in the end and as it was one of the major reasons why we chose the hotel initailly very annoying. We did use the business lounge and found it was too small and crowded for the people there. It felt more like a normal restaurant and bar due to this. So if you are booking a club room for the peaceful breakfast that would be a mistake. The mineral water filled pool is a plus but it lacks the ambience and atmosphere of other similar Singapore hotels. Very stark area and when I used the pool it was full of people swimming lengths and getting angry when others got in their way. I'm disabled and it was a bit intimidating. Not had this problem before and wonder if the pool is being used by Singapore residents, such as businessmen after work and they come here purely to swim lengths. There are many postive points about this hotel and it comes down to personal taste in the end. This hotel was not for us - we like quieter, less glitzy and less crowded but many people would disagree. Just be aware that until the noise (building) problem is resolved this hotel has a serious problem.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ClaytonO
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the deluxe room which was clean and modern. Bathroom was excellent and spacious with a double vanity and a separate shower and bath. View from balcony was beautiful overlooking the CBD. Staff very extremely helpful, even during check-in they asked when our return flight was and offering us late check-out (I did'nt even have to ask). They even had birds singing in the lobby during the day. Location is excellent, direct access to the Marina shopping mall and connected to SunTec city mall. Also only 10 minutes walk to the MRT, and best of all most of the walk is through underground airconditioned malls! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: twchix
Reviews.Content: Our flight got in late and we checked in pass midnight. When we got to the room, we realized a lot of in room amenities were not there. WE only got 2 big towels in the bath room and that was it. It was near 2am, so we didn't want to make a big fuss at that hour. Next morning, I noticed on both of our pillows, there were huge brown stains on it which really looked disturbing. A closer look, I realized that's burn marks from ironing. You would think a 5 star hotel would just throw those away instead of still using them. Then I tried to rince the bath tub with the shower head, the water was spraying everywhere coz the hose came loose. I had to mop the floor with the only big towels we had. I went down to tell them the condition of the room was less than satisfactory, all they could say was " Should wee change the room for you?" We already unpacked everything, so we couldn't be bothered. But there's no other gesture or any service recovery or so. For a 5 star hotels which costs more than 300 SGD a night, honestly, I expect more. It was not worthy the price we pay at all for what we had .There are plenty nice hotels in Singapore cost less than Marina Mandarin, but provided much more . It could have been a very nice hotel coz the location and the room is very nice. Shame that service could not keep up with the others....

Reviews.Title: “ASIA-TOUR-2009! The Leading Hotels of the World - 05LHW09 - One of the best in Singapore - Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer007Dublin
Reviews.Content: After our flight with Air Asia from Kuala Lumpur ( see our profile for our reviews of much more hotels who are part of our ASIA-TOUR-2009 ) to Singapore as part of our ASIA-TOUR-2009 we have taken the Airport Shuttle Bus Service ( 18 Singapore Dollars for us two! ) to our stunning hotel the Marina Mandarin Singapore in around 30 min. located at the Marina Bay opposite the Merlion and beside the Singapore Flyer, the world' s largest moving free-standing wheel ( higher than the London Eye even! ). A location which is perfectly described as magnificent. We had been welcomed to our hotel with smiles and personal check-in at our room no. 1602 on the 16th floor, which boasts superb views over the Marina, the Esplanade Theater and over the Marina Mandarin' s Swimming-pool landscape. Our check-in was fast and friendly and our luggage was also delivered in no time within minutes. We also had received free water for two and signature chinese welcome pineapple cakes! The first thing we had seen was the WOW! Atrium which stretches all 21 floors, Folks! Our room was very modern and had been recently renovated with a clear message of luxury and relaxation in mind incl. a large 37inch Panasonic LCD TV which offered BBC World News, CNBC, Asia News Channel, korean TV, japanese TV, local TV, malay and arabic TV plus Pay TV movies for 18 SGD plus 5% tax. Our room had many asian accents and muted colours of the exotic east plus a large comfortable queen-sized bed with white linen and several pillows to choose from. Overall the room had a colour scheme incl. cream, gold, brown and beige all en-lighted by the massive floor to ceiling windows and our 16th floor balcony with massive views over Singapore and the people downstairs moving to and from the pool! We also had a fully stocked mini-bar, glas fixtures and large mirrors and a very modern writing desk and executive style seating was also on offer for us, Folks! We should not forget the resident artist with studio at the Marina Mandarin which is well worth a look! Plus the fabulous art on the wall especially on the fifth level of the Atrium! The hotels location is also somewhat of a shopper' s paradise as well with such malls as the Suntec City Mall and Millenia Walk to name a few as neighbours to the hotel. Plus many other hotels count as neighbours of the Marina Mandarin incl. the Conrad Singapore and the Mandarin Oriental and the Ritz-Carlton Millenia Singapore and others. The hotel is rather famous for eating and drinking as well and we enjoyed a superb dinner at the world-famous Ristorante Bologna located at Level 4 in the stunning Atrium of the Marina Mandarin - the restaurant is one of the best italian restaurants in Asia and has won many awards over the years! We enjoyed the following incl. red wine from Tuscany ( 2005 ), Aqua Panna waters, a Bologna Cesar Salad ( the best! ), one signature lasagna fresh out of the oven, my better half enjoyed incl. her Tagliolini with lamb ragout and her tiramisu and we also had a Zabaglione with masala wine and hazelnut crunch. Such Dinner stays in our memories a very very long time! This Restaurant come highly recommend and it offers also refreshing prices, too! The Service was professional all the way and very friendly and the atmosphere oozed of real charm in the heart of Singapore. During our stay we enjoyed also 2x breakfast at the Aquamarine Restaurant which was always very well visited in the morning and incl. the following: coffee, pineapple juice, waffles, fruits selection, yoghurt and nuts selection, bread selection, jam and butter selection plus peanut butter, miso soup ( so good! ), chicken sausages, vegetable selection, salad and fruit compote plus bircher muesli, apple juice, salad with thousand island dressing and muffins! Plus much much more! We sat on both sided on each morning incl. on the terrace and the indoor Restaurant! Beautiful presentation and the choice make this breakfast a real winner on our second visit to Singapore! The hotel offers a superb choice of wining and dining incl. chinese, italian ( which we tried for dinner! ), international, Senses - The Patisserie, 24h Roomservice ( which we also tried incl. Chicken Satay with rice dumplings and full condiments incl. red onions, cucumbers, Chicken Lhaksa, and two creme brulee vanilla, all first-class and well priced for such a superb hotel! ) We should also mention the stunning Atrium Lounge and Bar which was busy with locals and guests from around the world on each evening! During our stay at the Marina Mandarin we had taken the opportunity to visit also the world famous Raffles Hotel incl. the Raffles Museum, Long Bar for a Singapore Sling and visited the Raffles Creamery for ice-cream and the Raffles Shop for memories! We had also seen two wedding celebrations at the Raffles! Wow, Folks! Another Singapore highlight was the view over Singapore from the 70th floor of the Swissotel, The Stamford Hotel ( the highest hotel in South-East Asia ) which lies within walking distance from the Marina Mandarin and can be done with the Raffles Hotel in one go! Wow, Folks - again! We also have visited again the Merlion - the symbol and protector of Singapore! This should be all done while staying at the Marina Mandarin - one of the best hotels in Asia and indeed the world! The hotel offers also a fantastic pool with terrace over Singapore and water fountains plus pool bar and the pool is open 24h each day of the year! Wow, Folks! The St. Gregory Spa is a member of the Leading Spa' s of the World and the hotel is also a member of the Leading Hotels of the World! ( Singapore' s only member at this exclusive chain of hotels! ). We had 2 nights / 3 days at this urban oasis in the heart of stunning Singapore. This was our second visit to the Lion City and we look now forward for many more visits to come to Singapore in the long-term future! Our time here at Singapore was fast and the check-out of the hotel was fast and friendly with many a greeting and love of come-backs as well plus our booked Hotel Limousine to the Changi International Airport - a black brand-new BMW 5 Series by the way with uniformed driver as a highlight of transport of our stay! We also highly recommend the Airport Shuttle Bus Service for superb views from the mini-bus from the Airport into Singapore, which we had taken from the Changi Int. Airport! We highly recommend the hotel for value, location, shopping, sightseeing and people who love hotels and Singapore like we do! Now we were off with Air Asia to Kuala Lumpur again, but before we visited the brand-new and exciting Crowne Plaza Changi Airport Hotel at Terminal 3! Well done! Singapore you are a great City to Fly! So do not forget to FLY!STAY!EXPLORE! MORE! and learn while you can during exploration in spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Dibaco
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this impressive hotel in Singapore for three days for work. The hotel is simply amazing. Expect a Burj-Al-Arab style atrium, hostesses on many floors, large luxurious rooms, friendly staff, super (fast) room service and outstanding breakfast buffet. In-hotel access to the Marina shopping mall for hours of shopping should you wish to. Well equipped gym with good instructor. All this at the price of a mediocre hotel in Europe. Wauw!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view from the Balcony”
Reviews.Author: maydaymusic
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for 2 night in Singapore. 15-20 min time from the Airport. Convenient access to all shopping mall. Good area. Hotel breakfast is over priced. It would be better if the internet and breakfast are free. Room is wonderful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “5 star!”
Reviews.Author: TreveP
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Marina area is really cool. Suntec complex is right opposite. MRT within walking distance. Good breakfast. Hotel has plenty of restaurants, altho in Singapore better to eat out

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: thirdsunday
Reviews.Content: I had the honour of helping at my buddy's wedding, as the wedding photographer. The very generous couple put me and my family up for the night at your hotel and we had a very pleasant stay over the weekend. The morning after the wedding, I took my 18 month old daughter to the hotel swimming pool. At the poolside, a member of the hotel's staff, a gentleman called David, attended to us. From the moment we arrived, he greeted us with a warm smile, showed us to a deck chair, etc... general service was excellent. When my daughter climbed out of the swimming pool and shivered because a strong wind was blowing, David quickly ran to her and wrapped a towel around her. When I was drying her up, David came to us with a cup of warm water and a straw for her to drink. That's just one example. Needless to say, we had a very nice time by the pool that morning. I could go on and on, but I think you get the picture, the standard of service was awesome. Thumbs up to David and to Marina Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: dmrres
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just down the road from the Swissotel however it seems a million miles away as it is so quiet, you have Marina Square mall attached and suntec city just across the road, a little confusing at first as the front desk is not the check in desk that is on floor4, service much better than that of the Meritus Mandarin. Overall a good hotel for ¾ nights. Pool very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, hard to find fault!”
Reviews.Author: AndyMaxx
Reviews.Content: We made Singapore our first port of call on a 3 week holiday, and stayed for 4 nights at the Marina Mandarin. First impressions were very good, very helpful, courteous staff upon arrival, swift check in on the Club Floor, and a mind blowing atrium! We were on the top level of the hotel, and looking down to the ground floor bar/lobby area was a site to be enjoyed each time we came or went. We had originally asked for a Marina Bay view and paid a small fee to enjoy this privilege, thinking it would be a bay view with the city skyline behind. We were wrong - it was only bay view, which is apparently what most guests request. However picturesque it may be, albeit with a big building project across the water, city skyline views are always the best for us, and we managed to change room next morning, and without asking, they adjusted the room rate down! We were so pleased we did, having a beautiful view of the colonial governmental buildings, Swissotel, business district, etc. For the rest - superb breakfast and cocktail hours in the Club Lounge, refreshing swimming pool, oh so comfy beds, great shower, amazing, genuine service throughout our stay, easy peasy walking distance to City Hall MRT (through a shopping mall tunnel if you so please). Just had the most perfect stay, to start our big holiday! Singapore - we must see city with the tastiest food ever, great shopping, and lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of a world trip”
Reviews.Author: gailandgrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our last stop on a round the world trip. We stayed in the Meritus club suites at the hotel and it was absolutely awesome. Everybody was so helpful and polite, It was the perfect end to a perfect holiday . A 5 star experience in a 5 star city. The restaurants are awesome the shopping is awesome, the staff are awesome. I will be back for sure. If you only stay at one place this is the place to go

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic facility”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: The room was fine and service was good. What stood out was that it is "attached" to a shopping center 9not particularly upscale) and the place was hopping! A younger crowd, under 30, which was OK...just a lot of people enjoying themselves. Just stayed overnight to board a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWPDWR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin at the start of our Honeymoon and we thought it was fantastic. The atrium is out of this world, they have created an oasis inside which feels like you are outside! There is a roof top terrace with a small pool and a lovely bar. Everything about this hotel is fabulous - the rooms, the bar, the breakfast area, the staff..... It was a lovely place to start our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShashiMumbai
Reviews.Content: This is very near to the famous Marina Beach, on Orchard Road thats shopping paradise, try the hotels Shopping center for Big Brands there are all of them the Hotel is a Seven Star

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Seasinger
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel and got the weekend rate of 240 Singapore dollars, inclusive of breakfast for two, late checkout and a 30 dollar voucher to be used at any of the hotel's restaurants. We got a room on the 9th floor, which was clean and well kept, but it is obvious that it has seen better days. There were stains on the cushions, and the toilet although huge, had a leaking showerhead. My biggest disappointment was the noise. The room overlooked a fountain/waterfall and the sound of water could be heard quite distinctly. It may be soothing for some, but if you're sensitive to noise, then you would need a higher floor. Worst of all, the evening entertainment at the lobby lounge could be heard in the room till midnight. And this was with the TV on in an attempt to drown out the singing! The management needs to look into soundproofing the rooms. The highlight of the stay was the dinner buffet at AquaMarine. The seafood was fresh and the variety of dishes was quite impressive. In terms of location, the Marina Mandarin can't be beat, but there are other hotels in the area which also have competitive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: traggs
Reviews.Content: As with all 4 to 5 star hotels in asia it's pretty hard getting a bad one. No negatives at all shop around all sites for prices, we paid $220 Aus. Saw it on some sites at $350+

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great Service”
Reviews.Author: Austrian30
Reviews.Content: Service was great, rooms a little bit old but ok. great if you are on a mixture between business and holidays

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but warm”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: My room was normal size on the 20th floor, very comfortable with an excellent view. Room tended to be very warm if you take the room key out of the energy control as the A/C turns off after a while. When you get back in it took quite a while to cool off and I started to use another card while I was out only to find that this card had been taken out by the maid. Also in the restaurants,,elevators and other areas I found the A/C to be inadequate. But really this was a minor thing and all in all I would certainly come back as the location is great for Seatec events and the rate very favourable.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel in a Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: RichieS77
Reviews.Content: Overdue.. yes, but better late than never! I stayed at the hotel as part of my honeymoon. It was the last leg of a 15 night trip to Malaysia and Singapore. From the moment we landed, my wife and I were sure our trip to Singapore would be something special. For all of you who have experienced Changi Airport, you will understand how efficient, clean and spacious it is. There is no hassle whatsoever in getting off the plane and making your way to the transport points to be on your way to your hotel. We didn't arrange a private transfer to our hotel as you can probably do it much cheaper yourself. We caught a taxi to the hotel and it was about 18 S$. As you approach the exit of the terminal you queue respectfully at the taxi rank and, on average, have to wait no more than a few minutes to get your ride. To the hotel we went. As we arrived we were greeted by the staff and escorted up to the, I think, the fourth floor to check in. This process took only a few minutes and before we knew it we were at our room, unpacking clothes for the third time! The room was very spacious, clean and had all the amenities you'd expect from a 'Leading Hotel of the World'. The room had a mini bar, TV with satellite channels, complimentary water and fruit, and all the usual bathroom products that save you hoarding shampoo all around Asia! The hotel itself has a magnificent looking atrium, with numerous restaurants and bar. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast and found this an asset to the hotel. You had a selection of east and west delights and were as fresh as you can get. The service from the staff was very efficient. We made use of the wonderful, refreshing pool on a number of occasions as it was a welcome relief from the very sunny, hot and humid weather that you get in Singapore. The pool area has a number of sunloungers and very attentative staff taking food and drinks orders. We loved the pool area! 10/10 for the hotel as a whole. Singapore has lots to offer travellers of any age. It a modern, bustling city that oozes style. The daytimes can be spent wandering around the city, visiting places such as Chinatown (amazing selection of handcrafts, clothes, foods etc), Boat and Clarke Quay for its amazing selection of bars and restaurants (whatever you type of cuisine you are sure to find it here), the Marina area just opposite the hotel and the famous shopping area of Orchard Road. We visited all of the above and thoroughly enjoyed. We even took a very touristy boat ride up the Singapore River, well when in Rome etc!! All good fun and gives you a feel for Singapore as it is today! We also visited Sentosa Island. Its ok for a day trip but wouldn't stay there! Its packed with tourists thsi is something I try to avoid these days. Saying that we had a good day there. There is an aquarium and other attractions but most of all there were decent, man made beaches, good views across the Straits and a Cafe Del Mar (Good music of course!). The cable car over is probably the best bit - although if you are nervous of heights, as I am, don't look down!! :-( The nightlife is fantastic! There are so many bars and restaurants you will never get round them all. Our first stint of nightlife was at an old convent complex called Chijmes. It had a good selection of bars, clubs and restaurants and was only a short walk from the hotel. The main area, that we loved from the second we got there was the Boat and Clarke Quay areas. The latter is so energetic it’s contagious! Wonderful bars and restaurants and the perfect way to end your day or early morning as I found!! The costs in Singapore are on par with the UK depending on where you went. Food and drink can be expensive or as close to your budget as you like - we ate in the food courts on one or two occasions and loved the atmosphere, food (if you like Asian fare then you will be spoilt for choice and it won’t break the bank - very cheap in these places for food) and people. When we were there the Singapore authorities were having a practice run for their national day parade. We were lucky enough to see military parades, flyovers and the most amazing firework display I've ever seen - I just wish I was there for the real thing (in Aug I think). We loved Singapore. The city is a modern metropolis that has charm, culture and the best nightlife around. Its people are very friendly and always on hand to offer advice if needed. As far as big cities go, I always felt safe and never intimidated. The hotel is an excellent base to explore the city and would highly recommend it to all who wishes to visit the city. If I ever return here I will be sure to stay here again. Thanks to the staff of the hotel and people of Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Club Level”
Reviews.Author: LucindaGray
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 6 nights (Mon - Sunday) in a Club room on the 21st floor. During a previous visit to Singapore in august we stayed in a club room at the Oriental (which was outstanding) but due to tighter purse strings this seemed like a good compromise. Which is most definitely was. We booked our room through hotels.com which was hassle free. Upon arriving at the hotel we were escorted up to the Club level to check in which was dealt with professionally and efficiently. we were taken to our room and the usual guidance was provided. The room itself was large and spacious with all of the amenities you would expect with a high end hotel. Being a female I like to check out the toiletries which I was pleased to see were by Elemis. :) The Club lounge itself is not as big as some other hotels and is split into a separate dining area and 'lounge' area. The breakfast was plentiful and a good selection available. as a club guest you can dine at the hotel's main restaurant Aquamarine which I did once but found the service very hit and miss. The internet connection is excellent and the cocktail hours are good. They serve Mumm champagne, a variety of beers, spirits, cocktails and red/white wine. In all honesty if you are on a leisure break in this wonderful city and enjoy an evening tipple then upgrading to a club room is worth every penny. in a city were it costs S$14 for a beer the costs soon mount up! Drinks are served with a canape buffet which was ok but not great. The Club staff were generally wonderful, there were a couple of surly ones but i have found this to be fairly normal. The other staff members more than make-up for grumpy colleagues. We had a problem with our room after our first night, namely that there was a strange water seepage through the bathroom floor. After informing the club lounge manager, a maintenance man was sent to our room and the leak inspected. it turned out that they were going to have to take out the shower and toilet for a burst pipe and they moved us to another room. This was handled in a very efficient manner and within 20 mins we were in our new room with our clothes hung up in the wardrobe. In regards to the rest of the hotel everything seemed of a high standard. The fitness room was more than adequate and had a reasonable selection of free weights and cardio machines. The pool was also very good. I did not visit the spa although it is meant to be excellent. We enjoyed a fabulous meal in the Peach Blossom restaurant which was surprisingly well priced. For starters and mains with soft drinks and Chinese tea the cost was about £38 as guests also receive a 20% discount. We also enjoyed late evening drinks in the main Atrium bar were they have a pianist and a singer. This normally finishes around midnight. Costs in this bar are high with a bottle of Jacobs Creek Cabernet Sauvignon at S$65 a bottle! Location wise I found it to be excellent. I like the Marina Bay area a lot as it is fairly quiet and is being developed rapidly. The hotel has a connecting doorway to the marina shopping centre which has a great food centre on the top level and good shopping. You can also walk through this to Raffles City via the Raffles Citylink shopping mall making the MRT station about 10 mins away when walking at a leisurely pace. I would stay at this hotel again as the price per night was very good for the standard and club level facilities. It wouldn't be my first choice in Singapore but it does come a close second.

Reviews.Title: “Service with smiles”
Reviews.Author: rubysophie
Reviews.Content: Lovely friendly staff and locals in a lovely spotlessly clean hotel. Good breakfast where the staff were very efficient - nothing was a bother to them. Peach Blossoms restaurant served us with the best chinese meal we have ever had,and we have had a few. Try the monkey head mushrooms in wasabi sauce - to die for. We had four great days in this hotel - easy walking to Raffles, Clarke key, Singapore flyer and the marina front. Shops galore surrounding it. You can enter the shopping mall from the hotel. In fact if it rains, you can walk all over Singapore in underground malls.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning”
Reviews.Author: ViolinDingue
Reviews.Content: The Atrium was amazing, flooded with the sound of real bird song in the morning. As with most things in Singapore the drinks were a little expensive, the hotels breakfasts were superb, we tried out many of the facilities of this hotel and the were all excellent. The bar opposite 'Balaclava' was a great place to spend an evening out drinking and was far superior for atmosphere than the Raffles. Would recommend a massage / spa facilities, ideal preparation for flight home.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Much Better in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older five-star hotels in Singapore. They have "upgraded" it, but it still has single-pane windows (traffic noise), air conditioning with no fan speed control (and not much control over the room temperature), and small rooms (in mine, you could not open one of the night stand drawers fully because it hit the one chair in the room). The bathroom had a separate shower, but only one sink and not much counter space. Although they have lots of staff standing around, service is mediocre--after waiting 20 minutes for a porter to help with my bags, I just carried them myself on check-out. Singapore has lots of hotels. For this price class and market segment (upscale), you can do much better. In about the same location, I had a much better experience in a vastly superior room in the Pan Pacific a few years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Sensible value”
Reviews.Author: 100nights
Reviews.Content: This hotel works well. Nice architecture and efficient service. Being 20+ years old (renovated recently) the rooms are a good size and sensibly equipt/furnished. Don't get a room overlooking the pool (parties until late/early) and location is not good for doing business. Takes ages to get any where.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: cazhad
Reviews.Content: We had a very relaxing break in this very plush hotel. The staff very willing to help you. Very modern clean rooms. We stayed 3 nights in Singapore and had a great time. We loved the glass lifts although sometimes a bit slow. Just a few niggles though. There are limited sun beds around the pool and we were unable to have one although many of the beds seemed to have been reserved for some time with no one on them. The staff were all very friendly but sometimes they were not too clear about prices and stated that breakfast would be $60 dollers each [£30 approx] which although lovely did seem very dear so we only had breakfast one day in the Hotel but later found out this info. was incorrect. When I asked for fresh milk in our room to make tea the same receptionist said it would be an extra charge but this also proved incorrect.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute peach of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nursejue
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writing this review whilst still in my Club Meritus room! This hotel is simply fabulous. The height of luxury and service. I would not hesitate to stay here in the future. The attention to detail is fantastic. The shopping mall under the hotel is huge, with everything your heart could desire. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PeckhamV
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for these reasons: Good beds, great service and the massive pool and poolside terrace are perfect for relaxing and making the most of the Singapore heat. Connected to a shopping mall so great for stepping out for a bite, retail therapy or simply if you want to get your hair or nails done at normal prices. Breakfast is also lovely - especially the outdoor breakfast terrace. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Made for a really enjoyable business trip!”
Reviews.Author: Klillrose
