Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin is a fantastic hotel! The staff at the hotel was very friendly, helping and accommodating. The pool is quite nice – especially for relaxing after jet lag - and the rooms are very spacious, clean and modern. The hotel is in a great location for walking to restaurants (although the restaurants inside the hotel are excellent – a lot of food choices and delicious!) and shopping. I would stay at again when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Five star luxury with central location”
Reviews.Author: narla20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nghts as part of a package deal following a cruise, and were pleasantly surprised at the high standard. The hotel is centrally located to the colonial district, Raffles Hotel and 2 large shopping malls...we could walk to all sights there as there are many pedestrain underpasses/overpasses. There is also a free shuttle bus between the various Singapore shopping malls. The hotel is attached to one of the shopping malls so there was no need to even go outside in the heat. The hotel is also centrally located to the City Hall train station, so were were able to catch the train (inexpensive) to the Changi Museum and the worthwhile Bird Park in the same day, although at opposite ends of Singapore. We did catch a taxi to the Botanic Gardens (a visit the orchid area is highly recommended if you enjoy gardens), Orchard Road and Little India, as the taxis are very reasonably priced too. The hotel room was spacious and well serviced, although not enough milk supplied for more than 2 cups of tea/coffee per room. The tariff included a tasty full buffet breakfast. We had a night departure flight so had a late checkout at 12 noon, and the hotel stored our luggage and allowed us use of hotel facilities including swimming pool and hot pool showers complete with towels, soap & shampoo, until our flight. Other than breakfast, we did not eat in the hotel due to high restaurant/room service prices. Instead, we ate at food courts, one in the attached mall, at a cost of Singapore dollars $4-5.50 per main dish -a bargain. The shops are open until about 9pm every night. While waiting in the hotel lounge for our transfer to the airport, we made the mistake of ordering coffee without checking the price, and were charged Singapore dollars $15 per cup! In hindsight, we should have visited the nearby Starbucks in the mall instead, at a fraction of the price. Also, do specify a double bed if a couple, we presumed being married this would be provided, but we were given 2 singles instead.

Reviews.Title: “few days break”
Reviews.Author: morrisonsofyork
Reviews.Content: Quite simply You would be looking for faults unreasonably if you could fault this hotel. I cant think one one area that was under par! reccomended , you wont be displeased

Reviews.Title: “Better than average hotel but beware of rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: I booked a room to rest for a weekend event which had 16 overseas guests flying in and staying there as well, so I thought it'd be convenient. The location of the hotel was excellent, with a passageway accessible from the 4th floor that leads right to Marina Square the shopping Mall. Marina Square itself have sheltered access to other nearby malls like Suntec City and City Link Mall, so for the shopaholics, you can still get tons of shopping done while staying dry when it pours. The only gripe is its a fair walk from the nearest MRT station, Cityhall. Takes about 10mins if you walk briskly, and the walk can seem to be abit too long when you need the showers after a long day. Loved the design of the hotel, high ceilings with a circular design to compliment the shape of the building itself. From every floor of the hotel, you get a full view of the hotel lobby on the 4th floor and hear birds chirping every morning and evening (I heard they bring in the birds especially on these 2 timings each day so guests can feel closer to nature; nice touch!). The room itself was very clean and spacious enough to warrant the SGD269 per night I paid for. Comfy beds, plasms TV, and bright clean bathroom. My event lasted until 5am and I had to wake up the next day at 7am so I didn't have a chance to try what channels were available for entertainment. The only thing I felt they could have thrown in was the buffet breakfast, which cost an additional SDG40 per person at Aquamarine. Check-in and check out were efficient, even a last minute request for a 40-seater coach to send my guests to the airport was met promptly. The only thing I noticed about some of the staff is that they tend to greet tourists with a smile while us the locals, even though we were hotel guests as well, were ignored. I have encountered this many times and it still irritates me that some of them practice such discrimination. My overseas guests had a ridiculous experience with the hotel staff that ended up with the hotel staff ordering my guests to return to their rooms and demanding them to flash their key cards to prove that they were indeed hotel guests. An experience which led to my overseas guests vowing they would never return and us the local hosts embarrassed that a 5-star luxury hotel could do such a thing. But then again, I thought I needed to give an objective review of the locations and rooms itself, that explains my entry. I'll leave it to your discretion but if you ask me, better service and cheaper rates for the same convenience and standard of rooms can be found at Pan Pacific Singapore, right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stopover”
Reviews.Author: louise_ar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night in February - booked via SIA Stopover package. Fabulous hotel - room on 10th floor was lovely. Staff were delightful - I was given a complimentary late checkout as my flight the next day was at night. The showers and facilities at the hotel fitness centre was also available after check out. Location near the Marina was good. As a solo female, I felt comfortable walking around the area alone at night. Breakfast at the hotel was overpriced in my opinion and if staying here again, I would explore the nearby cafes or foodcourt at the shopping mall. I would definately choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if you're a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: SLD64
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and we stayed 6 nights in a marina view room. If anything it has improved. The service is fabulous, the rooms spotless but ours could have done with a little refurb, but that's the only criticism. Try their chinese restaurant if you have the opportunity. I know there are fabulous places to eat in Singapore but the food there was amongst the best I've eaten. EVER. And that's saying something. Obviously it is a subjective view but I was very impressed. There is only one downside - if you are a light sleeper, as I am, the piano music every night in the bar downstairs drifts up into all the bedrooms and it goes on until 12 midnight every night. So, arm yourselves with earplugs. They've had complaints many times but seem to think it is worth it. It isn't a criticism, just be aware. Also, as the alcohol is extremely expensive (everywhere in Singapore but particularly in the hotels) if you fancy a tipple for a nightcap or before you go out there is a supermarket just up the road (out of hotel, turn right, keep walking, it's called 7/11) and the prices there aren't extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Hubert_Cumberdale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here as part of an extended stopover. The hotel itself is visually impressive, the rooms are spacious and well decorated and the service provided by the staff is top notch. The hotel is situated a 5 minute walk from the MET (subway) which is simple to use and can get you just about anywhere in Singapore in a short amount of time. For the more energetic types, Orchard Road, the Quay's and numerous shopping plaza's are less than a 10 minute stroll away. Little India and Chinatown are a decent 10-15 minute walk away. The gym is small, but well equipped and staffed. The buffet breakfast is a tad expensive, but has something for everyone. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Giu-Boxeur
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay at this luxurious and friendly hotel. Rooms, facilities and location are perfect for a trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, great location”
Reviews.Author: Alistairio
Reviews.Content: Very good quality hotel in an excellent location in Singapore. Lacks a little character and could do with alcohol in the mini-bar, but other than that, all good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DJGDJG
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed here for a whole month after moving to Singapore at the start of summer 2008. We choose this hotel as it gave the best accomodation, service and location for the budget amount my work had quoted. I have stayed at Swisshotel before, which is also nice, especially the view from the top, however Marina Mandarin offers a more relaxing and less stuffy environment. All the restaurants are excellent and are well served by the always helpful staff. This hotel has a very nice pool with outdoor restuarant and bar and a reasonable gym. If you ever visit Singapore, I recommend a stay at this hotel to give you great location and less business like hotel. It is still a premium hotel without the all suits in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for two nights in January on the way back from Australia and can only echo many of the positive comments made by previous contributors. The Marina Mandarin is quite simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It has a massive ‘wow’ factor but somehow does not make you feel over-indulgent. Everything about the hotel offers comfort for the guest from the luxurious mattress and bedding to the silence at night to the radiance of the foyer bar. It’s the only hotel about which I can genuinely say that it felt painful to leave. Two quick comments on some of the earlier reviews. First, to describe the stunning, cavernous foyer as ‘nice’ is a bit like describing Pele as a useful footballer. Second, we only paid $200 US per night for the room, which I consider an absolute bargain. We understand from friends in Singapore that this kind of discount could remain on offer for a while during the current global economic downturn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ddkent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marina Mandarin for 2 nights in January 2009, followed by 6 nights at Swissotel Stamford. Both hotels were good, with excellent location, facilities, staff and food. We agree with the Trip Advisor reviews ranking the Marina Mandarin just above the Stamford. The Mandarin has a nicer foyer, pool area and more recent fittings, while the Stamford is so large it is less personal and more of a business hotel. The Mandarin is well located near the water, but the Stamford has the advantage of being on top of an MRT station. Both are attached to shopping malls (Marina Square and Raffles City) that are actually linked underground by the City Link mall. The Food Loft at Marina Square was our pick of cheap eateries. Would stay at both hotels again, but the Mandarin would be our preference.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AddieLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service, fantastic design, gorgeous rooms - perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iulia_Ro
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent recently 4 nights (including NYE) at Marina Mandarin, Singapore. Hotel is located in Marina Bay new and hip developed area and makes part of a bigger estate development (it's connected to the mall, conference business center and other hotels) close to center (5-10 minutes drive by taxi). Room: very clean, large and seemes recently renovated. Staff: friendly and helpful. Hotel is huge, business & conference orientated.

Reviews.Title: “Superb. Didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Price: SGD299 per night, inclusive of all taxes, full breakfast and internet access - club room package, which included separate check-in and access to the club lounge. Cocktails also included and served from 5pm. Room: spacious with view of city and hotel pool. 21st (top) floor. clean and modern. Service: excellent, everyone was very friendly and helpful, and available whenever we needed information. Location: great! Walking distance from marina and connected to marina square shopping centre. Breakfast: delicious. Served in Club Room on 21st floor. Very quiet and relaxing. Pool & Spa: Pool very clean and enjoyable. St Gregory Spa great value and excellent service. Overall: Terrific. We only had two nights there and wished we had a week to completely unwind. We didn't mean to book the Club package, it was just the best deal when we looked around for a luxurious hotel in this area. If it's within your budget we would highly recommend the Club package. Everything included (breakfast, internet, cocktails and a few extras) means you can relax and not worry about nasties you didn't budget for at check-out. Gorgeous little exotic birds are brought out in the morning and placed on level 5. They chirp away and we heard them on level 21. Even without the Club package the service, ambiance, food, pool and spa is all superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but over inflated prices”
Reviews.Author: Ghanabound
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in sister hotel the Meritus Mandarin on Orchard Road but their pool was closed for renovation. Have stayed in Marina Mandarin a few times on business so knew it was in a great location - very central for a number of attractions and for the shopping but did not anticipate the high prices they were charging even taking into account the xmas and new year period. Facilities are great although rooms smaller than I'd expect for a hotel of this price in this part of the world and in-room facilities are spartan in comparison to other chains. Breakfast buffet is reminiscent of feeding time at the zoo when the hotel is at full capacity as it was during my stay. Such a crush of people meant long queues, a constant lack of something on the buffet table and poor service. Calls to the service desk on this issue went unanswered. Staff are friendly and everything works - the hotel does however lack a real identity but given the high turnover of folk and the size of the place, this is to be expected. Good access to malls/entertainment/MRT/taxis and overall a good hotel althouigh if I were staying again I have decided to stay in the suburbs, save at least $100 per night on room price, commute instead by taxi into town and have an additional $100 to spend on goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalverleyRhino
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for anybody wishing to explore Singapore and only has a short amount of time. Walking distance to the underground station, Raffles, water front and Singapore Flyer (similar but I think bigger than the London eye) I would recommend the night safari, its superb. We could not fault the hotel really, the staff, rooms, location etc were all excellent. The lobby is awsome. As some reviews have said its alittle on the expensive side. I agree that drinks and food at the hotel bar are rather expensive however a nice experience. If you want cheaper drinks there is an Irish bar about five minutes walk away. As far as the hotel in general goes I think you get what you pay for in this instance, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Three Es - Exceptional...Expensive...Elegant”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: You're definitely going to remember this one, regardless of the price - which is a little on the 'overly inflated' side. The feeling I had when I stepped out of the elevator at reception level is that of an excited child...looking up the Atrium to the roof certainly gave me the wow factor. I opted to go for broke and, against the wishes of my wallet, upgraded to the Club floor. But I was simply stunned at the room. The glass doors to the bathroom, mood lighting, Olive sweets beside the bed, 37" LCD TV, 5.1 Digital DVD sound system, fantastic City view from the balcony...yes, this was pretty special. The Meritus Club offers free snacks and cocktails, papers and magazines, internet, free DVDs to watch in your room, drinks, as well as it's own breakfast room - which even has a chef for those lovely egg dishes! I found exotic Dragon fruit on the fruit tray, and the female staff were all dressed in beautiful leg-cut red dresses. Yes, I'm a man...so I looked! The pool is a nice size, but the pool area itself could do with a spot of updating. On the pool level you'll find doors that exit straight to the Marina shopping mall. If you're like me, you'll love the sound of songbirds chirping as you awaken...and you'll find them around the lobby level. The Marina Mandarin is an extra special treat...go on, push the boat out and see for yourselves....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Great location, good rooms, and food and service was good.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: I like to try and fault city 5 star hotels, but I really couldn't with this one. The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere, great location, large refurbished rooms, big balcony, great views, good service and food. For a tourist trip to Singapore this hotel is in a great spot, walking distance from almost everything and next to a shopping mall. Will definitely be staying here again next time I m in Singapore. Advice: Try and get a room facing the city with view. Downfall: Pool could to with a make-over Dan

Reviews.Title: “nice but very expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: LANDJAY
Reviews.Content: we arrived from a lovely stay at Phuket and had to wait over 2hrs for a room which when we got to it it wasnt the right style that we requested.We were told that there werent any of the marina bay view.I told them that was what we had booked in feb 10 months ago and we wanted as paperwork stated.After further disscussions on the phone we were taken to room 1033.Whilst we had to wait for the wrong room we had a triple sandwich and my hubby four tiny squares of pate and 2 lattes which cost around £30 which was far from reasonable for the size of the portion.Had we not had to wait longer than normal for the room we wouldnt have had to pay this price for lunch and gone out to find something more value for money,we dont mind paying for an evening meal but not a light lunch.Lovely hotel but go out for food and drink if at the end of your holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Zabka
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and specious. Good selection at breakfast, all this for reasonable price by Singapore standards. Direct access to shops via downstairs lobby - what more could a woman need :o) Due to our late arrival in Singapore (our plane was diverted and we were 13 hours delayd and missed our first night), we were offered free late check out. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Singapore!!”
Reviews.Author: jowms
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best hotel we have ever stayed in!! Here for 2 nights on stopover to New Zealand. Special cheap rates and airport transfers free with Singapore Airlines. It is an excellent position for walking to Raffles(10 mins) and the shops. Suntec shopping center directly opposite which held shops of every description as well as excellent restaurants and small "pods" where they cooked oriental snacks in front of you.We ate from these "pods" twice and would definately recommend. On way back stopped in different area known as "riverside" ok but not so good as this part of Singapore. Will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel but pricy”
Reviews.Author: Blobasaurus
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at this superb hotel. Service, food, amenities were all excellent. However the price for drinks and food was excessively high in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “excellant”
Reviews.Author: magtb
Reviews.Content: After a long cramped flight to be met by a representantive from the marina mandarin was a welcome sight. The transfer was seamless and even taking us to our room bypassing reception was gratefully received. The hotel was spotless the service perfection.The room was excellant and breakfast interesting. The view over towards the Lion and the esplanade from the balcony was great. Access to the MRT was airconditioned and a welcome relief from the humidity of Singapore. For a central hotel this hotel will take some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: bigbman
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Singapore and booked the Marina Mandarin for 4 nights. So... it is a very nice hotel, very nicely appointed, each room has a nice balcony. No problem with noise as mentioned in earlier reviews. Pool is nice and I would compare it to a Marriott by North American standards. The patio is nice on every room and offers nice views of Singapore. I would definitely recommend this hotel however, I also stayed 1 night at the Pan Pacific Hotel for about the same price. If I were to return to Singapore I would stay at the Pan Pacific (Which is right across the street from the Marina Mandarin). Here is a tip for drinkers. Go to the 7-11 and buy your drinks and alcohol. It's right across the street and a quarter of the price. Hotels in Singapore have ridiculously expensive beer and wine, espescially in the hotels. If your looking for a good bar then the CasaBlanca is a nice bar with two for one drinks and a great patio.

Reviews.Title: “seriously good”
Reviews.Author: wingedfeet
Reviews.Content: my wife and i had three nights at this great hotel. the hotel stands alongside its sister the mandarin singapore and the marina shopping mall and faces out onto marina bay. on getting to the hotel you are immediately impressed by the building,you are greeted by the concierges staff and whisked upto the 4th floor reception area, the first thing you see is the awsome atrium soaring 22 stories above you,the ckeck-in is very quick and you are in your rooms in moments,we arrived at 6-30 am and our room was ready,the hotel facilities from the 5th fllor swimming pool to any one of 4 restaurants and numerous bars are impressive. the staff cannot do enough for you. the hotel is within walking distance of the major attractions of the singapore flyer,boat quay,clarke quay and raffles hotel, we highly recommend the marina mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bakes3520
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marina Mandarin on our way to Bali. The hotel was superb and all you would expect from a 5 star establishment. The location is also perfect for all that Singapore can offer. The only downside was the view. We were on the 10th floor facing towards Singapores version of the London eye, which is lovely. However the marina is currently undergoing massive construction work which is due to be completed in 2010. The cranes and floodligting dominate the view from this side of the hotel so try and get a view across the city and Esplande. This is not the hotels fault but if you want a view of Singapore the Marina view is probably not the best example.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_cjo
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay at this hotel and it was only too pleasant! The staff are very friendly and we were able to check-in at a very early time. The location of the hotel is great with many shopping places close by. The room was very clean and the hotel fittings were excellent. The ambiance of the hotel lobby was very good with a singer and pianist playing one night. It is a great place to stay for business or shopping or just touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy1918
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel on our way to Australia. We arrived at 9.25am and the staff made every effort to have our room ready by 10.am. Only niggle would be that we weren't offered a complimentary tea or coffee on our arrival. That would have been most appreciated. Never mind. We paid for a late checkout which was actually extended until 10 minutes before we were due to leave the hotel. Our room was on the 10th floor with views over the marina. It was spotlessly clean and towels and sheets changed daily. Breakfast was not included in our package and we paid £16 per person plus a 20% service charge which we thought quite expensive. However breakfast was good and service was excellent. The hotel is in an excellent location for the Singapore Flyer,and for shopping and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel for a stop-over in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: earlybird4
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Mandarin for a couple of nights, on our way to Australia, but really wished we had more time there. The total experience, from when you arrive at the entrance, was fantastic. From the outside the hotel is nothing special to look at, but once you step inside the doors ... wow! Beautiful surroundings, wonderful service, usually by the most gorgeous Chinese girls. The room was fantastic and food in the restaurant couldn't be faulted. We thought the value for money was fantastic, especially compared to what we paid for a room in New York on our way home!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Singapore Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: I had a short one day transit in Singapore and decided to try the Marina Mandarin. Among the five hotels that I checked in Marina Bay, this has arguably one of the best view and also the best price. This hotel belongs to the Meritus Group which runs a collection of mid-upper 5-star hotels in Asia. Arriving I arrived by taxi which is just 15 mins drive from the airport. Upon arrival at the hotel, a lady staff in Marina Mandarin’s signature fiery red cheong sum was on standby to greet me and showed me to the reception area. And she already knew my name without me telling her. Impressive! Check in was swift and I was soon escorted to my room. The Room I booked a suite since the price is just slightly more than the room and I was told it has the best city view and Executive Club privileges thrown in such as free internet, laundry, breakfast, cocktail etc. I requested for Esplande view and was slightly disappointed that the Esplande was only visible from a corner and not a direct view. Apparently, the triangular structure of the building means no rooms actually face the Esplande. My premier “suite’ is actually two connecting rooms turned into a “suite”. It’s rather strange because the two rooms are identical except one of the room, the bed and working desk was removed and replace with a sofa sitting area and a small dining area instead. Accordingly, everything is “double” in this suite in that there are two bathrooms, two closets, two minibar, two balaconies, two TVs and strangest of all, two room numbers and two entrance door. I have mixed feelings about this kind of “short-cut” design as the room was clearly not designed as a suite in the beginning and I was reminded constantly that it’s two inter connecting rooms and not a suite. In retrospect, probably I should have just booked the standard room which will be cheaper. Bed was a bit too hard for my liking and the room did have sound-proof issues as I could hear noise of guests walking by and music from the lobby lounge. But it wasn’t too loud to be disturbing ( I’m at the 16th floor, lower floors may be more affected ). Bathroom is a full marble bathroom and well equipped with hansgrohe rainshower. Premium toiletries ( Elemins ) were provided. Water pressure can be a bit better. Room looks new and was clearly just recently renovated with high quality ( though not top of the class ) materials and fittings. Overall, it projects a very contemporary and modern look. Furniture, sofa are all very comfortable. However, the sofa chair is missing an ottoman. The TV is a Panasonic 37” plasma that has good picture quality which I watched the Olympics closing ceremony. There’s also a Nepresso Coffee Machine and complimentary coffee / tea, a nice and much welcomed extra for an avid coffee drinker as me. Common Areas The hotel is a triangular building with a central atrium that soars 21 storey up. Entering the lobby and reception area for the first time conveys a great impression of spaciousness and grandeur. The hotel has 3 restaurants, one Chinese, one Italian ( closed during my stay ) and a café. Morning breakfast at the café was rather ordinary with standard item breakfast stuff, nothing special and a bit disappointing. The common areas have a very ornate “oriental” look and huge beautiful chandeliers adorned many of the common areas. There’s a large swimming pool and a spa and gym. The Executive Lounge ( called Meritus lounge ) consist of two interconnecting lounges, one with a sofa area and the other, a dining area for serving breakfast/cocktail. There’s only a handful of guests during my stay. There’s a outdoor area which has a great view of the Raffles Boulevade area. Breakfast at the Executive Lounge is of better quality than the café. Generally, the common area especially the lobby and the soaring atrium impresses and compare very well with its neigbours. I did walked over to take a peek a the neighbouring Pan Pacific and Mandarin Oriental. While the Pan Pacific décor was rather advant Garde and unique, the Oriental was downright depressing with a stark dark and claustrophobic interior. Overall, the Marina Mandarin has the most beautiful common areas. Service Service wise, the staff at Marina Mandarin more than live up to my expectation. Staff are uniformly very polite and friendly and always eager to help and more delightfully, it’s always done with a smile. I was also always greeted by name in the Executive Lounge, a nice touch. Every request I made was handled speedily and efficiently. This is miles better than the over-rated Grand Hyatt hotel which I had the misfortunate of staying ( and with a higher price ). To be fair, the occupancy during my stay was rather low as it was during a weekend so this may partially explain the attentive service I received. Location Being located at Marina Bay area, the hotel is connected is right in the middle of the second best shopping enclave in Singapore after Orchard Road. And Orchard Road is just a short taxi ride or a few MRT stops away. The hotel is directly connected to the Marina Square shopping mall with lots of shops and eating outlets and within walking distance to the equally massive Suntec mall and the more specialize Millenia Walk. It’s also located very close to the highway that connects the area directly to the airport ( just 15-20mins ride by taxi ), so it’s ideal for transit passengers looking for an overnight stopover as well. Conclusion Overall, the Marina Mandarin is a great hotel especially for the price paid. Everything is as per expectation ( except the design of the “suite” ) and while it stop short of being the very best, it’s a good choice for those who would like to visit Singapore and a fine example of Singapore hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: fredbocaj
Reviews.Content: Perfect situation in Marina Bay Rooms: modern, absolutely clean and luxurious Great Breakfast Excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Very good 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: FabioC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, and offers an excellent 4 stars service. The rooms overlooking the city affer an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: johnboy68
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out the hotel lived up to my high expectations. I stayed for 3 nights and all the staff i came into contact with could not do enough to make my stay anything but pleasurable. The room i was given was large, clean, and comfortable and the bathroom had both a shower and bath. The way you were greeted each time you re entered the hotel really made you feel special. The one other thing that i enjoyed was to be able to go shopping at Sun Tec Mall without going out into the hot sun. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toby510
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 1 week in May 2008. The hotel is pure and utter top class. You are made feel extremely welcome. We stayed on one of the club level floors which allows you to have free drinks and canopes every evening from 5pm to 7.30pm and our room was beautiful. The hotel itself leads directly into one of the shopping malls in the suntect city area. The staff at the pool are excellent, extremely nice and helpful. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great luxery”
Reviews.Author: billymyidol
Reviews.Content: if you can afford this or its just for a stop over very good clean hotel with amazing food good location. polite staff friendly and helpful.immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “COULD'VE BEEN BETTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: r4bigboy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids recently had a 5-night, 6-day stay at Marina Mandarin Singapore. Check-in was swift and we were excited to see our room. We had booked a refurbished 1-bedroom suite with a convertible sofa bed in the separate sitting room which also had a small, round dining table and it's own toilet and bath. The bed in the bedroom was not exactly a king sized bed which the hotel had promised, and the newly refurbished toilet was leaky and always created a puddle of water where it was installed. The airconditioning was HOT and we had to bare it for 2 nights. They eventually had it cleaned and only then did it get cooler. They don't vacuum the carpet everyday, I had noticed fingernails that had not been cleaned for 2 days until they finally cleaned it. The location of this hotel is great but accomodations certainly could've been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Carla123
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and staff are well trained. There are positives and negatives which make this hotel below average. Positives: Connected to Marina Square shopping centre, easy walk to citylink mall through to city hall MRT and Raffles Shopping Centre. Rooms are modern, however bathroom maintenance needs a little work. Excellent cleanliness. Staff are well trained and very friendly. Breakfast was very good. Negatives: The hotel is an atrium and the result is noise being carried. The hotel could very simply solve this by improving the sound proofing. We were on a high floor and could hear the band and lounge patrons 10 or so floors below till the early hours of the morning. Additionally, the noise from the street and pool is also very loud. Bathroom maintenance needs to be improved. Overall this hotel is good for business travellers mostly who work in Raffles Link or are in Singapore for a quick stop and do not want to venture to busy Orchard Road and happy to stick to one shopping centre with several restaurants and all major shopping chains.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for us.”
Reviews.Author: AussieBird64
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in one of the Meritus Club Suites which is very nice, but it is so noisy. This is not through any fault of the hotel, but due to the building work going on outside the hotel. There is the constant noise of jackhammering and every single day without fail there has been a practice session for the Singapore National Day which is in August apparently. We are on the 21st Floor facing the harbour and we can hear it word for word, plus the brass bands and all the singing. Its driving us crazy. As an example, it has just turned 9a.m. here and we can hear some woman on a microphone saying "check 1, 2 check 1, 2 ". NOT what I want to be woken up by. Even as you sit by the pool at times, you are drowned out by the noise (through your iPod no less). The hotel check in was efficient and pleasant and the staff very nice, however the hours for breakfast are a little short, especially if you are staying in the Club suites, breakfast ends at 10a.m., which if you are jet lagged like we currently are, its hard to haul yourself out of bed and be ready by 9a.m. (they start clearing up at 9:45a.m. and ask you to fill your plate so that they can finish). The food is the major disappointment. For the LHW Hotel we expected better food as we have stayed in many hotels belonging to this group before and the food has been outstanding. The room service menu is ordinary and the restaurants are average when compared to the others in the area. The buffet in the Aquamarine is nice at lunch, but its virtually identical at dinner which is a shame. On a positive note, the bird songs during the day is beautiful as they have the birds around the atrium and the nearby shopping is easy to get walk to. Travelling into Orchard Road takes about 15 minutes and costs between $7 and $9. Would we stay here again, no. Obviously the noise is not the fault of the hotel, they cannot help the massive building work happening in the harbour, nor can they be held responsible for the rehearsals for the National Day, but frankly its been a pain in the neck and I feel resentful at paying these prices and then having dreadful nights sleep and not being able to relax in the room due to the noise. Perhaps you just have to accept that in Singapore noise comes with the territory, and then some. Also the food simply isn't up to scratch. They need to improve this tremendously if they want to compete with the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “nice lobby for nice chat”
Reviews.Author: Amanila
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights in Marina Oriental last summer. People are nice and helpful in general. I must say I am not really fond of the cyber interior of the hotel but my boyfriend just loves it. The balcony in the room faces opens to a clear view of the Mermaid, good place for a break. The lobby is good for the nice chat with cocktails and music.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quality”
Reviews.Author: BazzaNZ
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with rooms having a high standard of decor and cleanliness. We arrived on an early morning flight and our room was immediatly available (we had given them previous notice of early arrival). The room was on the 6th flr. It was modern, clean and, as with all the rooms, had a large balcony. The bathroom was clean with twin vanities, seperate bath, shower and a bidet. The only problem with bathroom was that there was no power point, which is a problem for ladies using hair dryers. There was complementary water and fruit in the room, with robes and slippers also supplied. The location was excellent. Attached to a large shopping mall with underground (airconditioned) walk ways to other mall including Raffles. Also 5 min underground walk to City Hall train station fpr travel on the metro (MRT). We did not eat at the hotel and found the bar on the first level quite expensive, though alcohol throughout Singapore was expensive. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would gladly stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “great start to our honeymoon !”
Reviews.Author: lil-miss-sunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first 2 ngts of our honeymoon in April 08. This is a superb hotel, we arrived at 6am after our flight from the U.K, check in was very swift & we were in our room within 10 mins. The room was great, clean & spacious with huge bed, plasma t.v on the wall, complimentary water, tea / coffee making facilities & a fab bathroom. The hotel itself is very impresive with a big reception area / lovely plush bar area's (prepare to dig deep into your pockets though if drinking there !) & a fantasic pool, great for a refreshing evening swim after being out in the humidity & heat. The service in the hotel was outstanding, you could call housekeeping to arrange what time is conveneint for your room to be made up, we were able to check in at 6am with no problems, we were also asked what time we would like to check out on the day we left so there was not the usual problem of having to be out of the room for mid day then hanging around waiting to be picked up. Singapore itself just blew us away, its an awsome place, so clean, civilised & ordered (without feeling like you are being policed) when we were there they were just starting work on the marina area for the Grand Prix, we commented how the traffic & public transport etc still ran like clockwork ! We stayed here on our way to Bali & said if we ever visit that part of the world again we would most definitley choose singapore as a stopover & would not hesitate to consider at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: wanderinglust
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin was superb! the rooms were very nice (had a flat screen TV). It had a separate shower from the bath. The staff was so helpful with places to eat and shopping directions. The hotel is right next to Marina Square and Suntec so you can easily walk to the mall. Eating around is very easy although I found the food (in singapore)generally speaking very expensive than say, Bangkok or Manila. In the afternoon, they turn down the beds and put some candies on your bed...Excellent Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marina Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: easternman
Reviews.Content: One word describes this hotel "FANTASTIC" yes absolutely brilliant!! The staff here are superb nothing is too much trouble you are made to feel welcome and special as soon as you arrive and I was very happy to be in this hotel last week. The swimming pool is also a big plus large enough to do lengths with a nice view of the singapore skyscrapers adjacent. There is a poolside bar for a lovely ice cold tiger beer or cocktails or soft drinks. I was very sad to leave this hotel and the hotel lobby is awesome!! Nothing is too much trouble here and the staff genuinely care about you. Welldone Marina Mandarin!!

Reviews.Title: “Only one night”
Reviews.Author: ExeterHector
Reviews.Content: Had a night to stay in Singapore on the way back to UK. Went into the tourist services place at the arrivals hall in terminal 1 and they gave me a list of hotels. They said there was a special offer at the Mandarin for about £140 / night. About 20 minute taxi ride from the airport. Very nice looking hotel. 21 floors with the atrium going full heigth inside the building (as a builder always thought this was a bit of a waste of good construction space). Very good view from the 21 st floor looking down inside to the reception area. Didn't try too many of the hotel facilities as I was only there for 1 night. However, the service was good, the room was clean and tidy, and of a good size. Only draw back was that I was on the 6th floor, so the view outside was limited. Overall an excellent hotel for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Outdated filthy room/unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: Hideo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marina Mandarin from 14 April -16 April on the Eleventh Floor. The room was outdated and filthy with stains on the carpet and walls, mold in the shower and bathroom, and handprints on the headboard. I also missed valuable time to meet with business colleagues to discuss future business because one of phone operators told business colleagues that I was not a registered guest at the Marina Mandarin during my stay. For SGD $ 424 per night without breakfast, there are many better hotel choices in Singapore. Based on my experience this is not one of World's Leading Hotels. I had contacted the Executive Housekeeper and Rooms Division Officer to view the room. Upon viewing the room, neither any explanation but said they would contact me. I was never contacted by either of them. Upon writing to them, some one else responded but did not have any explanation but offered an upgrade if I came back again. Why bother? Their affiliate hotel, Mandarin Oriental is so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UkBumblebee
Reviews.Content: We visited the Marina Mandarin for two nights in March 2008 on our way to Australia. After a long flight, we arrived at the Marina Mandarin and from the moment we arrived our whole experience could not have been better. Staff were fantastic with impecable service ranging from the concierge to the receptionist. They could not do enough to make our stay more enjoyable and made our children feel very welcome. Facilities were equally impressive, with two matching connecting rooms(family room), which were well presented and clean with fantastic bathrooms. Pool was beautiful with very helpful staff who ensured you enjoyed every minute of your time. Glass lifts were super quick and efficient. The atrium is amazing with the sounds of birds singing, which we loved. Breakfast was excellent with a beautiful area for dining outside. We cannot wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most welcoming”
Reviews.Author: AyshaM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early April with our 3 year old daughter. The room was spacious and clean, but the hotel is not really suitable for families with young children. We found it too 'clinical' and in the very quiet atmosphere, our daughter's excited behaviour was frowned upon. Constantly felt that we had to make sure she was being a 'perfect child'. This hotel is OK if you are staying on business, and although a great location for sightseeing, not for young families. Disappointed as this was an expensive hotel

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fayreland
Reviews.Content: Request for a high floor room was ignored. Single glazed windows meant that we had unacceptable levels of traffic noise. Added to this was a really annoying water hammer from the plumbing, making sleep almost impossible. Room rate (GBP 150 per night) did not include breakfast. Carpet in room was covered in stains. Receptionist did not tell us about using the key card to operate the lift. Not a good experience. I am a regular visitor to Singapore and I've stayed in much better hotels - for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Music in atrium straight into your bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy_trav
Reviews.Content: The hotel, staff, location, facilities all great BUT I couldn't stand the loud (although nice) music from the piano bar wafting straight into my bedroom and we were 14 floors up! If you are a light sleeper you won't like this place. The gym was good, pool nice, location fine, breakfast yum, staff helpful and efficient if the music at night doesn't bother you; go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ... very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Reeny
Reviews.Content: Having read all the recent reviews regarding the service and noise I was a little apprehensive regarding our stay. It was our first visit to Singapore and we had planned a 3 night stop over on our way to Oz. On arrival, any concern I had quickly vanished. From the moment we arrived the service we received was impeccable - the staff were well presented and attentive. Our family room (1 king size with adjoining twin) situated on the corner of the 17th floor was first class. The buffet breakfast would satisfy even them most ravenous of guests and more than set us up for our days' exploring. We did the 'tourist-thing' and visited Raffles; had dinner at Clarke Quay (went up by boat from the Merlion Park); had a day at Sentosa and also a 'flight' on the new Singapore Flyer (booked online before we left the UK). There is quite a bit of construction going on with a new casino being built across the bay plus the changes and additions ready for the night-time F1 Grand Prix in September but it did not dampen our spirits. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Singapore and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone planning a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Atrium”
Reviews.Author: Monterey
Reviews.Content: At check-in the staff were gracious and helpful. We loved our rooms (family with 2 children) one had a King sized bed and the other had 2 singles. Breakfast was buffet style and would satisfy the fussiest of eaters - the range of multi-cultural foods was amazing! The swimming pool was fantastic and very exotic! A welcome relief from the heat/humidity of Singapore. We were fairly central to most activities and sightseeing locations. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Marina Mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Above average in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Calvynz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with very convenient location as several shopping centers are connected to it, plus access to the convention center which is located across the street. Nice rooms, but surprisingly a little noisy. I was on the 17th floor and I can hear the traffic in the morning. The only other surprise is that on the first night there was a turn-down service, but not for the other 3 nights that I was there. A little puzzling...otherwise a nice hotel to pass the time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: helix77
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Singapore and I did choose this hotel very careful. It's is located at the Esplande. It is connected with Maria Square Mall. So you can visit the mall and it's a big one. They have a lot of place to eat, bowling arena, cinema. There's an entrence from the mall direct into the hotel. There's about 10min walk underground to the nearest subway station, City hall. Across the street is the other big mall, suntech city, From the airport was it about 20min and did costs about S$ 20. From the time i checked in to the time I left they were very friendly to me in any kind of way. I had a room on the 12th floor, with a smal balkony faceing the Merlion and Fullerton hotel on the other side of the bay. The room was clean, no problem there. I orderd some food and drinks to my room. It came very fast and was lovely prepared. I never tried the pool but I was in the gym. A smal gym but it has the most important equipment. Outside the door to my room the have sounds of birds and first i was thinking this must be taped but i found on the 5th floor, birdcages with birds inside. However it think some of it is taped to. On my floor I didn't hear them inside my room. One thing I didn't like was at balkony. It has no roof, there is a copule of bars so if you are out there, the ones who are living above you can see you. The same under you, you can see them if they are outside. So keep your clothes on. The hotel has dresscode if you read the book that is in you room. No running around in flip-flops or running shorts. If your are down at the bar you need to be dressed in a proper way. I did book the room on internet and paid with my card at that time. Just to be sure, I did send an e-mail to hotel just make sure a room was booked in my name a few days before I came. They were very quick to answer back that everything was ready for my arrival, A funny thing to know. The hotel is shaped as an elephant, two ears and a trunk. For the chinese it represent that this will give the hotel wealth. The trunk brings water to the elepant., the hotel gets money. If or when I come back, I will stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolinehigh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marina Mandarin several times now and it gets better everytime. It has the most amazing swimming pool ever, and half the pool is quite shallow so it's great for my 9 year old to be able to stay in the 'adult's' pool!! The rooms are big, beautiful and clean and the atrium lobby is amazing. The only flaw this hotel has is the price of the breakfast, I wish they would make it a little cheaper, but nevermind, the hotel is attached to one of the biggest malls in singapore which has several breakfast restaurants including mcdonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Far too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Pistiagon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Marina Mandarin for two nights on the way back home from Australia. We were definitely disappointed. The staff on Reception were indifferent, apart from one lady who I dealt with later and who was charming. I explained that our onward flight was to be late in the evening - and was not initially invited to have a later check-out time and make use of the pool facilities (although the pleasant lady I spoke to later informed me that we were welcome to use these facilities). Our room was clean, the bathroom was fine, but at night the room was very noisy - we were in the front of the hotel and the traffic noise from the road 10 storeys below was horrendous, and this was all night - no double glazing at all. Other people complained about the noise from the Atrium - we could hardly hear it for the traffic noise. The bed was extremely hard and the pillows were like sleeping on bricks! Had we been staying longer I would have asked for a different room. Housekeeping and the Concierge were unobtainable on the phone. The Executive Suite was easily accessible, and open 24 hours, but the computers were down when I was there and remained so for the two days we were there - however, I was able to use one of the staff's computer. Breakfast was very good, but the ambience in the Aqua Marina restaurant was nothing to write home about. The pool area was a welcome haven, and the staff there were extremely friendly and helpful - that was the best bit of the hotel in my opinion. The hotel was potentially lovely, what a shame there were so many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Rude indifferent receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: Charmainee
Reviews.Content: Booked one night stay through the internet. There was no problem with the booking. At checked in, we were told that there were no rooms available. The receptionist asked us to wait and promised to call us asap when our room is available. We waited for 1.5hours and didnt receive any call from the hotel. Around 4pm (the check in time is at 2pm by right), we made another enquiry at the check in desk. At the check in counter, ahead of us was a man who just landed into Singapore. Apparently, he was told that there was no room for him too. The man kicked up a big fuss, demanding a room right away as he was so exhausted from a day of air travelling. The receptionist went back into her computer system and checked. And "by miracle". there was immediately a room available for him. So apparently, there are rooms available, but you have to kick up a fuss a get your room immediately. We had already waited 1.5hours just because we thought there were really no rooms. You can imagine our dissatisation. I got the feeling that to the receptionist, we were just another customer waiting to check in. There was no big deal for alittle waiting. The receptionist offered no apologies or smiles at all throughout the check in process. By the time we got our room, it was already way past the normal check in time at 2pm. So we asked for a late check out and was given. The check out staff was also unfriendly and offered no eye contact with their customers. The room was nice and clean. Comfy bed. Bathroom with separate bath and shower units. Location is at the heart of Singapore. WIth many local shopping and sightseeing attractions nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Cool interior”
Reviews.Author: adrianlondon
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the pun ... the interior of this hotel is a huge atrium. It also keeps the whole hotel lovely and cool. Some previous reviewers have complained about noise. I stayed at the hotel for a week and I found it very peaceful. The beds are situated by the windows rather than by the door, and on the one occasion I went to bed early, I really couldn't hear the music drifting up from the atrium. Maybe they've listened to previous comments and reduced the volume. I've been to Singapore many times and always like to stay in a 5-star hotel, as it's an affordable luxury. Unlike Europe where I live. Previously I've stayed at The Fullerton (lovely, but it's now very expensive; not the S$250 it was a couple of years ago) and Raffles The Plaza (great location above the MRT station, but impersonal and dull. Now called The Fairmont). Marina Mandarin's main advantage is its uniqueness. The atrium is lovely, and it feels great walking out of your room - none of that dark-corridor-in-a-non-descript-hotel stuff. The breakfast was good and the service very friendly. The rooms spotless and well equipped. The only downside is the distance from the MRT. Taxis are cheap, but as a single traveller I usually enjoy (honest!) using public transport. The walk from the hotel to City Hall MRT, whilst all underground, gets tedious rather quickly. That could be because I spent a week there. One or two days and it's a novelty. Maybe. Don't be put off though - I don't like staying near Orchard Road and much prefer the location of this hotel (and the others I mentioned above), and the walk from the MRT is through shopping centres so you can wheel your luggage most of the way. If the price of this hotel is no more than The Fairmont, or even the Swissotel (which seems oddly expensive now) then stay at the Marina Mandarin. It's got all the comforts of a chain 5-star hotel with that unique atrium. It may not sound like much, but it does make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarkO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina Mandarin as part of our honeymoon, although the staff did not acknowledge this fact unlike in other hotels on our trip. The first impression you get of the hotel is the amazing lobby, which is even better at night. Rooms are OK and staff were helpful and friendly, although not particularly welcoming - felt very business-like and not the personal touch that you can have in other hotels. Hotel is well located for the harbour front and within easy walking distance of most of the attractions. Underground stop is a short walk away through the maze of shopping centres, which is an ungerground city in itself. Visit Singapore Zoo - its a little way out the city, but well worth the visit - best zoo park I have been to. On the whole a good hotel, just that the staff could have been a little friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Where is that twittering coming from?”
Reviews.Author: jibberjabber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Marina Mandarin on our way to New Zealand on honeymoon. The hotel is very impressive the lobby and entrance area is stunning. Our first night we had 2 single beds pushed together I wasn't too impressed considering we were on our honeymoon and they new that. I requested a new room the next day and in fairness to them we got it. Both rooms were spotless and the bathroom was huge with double sinks and separate shower and bath. There was a piano bar in the lobby area and the design of the hotel ensured that the music travelled up to all the rooms. We were pretty tired and I wasn't too happy to hear that in our room. The next morning I could hear birds twittering constanly. And while sleeping thinking there must be so many birds in this city. It turned out to be a recording of birds being played all day, very annoying. The pool area was beautiful well worth a visit. We had food in the hotel it was not too good, there are several choices though. I was a bit put off also by the fact that staff only seemed to want to deal with my husband even though everything was booked in the lead name as in me.

Reviews.Title: “Still excellent”
Reviews.Author: Smelly03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 3 years ago, and found that it provided a clean and excellent service, and the staff always frendly and helpful with a very handy location. Three years later nothing has changed; will always stay at this hotel when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average, slightly tired rooms, service way below average”
Reviews.Author: Goodyear07
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three days and would not stay there again. The check-in / back office was not up to five star standard. Besides we got a rate that included two breakfasts for a double the hotel claimed that there was only one breakfast included in the rate for a double room (???). Instead of clarifying that with agent (HRS) directly the staff at the check-in pointed out that they have a policy of not contacting travel agents directly! (After long discussions and contacting HRS the breakfast was included in the room rate). I do not consider this kind of behaviour customer oriented and also this way of dealing with problems can only be considered inadequate. The staff at check-in can not be considered friendly and had a tendency towards arrogance. The rooms were slightly tired and a bit old fashioned and there was also mould in the shower, thus the rooms and the cleaning are obviously not up to 5 star standard. Fortunately there was a separate bath tub which was ok. As some reviews have pointed out already that due to the accoustics in the atrium and the thin doors/walls the bird songs/sounds will be clearly audible in your room in the morning. Breakfast buffet was good and offered a wide selection. The concierge was a positive exception and was helpful and efficient in organising transportation to Johor Bahru. Overall the price/performance ratio and the service of the Marina Mandarin could be improved considerably.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. 2 nights at standard room and 2 nights at the club room Location wise is great. At the shopping centre and convention centre next door and within walking distance to the subway. I like its architecture. It has a volumous interior which gives good resonance in the evening when there is a band signing. Really nice ambience for a drink in the evening. During the day, there are ral birds singing near the chinese restaurants. I think this is the best thing i like about the hotel. Check in was good. Must congratulate Josephine who is exceptionally courteous and helpful. The staff are quite attentive also. Standard rooms are spacious but look plain. Other than that it is reasonable. Club rooms are much more luxurious with good coimplimentary bottled water (still and sparkling) and a fine selection of gourmet coffee. Breakfast at the club floor has a nice view but food is more limited compared to the restaurant where other people (non club floor) goes too. The hotel is not new and shows signs of aging but is nicely refurbished. Club room, although nicely decorated and designed, feels small and cluttered. But the free gourmet coffee, sparkling water and Crabtree&Evelyn toileteries make up for it.. Overall, a very good hotel. I won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business traveller review”
Reviews.Author: BZGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marina Mandarin for 3 nights, and took part in a business function in one of the Vanda meeting rooms, which are on the sixth floor of the hotel. Where the hotel excelled: 1. All hotel staff were extremely friendly and notably polite. They spoke excellent English, and offered help before being asked. 2. This hotel has the best bellmen I have ever encountered. I didn’t have to carry my own bags at any point – a real treat for a weary business traveller. 3. The hotel is centrally located in downtown Singapore. Getting around was very easy – especially on foot. 4. The hotel has several different restaurants - Chinese, Italian and seafood. The food and service were above average in each one. 5. Cabled web access was available in the hotel rooms, for a fee. 6. The rooms were clean and quite spacious. 7. The atmosphere and décor of the hotel are striking – 22 storeys of rooms are situated around a massive open atrium that is topped with a glass skylight roof. On the fifth floor, unusual tropical birds are kept in brass cages. Their calls can be heard throughout the hotel during the daylight hours. On the fourth floor, the large bar area in front of the reception desk includes space for musicians and performers. I heard several talented singers, pianists and violinists each night I was there. Things that could be improved: 1. Signage was a problem. Except for in-room literature, the only indication of locations for restaurants, meeting rooms or hotel amenities was written in small, hard-to-read script next to the floor selection buttons on the panel in the elevator. 2. The temperature in our meeting room was appropriate for hanging a side of beef. Despite repeated, well-intentioned attempts by hotel staff to adjust the room to a warmer temperature setting, we continued to be uncomfortably cold. (I suspect part of the problem is the location of the thermostat/heat sensor. It is set way too high on the wall – just below the ceiling. This is probably unnecessary in a facility that is used exclusively by adults.) Things that were unacceptable: Nothing was unacceptable about this hotel – it is pretty spectacular. Bottom line: This is an above-average hotel with superior staff and world-class ambiance. This was my second stay there, and the Marina Mandarin lived up to my wonderful memories of the place. My recommendation: Business travellers can book there with every confidence and look forward to an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Immense!”
Reviews.Author: dirtycellar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was immense compared with others we stayed in. Its huge, with its hollow atrium where you can see right up to the 21st floor and externally mounted lifts. WOW. We stayed at the Marina Mandarin as the last part of our honeymoon. The hotel is situated slightly out of the city centre, but to no detriment, it is still walkable to the centre and there are so many restaurants and shopping centres around there you needn't worry. Our room was on the 10th floor and had a view of a neighbouring hotel. The room was nice, the bathroom was big with a bath and separate shower. The bed wasn't huge but big enough. The only downside was lack of lighting. The hotel has a pool area on, I think, the fifth floor. This is a nice place to come after a hectic day in the city. There is a bar here too. I think one of my favourite things about this hotel was the entertainment in the atrium bars, you can hear it all round the hotel. We spend a lot of time drinking champagne just listening, it was very relaxing. There are loads of restaurants in the hotel. We ate in the italian which was very nice and reasonable. We had breakfast in the main buffet restaurant, which was ok, but very busy. This hotel is a great base for exploring singapore.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: bluenoseWestMids
Reviews.Content: FIVE STAR! customer service superb hotel looks the part with service to match great location make sure you pay the extra for executive rooms and facilties nice rooftop pool. great weather

Reviews.Title: “Marina Mandarin - great Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: TrishWarrandyte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel (Singapore stopover) in September 2007. Not having stayed in Singapore before, we were pleasantly surprised. This was a beautiful hotel - the atrium foyer was spectacular - we were upgraded to an executive room on arrival - which was very spacious. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and obliging (eg: we just enquired to where Raffles Hotel was as we wanted to try the famous afternoon tea and Singapore Sling (as it turned out just a 5 minute stroll around the corner), the concierge staff gave us the directions and even rang to make the booking for us! The breakfast buffet at the Marina Mandarin was very extensive and high quality food. It really is the little things that make a big difference - and the staff made us feel very special indeed. We wished we could have stayed another couple of days! We will definitely stay at the Marina Mandarin again next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “good but a bit random”
Reviews.Author: trixiebear
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide if to give three or four stars, I believe it claims to a six star hotel (whatever that actually is) and well that its definintely not. We had a one night stay on the club floor for our wedding anniversary, Carlo the chef at their upmarket Itlanian restaurant having run the restaurant at Sheraton where we had wedding reception way back when. Service was decidedly mixed overall with the Filipino and local staff were good (some very good) but the others mainland Chinese et al were somewhere between average and "I get better in my local coffee shop - and they speak better english". If you are a six star hotel your club lounge staff need to be able to communicate in the main international business language - that's just the way it is. Generally speaking the reception etc staff were good to very good, while the F&B staff seemed largely untrained and vaguely hopeless (a huge contrast). Breakfast in the club lounge verged on laughable with a woman cooking eggs etc who had obviously been hired from the local hawker centre (although that is an insult to my local joint). Thick as two short planks is an understatement. The rest of the F&B service was average as well, excepting the manager(?) and Carlo in Risortante Bologna. The room was really nice, and a way cool shower. However rock hard pillows did litlle for actually sleeping. The aircon was very warm with no apparent way of turning up the fan, and the absurb number of unlabled light switches was just plain irritating. Overall - nice rooms, some very good staff - and if they could iron out the kinks would be a great hotel - but at what we paid average for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: willcPerth
Reviews.Content: I chose to end my South East Asian holiday in what i thought would be a 5 start hotel in Singapore(29&30 Sept 07) I booked through Asia Rooms whose bookings nowdays seem to be on an unrefundable basis, which leaves little leeway if your hotel turns out to be a loser. On checking in i was placed in a room on the 10th floor........it was a dump! The entire room was old and tired with much of the furniture having stains on it.........not what one would expect from a 5 star hotel. I asked to be shifted as i did not want a room with an interconnecting door..................I was moved 5 rooms down and the decor was no better!!!!! and whilst it was a non-smoking room, i discovered a full ashtray out on the balcony that looked liked it have been there for several days!......Shows how well these rooms were being cleaned. The fact was both rooms felt old dirty and tired! I had had enough and at this point in a normal stay I would have checked out and gone accross the street to the Oriental but because I had used Asia Rooms i would lose my money.......so i upgraded for a further $50.00 a night ........The end result was basically the same room tarted up with a cheap renovation! To top things off i caught a bad ear infection from their pool My advice if you are thinking of staying at this Hotel? don't ......It just doesnt have any class its a 2 star hotel with the outward trappings of a 5 star........It looks tempting but if you want a real 5 start hotel go for one of the major brands at least you will get value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Jane89
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms (always kept immaculate) and stunning atrium. Chinese and Italian restaurants were great, cocktails were fantastic. It is very close to all sights of Singapore and staff were very helpful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not stunning”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterWoman
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 children, we stayed for 4 nights in 2 connecting rooms in August 2007. The hotel was fine - very clean, all the facilities we wanted / needed, and thanks to prompt e-mail communication before we travelled, I was confident that we would get the important connecting rooms (always a worry when you have booked 2 rooms with children). I would say not a five star though - maybe 4? We checked in without any problems, had some delays in getting the connecting doors opened, and an issue with power to one of trooms, but that was soon sorted out. We arrived on a Sunday evening, tired and hungry and were disappointed that there was no 'casual' dining available in the hotel - only lobby bar snacks, or one expensive more upmarket restaurant was open. We went into the adjoining shopping centre (bit like 'Mr Ben' - go through a door in the hotel and you're right in the middle of a huge mall!) but sadly everywhere except McDonalds or Starbucks closed at 10pm on Sunday! This is obviously not the hotel's fault, but just a warning to other people arriving at this time. The breakfasts were fine - a bit busy due to the number of conferences in the hotel, but food good and varied. The gym was good, and the outdoor pool very welcome after sightseeing. Pool service (drinks, food) was also very attentive. The location was ideal for conference goers / shoppers wanting to be virtually in a mall, and also very close to Raffles (we had drinks in the Long Bar with our 2 children - definitely recommended) but we would have preferred a location nearer to some more restaurants (wish I had taken another posters advice to stay at Swissotel Clarke Quay! Lots more bars and restaurants there). Apart from location not being the best for what we wanted, the 2 negatives of the hotel in my opinion were as previously mentioned by other reviewers: 1. Caged birds 'tweeting' in he huge atrium lobby - seemed very cruel 2. Lobby music - piano / violin etc - not unpleasant music, but went on well past midnight, and made it difficult for our children to sleep. The design of the hotel is such that you could hear the music right up to the top rooms. I probably wouldn't stay there again, there are many good hotels in Singapore, but to be honest we found 3 full days in Singapore to be sufficient for us, and were ready to go on to Thailand at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Marina Mandarin epitomises Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SheldonB14
Reviews.Content: We booked five nights at the Maria Mandarin via the hotels website. We chose the hotel following good reviews and the excellent location offered. Following a stay in Bangkok we arrived at the Marina Mandarin mid afternoon. On arrival in the taxi the area seemed to have a lot of construction work going on, this was soon forgotten as we walked inside and took the glass life to the reception and magnificent lobby area. Check-in was rather robotic, and did not have the friendly touched of Bangkok. There was some discussion as we were first told that there were no non smoking rooms available, then told we could have a twin room. After a short discussion we had no option but to disappointingly settle for a smoking double. The room was a reasonable size and was clearly recently renovated, was clean and the bathroom stocked with the usual products as expected. There was a good view across town. In the morning there are bird cages hung up providing a relaxing medley of birdsong. In the evening the lobby bar offers the service you would expect of a five star hotel, and with the huge atrium does look spectacular when lit, but my recommendation would be to get out and sample some of the local bars. The Marina Mandarin is linked to the Marina Bay shopping centre, and the esplanade beyond which contains a good selection of open air restaurants, more of which can be found at Clarke Quay which is another few minutes walk. Access to the MRT system is via the Marina Mandarin shopping centre and around a 15 minute walk thankfully fully air-conditioned. In short, the Marina Mandarin is good, but does not go above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning architecture at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: Trainers1
Reviews.Content: We plumped for the Marina Mandarin after reading a glowing review in a UK national newspaper - and weren't disappointed. Centrally-situated, it's easy to get to most major attractions by using the maze of pedestrian walkways through shopping centres (air-conditioning is a necessity not a luxury when it's 95 percent humidity). Our rooms overlooked the outdoor swimming pool and the staff had arranged interconnecting rooms to cater for our two children. The breakfast buffet is outstanding, a huge variety of food to cater for a range of ethnic tastes - whether you want chicken porridge or croissants you'll find it there. Dinner in the Italian restaurant is pricey - but the waiting staff were charming, explaining all about the Singapore Zoo night safari and detailing local buses and other attractions which might be of interest to them. Jazz in the bar every evening made for a relaxing end to some very hot days and the curvaceous sweeping designs of the staircases and illuminated lifts are stunning. Would certainly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: kodySydney
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The service was amazing. The buffet breakfast and dinner was one of the best I have ever had. Location was perfect. My stay could not have been better. Highly recommended Sue Sydney

Reviews.Title: “The staff would bring me back”
Reviews.Author: ConnachtRambler
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here and enjoyed our stay immensely. The staff could not have been more helpful or more friendly. Our room was excellent, we enjoyed the swimming pool on a number of occasions, returned each morning to the breakfast restaurant and relaxed to the different singers/musicians at night. Only complaint is that I believe that in this day and age every hotel should offer free wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizmancn
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore, although we both live in China. Located in the middle of 5-6 other major hotels in the Marina area, my girlfriend (chinese) and I (US), who are both in our 30's found this hotel very convenient and reasonably priced at 130usd. We did not eat in the hotel, but received good advice from the concierge about dining outside, such as Little India (Nirvana Restaurant). Pool was nice, not busy. We had a room facing the exhibition center, see photo. I liked the fact that all the rooms had an open balcony. After several trips to Orchard Road, I was happy we chose the Marina location, because although it is only a 5usd taxi ride there, it's much more relaxed and the restaurants in the area are not nearly as crowded. The hotel itself is connected via a shopping center to the Pan Pacific, Oriental, Ritz Carlton and the Conrad. We booked online, showed up about 1am and left at 7am, check in and check out were both quick. Highly rec the Night Safari and a visit to the Raffles Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems !!”
Reviews.Author: Armsy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband, parents and our 18 month daughter. We stayed two nights enroute to Australia. I was apprehensive having read the recent poor reviews. However, our stay could not have been more pleasant. Staff were very accomodating, all our requests ie non smoking, interconnecting rooms on quiet floor etc were all met. The breakfast was great - fine selection of items, the hotel was clean, facilities great and could not fault staff. All in all a great stop over and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mercury_solace
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often to Singapore, and recently, I tried staying at Marina Mandarin Hotel - Marina Bay, Singapore.
