One of the reasons was its proximity to the SUNTEC CITY Convention Centre, as me and my colleagues were attending SOA & ECM Day Conferences there.. When I first checked in, it was to my (unpleasant) surprise that the room wasn't tidied yet, and smelt terrible (cigarette smoke, while I specifically requested for a NON-SMOKING ROOM, they just replied, this was all they had *sigh*). Once the bell boy came up to my room to send my baggage, I complained to him the room hadn't been cleaned yet. It wasn't his initiative to ask me why the room was in such a mess!! So he called someone from another division, to immediately clean the room. But I said I needed to get online and do my business work on my notebook computer, so I told him to clean up the room in an hour's time. They did eventually clean the room after an hour. I had a quick conversation with the housekeeper staff, and he didn't have a good command of English (Singaporeans DO have good command of English). I speculate they hired illegal workers of some sort from some rouge states. At first I wanted to tell him to do some specific cleaning in the bathroom, but as he couldn't understand what I was saying, I told myself "What the heck.. I got some other work to do." So I left him alone. My colleagues had problems checking in too.. The receptionist requested that I, as the principal booker of the rooms to physically be with them as they were trying to check in. (my colleagues checked in way later after me, because they had to be going somewhere that day..). She refused to tell them what my room number was, thus giving them a hard time.. But they eventually let them check in, after a series of angry remarks thrown to the receptionist. After I heard about the incident, I called the front desk if MY COLLEAGUES' names were on the check-in list for that day, and true enough, they were on the list. So why the heck did she go all that trouble to hinder them from checking in? Till this day, I'm still confused.. My colleagues' rooms' air-conditioning was not fully operative in a sense that it's not emitting cold air. It was quite warm indeed.. We specifically asked for rooms with fully-functional air-conditioning units that blew real cold air ! (Singapore is real hot) Three days later, in the morning, broadband internet connection was down, for 6 hours. Hell, I couldn't have any work done. I complained to the duty manager on the phone, that I was really pissed. He replied calmly saying the whole hotel had an internet connection trouble even with the businesspeople who were attending some important meeting in the conference rooms. I told him I was so disappointed I wouldn't stay in this hotel anymore, but he pestered me to give them another chance. Broadband internet wasn't that fast too.. (and they charged very dearly for that.. like S$ 20 / hour of usage, and up to $40 / day).. Download speeds are maxed out at 25 Kb/s compared to the previous hotel I stayed at, Royal Plaza on Scotts, which had speeds of up to 240+ Kb/s (and it's also free there...). I sat at the lobby lounge, surfing away on the web when suddenly cigarette smoke smell began to irritate me, and I kindly requested the waiter to escort me to a non-smoking area. She said, there's no NON-SMOKING area in the hotel.. The day I was about to check out, the lady in the cashier asked me to wait a little while.. as they were doing some "checkout procedures" which took over ten minutes. So I asked her what was the problem? Why did it take so long? She eventually admitted to having problems with the system/network. They can't login to the system.. What an absolute mess!!! I needed to rush to the airport, as I was just in the nick of time to catch my flight back to my home city.. If location isn't a factor, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, but I do highly recommend Royal Plaza on Scotts. It's a great hotel for almost the same price (cheaper that is) as Marina Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ZeusnGoose
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, close to Orchard Road and the Marina bay area... Cracking atrium when you first walk in and the service is great. The hotel itself was very clean throughout, although the rooms perhaps a bit dated. Having said that, the bathroom was great with powerful shower and lovely deep bath (if those sorts of things are important to you!) The pool area is clean and family friendly, and much needed when staying in Singapore! Great balcony overlooking the business hub, and would definitely stay again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms and shocking service!”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shocking, we arrived at the hotel at 4am, no porter staff around to help with our bags so we had to struggle up to the 4th floor where we found the reception. It felt like the hotel had switched off the air conditioning as it was very hot in the lobby. Check-in took a very long time 30+ mins and we certainly didn’t get that normal Singaporean welcome that I always receive at the Sheraton Towers. So at about 5am we struggled up to our room on the seventh floor only to find that the room was dirty and had not been serviced from a previous guest. So we walked back to the front desk only to wait another 30 mins before begin allocated another room, the reception staff were so unhelpful and didn’t even apologies for any inconvenience. So we went up to our new room to find that it was a double room with 2 single beds, instead of the king room that we had booked. (Why didn’t the staff ask if this was ok?) I called down to reception a third time only to wait another 15mins while they played around with their computers to be told that this was the only room left in the hotel. By this time it was approaching 6am so I told the manager that I was not paying $200+ for a room for 2 hours just to take a shower. All he offered me was 15%off. I told them to forget it and cancel the room and I ended up staying in a friend’s room for the few hours. If my friends were not staying here I would have departed and gone to the Raffles Plaza or Ritz, so the next morning I checked in again and was given the original room on the seventh floor that had now been cleaned, on close inspection the room was very tired and in need of renovation and a really good spring clean, dirt on the carpet, marks on the bed cover, hair in the bathroom, mold in the shower and items missing from the mini bar. I returned to the front desk again and spoke with the manager, he said he would upgrade me to a premium deluxe room with a city view but could not give this to me until 1pm, I also managed to get free breakfast out of him for 2nights. When I returned at 1pm it took the incompetent reception staff another 15mins just to give me the key to my new room on the 15th floor, the room was really no different to the original one and didn’t have a city view like promised. I spoke to the manager again and a few hours later I was moved to a city view room. I will never stay at this hotel again, putting aside there false claims of newly renovated rooms, there customer service is just so poor, to get anything out of them was such a mission and were do these hotels get off charging $25+ for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: udalvr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in August 2006. The stay was excellent. Everything was good. Service, food, rooms, atmosphere were all excellant. But I did not stay there on a weekend. I was told that on Sundays the hang bird cages with live birds in the atrium and one can enjoy the chirping sound of the birds. If true, I will not stay at this hotel again. I DO NOT SUPPORT THAT. I BELIEVE NO ANINMAL OR BIRDS SHOULD BE CAGED.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Meritus' group of hotels flagship Meritus Mandarin on Orchard Road for the past many years. I made the decision to try the Marina Mandarin a few months ago and I must say that the hotel and the Marina area can be a great alternative to Orchard Road. From arrival to check-in, staff were excellent, hallmarks of Meritus! The lobby was awesome, especially in the mornings when you get to hear birds chirping and at night as it is illuminated. I won't deny that the rooms aren't 100% sound-proofed so you do hear the pianist playing late into the night. It didn't really bother in fact the soft tunes might have helped me sleep better. Meals at Aquamarine is superb. The buffet was extremely elaborate, fresh and offered great value for money. Once again, the staff there didn't disappoint. Location wise, it is some 15 minutes on foot to the subway but you don't get bored along the way as the hotel is connected via an underground shopping mall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel after a 19 hours direct flight from NY, I was really looking forward to a nice comfy bed for a quick nap. Despite the 11AM arrival, I was quickly checked in and was shown to my room quickly. The room is about the same size as the one that I had from the Pan Pacific that is close by. It is however a bit smaller than the one from the Grand Hyatt. The bed is a bit on the soft side but otherwise comfortable. The view from my room is slightly better than the Pan Pacific but not by much. The marble/granite bathroom also have the same separate bathtub and shower although it is a bit smaller than Pan Pacific and also a bit more worn out. The amenities are good without being as exciting as the Grand Hyatt offerings. There are a quartet playing music in the atrium every night just like the Pan Pacific and the same bird chirping in the morning. The bird songs are quite soothing for a morning wakeup call. Outside the hotel, is a quick walk to a hawker center that opens every night around 6PM that you can get a quick snack. It takes a bit of walking if you like to reach the MRT but it is not too bad since most of the walking will be inside ti escape the Singapore heat. The Marina Mandarin is not quite a 5 stars in my book but a good solid 4.5. It is a toss between the Pan Pacific and the Marina Mandarin for me. I feels the Grand Hyatt is a bit above both of these but you can't go wrong with any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina Mandarin for 4 nights on our way to/from Oz. The hotel is about 20 years old, but was recently refurbished. It has a very impressive galleried Atrium design which rises up to the 21st floor level. The main reception area is on the 4th floor. The hotel is very central in Singapore and close to all the main amenities. There is a lower rooftop pool etc. on the 6th floor and restaurants (which we didn't use). Some rooms overlook the marina area and some look into the city area. I would recommend a room on a high level (10+ ?) in order to get a decent view above other nearby high buildings. Do not take a room on the 6th floor as this is used for conferences etc. & the bed's are hard & uncomfortable. All the rooms have a small outside balcony, but no chairs on them. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a short stop over in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough without being outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Craven
Reviews.Content: It was average for a 5 star hotel. Decent size room, big plasma television and room to work. I think the refurb money must have gone on the bathrooms and public areas. The food in the two restaurants was first class and the singer/string quartet in the atrium in the evenings were of high standard. So really nothing to moan about but nothing to particularly enthuse over either. I would go again mainly for the food , location and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Dirts
Reviews.Content: Having read that the Marina Mandarin had had a huge makeove I expected something special and it was just average. Most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful although on one evening the girls in the bar were very off hand. The rooms are average and didn't really look as though they had been refurbished in fact I would say they were drab. The bathroom was super though. The pool staff were delightful as were the staff in the Italian restaurnat and the food was excellent there too. Would I go back - Probably not. We have been to the Pan Pacific over the road on several occasions and I would deffinately say it is better.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but not quite to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Botak
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of the Marina Mandarin, but unfortunately the overall experience fell slightly short of those expectations. The hotel is in a very convenient location right next to Marina Square and Suntec city. Our room on the 13th floor had a nice view from the balcony across the Esplanade to the high rises downtown. On arrival we were efficiently greeted at the door and our bags taken care of. On check in we were informed that no non smoking room was available with a king bed, but that a twin room was available. I was happy to accept the smoking room on the basis that we could switch to the non smoking twin if neccessary. I was also assured that the smell in the room would not be too bad and if it was to call reception to change. We were escorted to the room which stank of stale cigar smoke, and was non too clean. Ash was present all around the chair arms, and the glass table had the remains of the previous occupants room service stuck in the groove around the glass. I contacted reception to ask to be moved but, was told that there were no other rooms available, but that housekeeping would be sent to deal with the problem. Housekeeping arrived and sprayed some air freshner, but seemed unconcerned about the mess around the table and chair. The housekeeping manager arrived some minutes later, and agreed that the table needed a clean, which was quickly undertaken. The room was pleasantly decorated, spacious and featured a good sized bathroom. The hotel itself is impressive in scale, but as someone else said, the modest refurbishment budget didn't go very far in a building of this scale, the hotel certainly does not have a "new" feel to it. I feel that for the discounted rate that I paid that the Marina Mandarin represented good value, but had I paid the full rate I would have been dissapointed with the rough edges aound the experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Snoweman
Reviews.Content: What a spectacular hotel. I only wish I had spent the extra $25/night to upgrade to the club level room. The staff was wonderful. I was amazed how quickly some of them learned my name. The song birds in the atrium just added to the ambience of the hotel. The breakfast is well worth the money, as it caters to so many different palates. I know Singapore has many wonderful hotels, and this should be considered among one of the best. I hope I have the privilege of visiting Singapore again. If I do, I won’t waste my time trying another hotel. I will be staying at the Meritus Mandarin. Thanks to the staff for a little slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Five Day Business Trip -- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tootallsd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a five day business trip. It was very good experience. It is a nice location with a connected shopping mall that provided easy access to a wide range of casual dining for nights when I didn't need a big expensive meal. The room was very modern: wireless internet free, plasma tv, deluxe bathroom. Staff was Singaporean -- attentive, kind, constantly available. Food in restaurants was very good. Breakfast buffet is really superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 1 night only as we were too late arriving in Singapore to catch the ferry to Bintan. Having stayed in Singapore a couple of times before we just basically wanted a hotel with restaurants/shops nearby and out travel agent suggested this one. It certainly fit the bill. Room was spacious. Bathroom was a bit dated but all in all for 1 night it suited us. Through the hotel you could get to Marina Square shopping centre which was large with plenty of eating places. We are non smokers and I heard the receptionist tell someone that they do not have non smoking rooms but refresh each room after guests depart. I can honestly say that our room gave no indication of anyone ever having smoked in there.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: tiger_sist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Marina Mandarin in Nov 06 for 5 nights with great promotion from expedia and I don't have much to complain about really. While checking in, I asked for a room with a nice view and was provided with a 14th floor corner room overlooking the Marina and The Oriental was right opposite - fantastic choice. The only downside was the walk from lifts as I had to walk in a big square shape every morning and night! The room has been partly renovated and was in a suitable size and good condition. Some pieces of furniture looked tired, but wasnt a big deal. Bathroom was clean and spacious but looked kind of late 80's. I agree with every reviews below about the noise from the lobby area which sometimes the songs could put me to deep sleep and sometimes it could be a little frustrating. The location is perfect in terms of physical comfort. Restaurants and shops in Marina Square were easily reached and if you need to take a cab, there is always one - I never ever had to wait for it. The spa was amazing. The atmosphere was so serene and I just loved going there for treatments. The rates were not friendly but service was spot on - highly recommended. The two problems I came across while staying at the hotel were the conceirge and the crowd. I was a solo traveller and hardly know anyone in town so when I was asking for crucial information, this man seems to always be rushing to do something and never let me finished my sentence. I just got fed up with the service so I helped myself with the directions in the end. As for the crowd, there were wedding receptions held at the hotel twice during my stay which made it troublesome getting in and out from the main entrance. All in all, I would not mind staying at the Marina Mandarin next time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dowf
Reviews.Content: One word - Fantastic! Would definately stay again, didn't want to leave! Great location, great rooms, great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Good but Not Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler111Stamford
Reviews.Content: Having stayed 6 days at the hotel, I found the overall experience there as good. I would stay there again even though it would not be my first choice. Check-in was efficient although not as friendly as most of the other staff in other areas. The greeter at the lobby Aquamarine Restaurant was excellent- he was friendly and knowledgeable- he also offered wonderful advice about places to shop. The buffet at the restaurant was very good as was the Chinese restaurant on the 5th Floor. The employees who help secure cars and open doors when you arrive at the hotel were also very good and friendly. It is clear that the hotel, overall, understands how to deliver good service. Employees would almost always say hello when passing you in the halls. The biggest negative here is the loudness of the music from the 4th floor lobby bar (Check-in is actually on the 4th floor here). I was on the 16th floor and the music actually sounded like it was in the hallway outside my room. Most guests that I spoke with also complained about the loudness. While the atrium here is very nice, the design at the Marina Mandarin represents how "form" took precedence over "function". It is just poor design to have hotel rooms that require people to use ear plugs to try to sleep. I certainly would hesitate bringing anybody here who needs a quiet environment. Internet use for every 24 hour period was high at $21 SG or about $15 U.S. A more accurate rating probably would be 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “"Party Hotel" -- Not for family with young kids or babies!”
Reviews.Author: HitchhikerUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights with 2 babies. On 2nd night, loud noise/singing from our closed window /balcony(facing the poolside restaurant) **past midnight**. Apparently F&B had a wedding banquet there and no one from the hotel management 'cared for' the noise. We called and they did stop the loud singing. On our 4th night, which is New Year's eve there a is countdown. We were okay with the noise since this is once-a-year event. However, they charged $70+SG for the lounge (in the middle of the hotel) and they sang until 2am. I complained but in vain -- the hotel manager said the 'official bar/party time' in SG is until 3am. It was v. v. loud that night, ***until about 2 am***. If you like partying, you may enjoy the free music (though I am not so sure about 'Phantom of the Opera' in the middle of the night.). But if you have young kids/babies or if you do need sleep, then this is not the place for you. This is a place where F&B and the accomodations have no communications or care for the hotel guests. It seems 'lounge' music/singing is a big thing for them. Due to the 'structure' of the hotel, I assure you when they have a party there, you can hear the music all night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service and well equipped rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: This is a good looking hotel with generous public spaces and superb friendly service. The rooms on the Executive Floor Levels (top two floors) were great with free internet access, (limited)complimentary laundry service and large rooms. The bathroom was equipped with crabtree & Evelyn products and replenished each day. My only (minor) gripe was that breakfast in the main restaurant was a bit of a 'bun-fight', so I guess I should have tried out the Exec. Lounge. With easy access to nearby shopping malls this is a good location too - although you'd be hard pressed to be far from anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjturner
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for £200 for three nights on Expedia. For the price this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are well decorated with contained a very large bed. The shower is great (v. powerful) and you also get a bath. I was told by a taxi driver that the hotel had recently been refurbised and it did look like it had been. The hotel tv had lots of channels including ESPN sports (Premiership football). The distance to the MRT station is about 10 minutes walk through a shopping mall which is air conditioned so the walk is quite pleasant. Taxi's where always waiting outside the hotel if needed which are very cheap in Singapore. The hotel is not too far from Orchard road and the Raffles hotel, if it wasn't for the heat you could walk to them both. Hotel staff where great, I especially like the waitresses dresses! I also liked the Karate style dressing gowns in the room! As far as the music being played in the hotel lobby, we stayed on the 12 floor and couldn't hear it. Fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel but don't accept a room on the 6th floor”
Reviews.Author: premoth
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Singapore Airlines overnighter and arrived late after a 10 hour flight from New Zealand. Check-in appeared very helpful and efficient but they must have known they were giving us a substandard room. The sixth floor is largely taken up with function rooms and the bedrooms on that floor have beds which fold way into the wall so that they can be easily converted into function rooms. These beds are extemely hard and uncomfortable and the rooms are noisy. When we asked to be moved, the reception staff did not seem to have the authority and it took an hour and two further phone calls to effect a move to a 10th floor room. This was very comfortable and reasonably quiet. We paid an additional 100 S$ for a 6pm checkout which I thought was reasonable, breakfast was good and we had an excellent dinner in the hotel's Italian Restaurant. The Hotel has a stunning design and, if we had been given the 10 floor room first, we would consider it excellent

Reviews.Title: “DONT GO THERE! IT IS A PERSONAL ADIVCE...”
Reviews.Author: SwissLuxuryFan
Reviews.Content: First of all, sorry for my English because actually I speak French. Nevertheless I would like to written this feedback in English in order to touch the most travellers I can: I stay at the MM on the 10t october until 25 october 2006. I had book a room thru the reservation center of the hotel. I ask the center if I could get an upgrade on the hotel Club for my long stay if I book a Superior room. They answer me that it depends on the availability. At my arrival they told me that the upgrade didn't depend on the availability but....ON THE PRICE!!! Crazy. I told the reception that I had book this kind of room only to get the upgrade in the Club and I would like to change the room and get down to a Deluxe Room. They answered me that the hotel was fully booked. I ask to speak with the manager. He told me that he couldn't do anything. I asked him to speak with his Superior. His superior called me in the room and didn't want to move me in a Deluxe room. I told the manager that I was going to change the hotel and then he called me back 10 minutes later to announce me that we could change room. This hotel and his personal haven't got FLEXIBILITY at all. It is a 5 star hotel and the first thing that a 5 star hotel has to do is to satisfy the client. And surely NOT discuss his need. Room was not clean. Never had the night turn down serices. No Sauna nor Jacuzzi. No rooms with Marina Bay front view. The staff is complete inefficient. The music in the lobby play every evening until…1 a.m ! Yes, you read well ! Breakfasts was good but dirty. Breakfasts service was scandalous. I am sad to say that the only person efficient and polite is….the Director. At the end of a disaster stay (one day another client arrive in our room with the same key !) he was the only that has changed something. He offers us an upgrade in order to get a late check out and propose us his personal driver to the airport. I don’t think that an hotel director have to do such things to fix the his emploies mistakes. Forget this hotel ! It is a IMPORTANT ADIVCE… There are a lot of wonderful hotel in Singapore. For example the Fulletron. And don’t hesitate to add some money in another hotel so you won’t have to destroy your stay. And if you don’t understand why other people like this hotel. I tell you that I am a professional and that I can recognize what is a good hotel or not. I have immediately written to the Leading Hotels of the World General Manager…

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: .....having watched all the other passengers being dropped off at their hotels I was pleasantly surprised when I came to the Marina. It looked magnificent even though it was in the process of being renovated. Checking in was speedy and my room and the service were impeccable. The lounge was amazingly welcoming and yet very flash with its beautiful decor and fabulous singapore sling! The accompanying piano and on the next night the quartet, were lovely. Breakfast enabled me to try true singaporean food one morning and regular english the next. I should have stuck to more authentic food though as the 'usual' was same as.... All in all the hotel was delightful and the food was too. Unfortunately the renovations made it difficult to access the road by foot, though the subway , I found was the best way to walk anyway due to the heat. The check out was a little disconcerting as I was made to feel a little like a criminal because I dealt with my bill the night before to save time in the morning and had to wait for the staff to verify this for almost 10 minutes! I was dissapointed with the local stalls as they were few and far between. I later found out that it was because I was there on a Sunday and public holiday! However All the shops were open! I wish I had been able to find that out before hand somehow....

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during one of the weekend taking up the offer of weekend break with breakfast. The rooms has been renovated but the toilet wall and floor isn't. The 80s marble was the giveaway. Location wise is good if you want to goto the Esplanade for performances or visit the Suntec exhibition. Else it is some distance to walk to the MRT station. The hotel is attached to the Marina shopping complex which lacks vibrancy as it may be a bit on the higher end. Parked our car there as the hotel shares the parking with the patrons of the complex. We received a vulgar note from the car owner on the left because we park our car within our box but 5 inches away from the edge of our box. This is because of a huge lorry parking on the right of us. One thing to note is the complementary car parking ticket. It is issued once a day and it is valid for one time use only. So plan your trip if you want free parking. Breakfast is average. The spread is sufficient but not overwhelming, as you may expect of a 4 star hotel. The ham, sausages and bacon appears to be of the cheaper quality. They could do better at this. Its true, as mentioned by all the writer here, the singing at the lounge do get to the room. So get a high floor. The staff is courteous, efficient and friendly. I would not stay there again unless I am visitng the Esplande or Suntec exhibition as there are better location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Glindaba
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marina Mandarin after a dreadful start to our trip at the Rasa Sentosa. The difference between the two properties could not have been wider. The welcome at the Marina was superb; we were ushered to the club lounge and offered champagne to eradicate the previous experience. A terrifically appointed club room with huge wide-screen TV and a proper massage shower. All very modern yet informal too. Excellent breakfast and cocktails served by an attentive and welcoming staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “impressive”
Reviews.Author: SMD1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on the way back from Australia. We have two young teenage boys so had ajoining double rooms. First impressions were very good. We were met outside the hotel as we got out of the taxi. Before I even spoke, a member of staff greeted me by name. I don't really know how she did this, maybe she had been there for hours greeting every visitor with our name till she got it right!. The luggage was taken away and she took us up to reception, checked us in, then took us up to the rooms, showed us how everything worked, and left saying your luggage wont be long. Literally seconds after she left the room, she knocked on the door and said, "you luggage is here". The rooms were very spacious with a view of the pool, which was nice. On close inspection however, they weren't very well cleaned. There was dust behind the taps on the bidet and the toilet had pee stains at the back of the seat. I think if these items aren't cleaned well, then what else has been skipped? The bedding was spotless though, as were the towels. The shower had good pressure and there was a good range of toiletries. The bathrooms were quite big. There was a sharp tack sticking up near the bathroom door, it seemed to be from the carpet gripper thing between the rooms. We pointed it out the cleaner the next day and it was dealt with. The singer in the Atrium on the 4th floor, who we could hear from our room, (only faintly with the door closed) was very good. We went to the bar to listen, and ordered the obligatory "singapore sling". It wasn't cheap, but came with a big bowl of nuts and things. We had breakfast on our last day. there is a staggering array of food, including noodles and chicken. Eggs are cooked to order. The coffee was very strong. it is a fair walk to the MRT, but is worth it, it is cheap, efficient and very clean. A trip to local stations cost about 50p each. China town and little India are well worth a visit, they are not as "sterilized" as Singapore generally. There are lots of places to eat, especially if you like asian food. The prices vary a lot though. We ate in the "banana leaf restaurant" in little india, reasonable and authentic, you eat off a banana leaf with your hand (RIGHT HAND). although they do bring a fork and spoon for westerners. "Sentosa" the leisure island just across a bridge, (or take the cable car if you are ok with hights) is well worth a day's visit. Lots to see and do. Good for kids. I would stay at the Marina Mandarin again, despite the slightly inadequate hygiene, take a chance on another room having a better cleaner. We did wish that we had had more time in singapore, but after a 3 week holiday, we were also glad to be going home.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: BDTPerth_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at the Marina Mandarin. Room was small, tired and worn with the bathroom in need of a good mould removing treatment. Breakfast was OK, although the coffee and tea were quite horrible, and only just lukewarm. Overall feel is of a tired hotel caught in a 1970's/80's time warp. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackieboo
Reviews.Content: Our arrival in Singapore (a stop off for 3 nights on our return home from Bali) got off to a bad start. Our travel company had forgotton to book our transport from the airport to the hotel, although we had paid a total sum of £92 for a return journey (they did return this) so we had to get a taxi which was less than £5 each way (quite a difference!). Just before we left Bali I had a problem with a tooth. On arrival at this hotel we explained about the mix up with the transport (although this had absolutely nothing to do with the hotel) and that I needed to see a dentist. They immediately sorted everything out for us, also making a dental appoointment for me. We were shown to our room immediately, with a very helpful staff member. The room was brilliant with a fantastic view of the area, including Raffles Hotel and the River. The bathroom was amazing. We had no problems whatever with this hotel and was very satisfied with the service and room. The breakfast was excellent, with a exceptionally large choice for all nationalities. The consierge arranged for us to go on a harbour river dinner cruise, which was an excellent evening and also included a pick up and drop off service. We arrived on the eve of the Singapore Independence Day and the area was heaving with people for a day or so and the hotel was very busy but the service was never compromised. The service and politeness of the staff were excellent. The hotel is in a brilliant position. You dont even have to go outside to enter a massive, spotlessly clean, shopping centre, and the Suntec Centre is right across the road. Raffles is just a short walk and its shopping centre. The walk along the river to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay is a loverly walk, especially on an evening. We had a brilliant steak meal (the best ever my husband said) at a restaurant on Clarke Quay called something like "the 1 and only". Totally recommended. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - perhaps there's better out there???”
Reviews.Author: Starshine#1
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by the travel agent for location and standard. It certainly has a pretty lobby and a lot of facilities, and to start our holiday I was quite impressed (unfortunately for the Marina, we went on to stay in the Equatorial, KL and the Dusit Thani, Bangkok which were far superior!!) Like another reviewer we also had to wait over an hour for our room (to be fair, we did arrive in Singapore rather early - 10am). The room itself had a sea view and a little balcony - all nice enough, but lacking a certain something... The fitness centre and pool were, however, superb and the breakfast was excellent - wide choice and very very tasty! Location-wise - it's convenient particularly for Raffles and the shopping areas, even Orchard Road is walkable...but to be fair a lot Singapore is walkable - if you can take the heat. It's adjacent to the Marina Square Mall and just across the road from the Esplanade for any avid theatre fans. Overall, it's a nice hotel, and without comparrisson I'd have said it was above average, but knowing what's out there, perhaps it's just "OK".

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kweeki
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel mid july 2006. Very good location (hotel is integrated into hudge shopping mall and entertainment center). Good room. But that's all. Nothing special, and to be honest - I don't understand why they are member of Leading hotels of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Some aspects great”
Reviews.Author: Scottishsmiths
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights with our 8 y.o. on our way over to the UK. We can not usually afford 5 star hotels so this was a bit of a treat for us. We loved the interior of this hotel ie the atrium complete with piano playing and singing rising up to our floor in the evening and the beautiful singing birds in the daytime. Found the staff helpful and polite most of the time except when one or two were unable to understand English. Also had to ask four or five times for someone to come up to our room and put the extra bed for our son into the room. Not very good service considering they knew we were coming well in advance! Also had problems with water not draining well in the shower, but overall found the room satisfactory. Rooms with view of the harbour much nicer than other side. Ate the buffet breakfast one morning and the buffet dinner one evening. The food was fantastic and service in the restaurants very good. Variety and quality of food was superb. Didn't intend to do this, expected to eat out in the city more often but as our son wanted to sit in the room and watch cable TV we took the option of letting him do this while we sat in the restaurant and enjoyed a meal, went up to check on him every 1/2 hour. Location I would agree is not ideal as only really convenient for shopping mall and Raffles, not the other sights of Singapore. Also not sure how this happened but got talked into some bus tours to the Zoo and Night Safari at a time when we were extemely jetlagged and fuzzy-headed enough to make the wrong decision to book these. This eventuated after a phone call by a tour operator shortly after we arrived in our room. Basically if you book one of these tours you will pay a high price for a bus out to the zoo, which takes forever as it stops at several other hotels where you have to wait for other tourists to get onto the bus - at one point they even merged us onto two different buses. Then we were disappointed to find no actual tour once we got to the Zoo, simply the "guide" who had travelled on the bus with us told us to all meet back at the entrance at a particular time. As a result of all the waiting time on the way there and once inside the zoo when she tried to gather everybody together simply to tell us to meet back at the entrance we did not have enough time to see all the wonderful animals and had paid way more than the zoo entrance fee and the cost of a public bus or taxi out there. Quite the rip-off! Overall, had a great stay at this hotel, and absolutely loved Singapore. The pool was a welcome refreshment in view of the humidity of this city but didn't have much time to use it or the gym!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kungpao
Reviews.Content: Having read through previous reviews on the Marina Mandarin, and every other comparably priced hotel in Singapore, I decided to stay here. The result was wonderful. The hotel lobby and atrium are beautiful, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. They are not, however, furnished with the most modern and updated looks and amenities. For someone who travels on business 60% of the year, I consider this an affordable and comfortable hotel, where customers are treated with exceptional service. The location is great, being adjacent to a mall, and right next to the Esplanade.

Reviews.Title: “Great atrium, rooms okay”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: The hotel's atrium is very lovely, the restaurants are decent. I liked the breakfast buffet very much. I thought the staff was always very friendly, and they did a good job at remembering me. The concierges did a great job arranging a couple touristy things for my friends and I at our request. My complaints are about the location, and the room itself: The nearest MRT station is a 15 minute walk through an underground mall. There's not much really walkable nearby except for said mall and the Raffles, so you do a lot of taxi'ing...bot a big deal really cause the cabs are cheap if you don't end up in a "limo" cab, a bmw charging you $25 for being a bmw, just silly The room was nothing spectacular. I was on the 15th floor, and I will say I had a very nice view, there's a very slender balcony, and if you go on that you have an even better view. But the room was dull and on the small side. Also, I had problems with my shower, the water just would not drain. I had a puddle almost to my ankle after just a couple minutes, so I'd have to stop and wait 5-10 minutes for it to drain before continuing to wash off. Also, the gym was very nice - above average. I liked the pool a lot as well. You can use your room card to get in after hours, which was nice. I enjoyed a couple 4am swims while I was getting used to the time change.

Reviews.Title: “Did I just get lucky?”
Reviews.Author: SugarWahine
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read these other reviews, I recently stayed at the Marina Mandarin, just for one day, but was treated like a queen and thought for the price a great experience. I think I had a deluxe room and it was grand. I even had pineapple cakes specially made for the hotel waiting for me. I also had a thank you letter waiting for me from the hotel when I arrived back in the states. VERY service oriented and I am a stickler for service. The only down side is that the conceirge said the bus tour was the best thing to do and that was a bad choice.... you don't need to see Little India, China town or the obligatory sales shop for "diamonds" at the diamond outlet.... that stop really ticked me off for we were there forever. The thing to see is the National Orchid garden at the Botanical Garden, spectacular. Take a water taxi (easily rented up and down the water ways) to see a tour of the water and take the Hippo bus instead.... hop on and hop off. Cheaper than the organized tour and a lot more fun. I would highly recommend the hotel... centrally located, great service, lots of business amenities.... the look of the lobby is a bit 80's, but hey, who spends time in the lobby?

Reviews.Title: “Still wanting after the refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Sal the Fat Fish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel three times, twice before the refurbishment, and once after the renovations. The works are the usual update to the common areas such as lobby, restaurants etc. Some of the premium rooms were also refurbished totally (I did not see them) but not the deluxe rooms. Some small fixtures such as shower heads and TV were changed, but the room looked very much the same. Some of the writers who lamented about the room's tired look are right -- you seem to have returned to 1980s Whitney Houston 'I Wanna Dance With Somebody' days. It was one of the host hotels of Miss Universe 1987 and that was really the capsule what the rooms have been trapped in... As for service, the previous two times were so-so and the treatment we got was lousy, to say the least. They were not obliging and unpampering, and some of the staff were actually curt or downright rude. For the May 2006 stay, it was slightly better, but still very much the Singaporean materr-of-fact way. Greetings, smiles etc were there, but there was nothing to rave about. The promotional rates this hotel give for weekend stays are quite good. But given what you pay, it's very much a tad below expectations. And since it touts itself as a member of the Leading Hotels of the World, I think they better do something to the amenities of the rooms, the look/design of the rooms and also the service standard. Otherwise, there won't be too many repeat customers unless your rates are competitive, and frankly, price is NOT everything...

Reviews.Title: “Lux hotel but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: GPATB38
Reviews.Content: The Marina Mandarin has recently undergone an extensive renovation, so on our return to Singapore, we booked in for a 4 night stay. The room was excellent - modern & clean, with nice touches like robes, newspaper, C&E bathroom products, etc. The rest of the hotel was also excellent - nice bar, good food. Now the issue - service is really poor. First, we received an email confirming a 6pm check out and 15% off all Food & Beverages in the hotel (this was a special offer that we secured on the website). On checking in, we were told our check out was 2pm, and despite insisting they were wrong, they point blank refused to budge unless I dug out a copy of the mail confirm. Then on leaving and checking out, we did receive 15% off restaurant bills, but not off the bar bill - they claimed this was not included under the Food & Beverage special offer, which is frankly a joke. Finally, no courtesy room or shower facilities, which given most western flights leave Changi late in the evening, was very poor. Overall I'd stay there again, but its time to sort out the service if the Marina Mandarin wants to stay competitive against a host of great Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Marina Mandarin on Rafles every time I was in Singapore. This time, I have decided to stay at the Oriental (which is far more better than Marina Mandarin) but for the last night of stay, I could not get a room and must book at the Marina Mandarin. The Marina Mandarin has just gone through a big renovation. It is very nice in the hall, the entrance but they have forgotten to do something about the ROOMS. I have booked a Deluxe Harbour View Room and I got a small smelly with the view of the Oriental Hotel. I have called the front desk to ask about it and they confirm that it is the Harbour View if you lean outside the balcony and look to the right. When asking for another room, they say that it is all booked up. My room is old and smelly and lack of a lot of things for a 5 * hotel. I guess that after staying at a real 5 * such as Oriental, you can compare. No fruit plates, no newspaper in the morning. Now for the service, that is another thing. No smiley faces at the reception. When arrived at the hotel, I have received a letter from Mr. David Lim wishing me a nice stay as a returned customer (what a joke). Left him the message for the complaint about the room. Nothing. No return call. This is the last time that I will be staying at this hotel. You could find much better service and much better rooms for the same price at others hotels. Don't get fool by the outside look. Ask to check for your room beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to the Marina”
Reviews.Author: margedd
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel when the staff made an excellent start on our early morning arrival from Delhi by finding a room ready for us to move into immediately. We expected to be told it won't be available until 10.00 am or worse 1.00 pm. Although the room was due for refurbishment, it was fresh and clean. The hotel is convenient to the MTR which can be reached by walking underground from the hotel. There happened to be a first class trio playing in the cocktail area at night - music to suit most guests. It was a pleasure to stay-in rather than seek entertainment outside the hotel. The buffet breakfasts were first class.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night, but we wished it could have been for longer. It is an amazing hotel, with a beautiful interior. The room was very comfortable with a huge bathroom and all the luxuries you'd expect. The swimming pool was lovely and has lots of sun loungers around it. But our favourite part was the atrium which is just a pleasure to relax in. The location is great, with a handy underground walkway through designer shopping centres to reach raffles. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel, and we will definitely stay there again if we get to return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Buffets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is fairly central-close proximity to 3 very large shopping malls and across the road to the hop on bus which takes you to Orchard Rd. The rooms were spacious (compared to HK) and well maintained. The highlight of the hotel is their food. As part of our SIA stopover package, we were given 50% discount on inhouse menus. The buffet either b'fast,lunch or dinner is to die for. Drinks were expensive but this is across Singapore in general. Try also the "No sign seafood" and Quayside Seafood for the chilli crabs and baby fried octupus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBa
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a stop-over for two nights early February 2006. Room was spacious, as was the bathroom. All the amneties you would expect in the bathroom, twowel robe, slippers etc. (although a bit small for european feet). Minibar and room service were extremely cheap by comparison to European hotels. Do not try the internet on the inroom TV, though, it flickers and you can hardly read a thing. Staff was very friendly and helped with arranging tour, luggage storage and delivery. Only downside was the noise from the street (my room faced Suntec City) and that, due to MRT construction work, the hotel is currently a bit hard to access on foot (cross a six lane street or take a detour through the neighbouring, mazelike shopping mall to get to Suntec City, MRT and busses). The SIA hop on-hop off leaves just across the street, though, if that is an option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Marina Mandarin in Singapore on our way back from Australia, already planning our next trip and it will definately include another stay at the Marina Mandarin. The staff were super eficient,most polite and helpful. The reception and bar areas were most impressive with birds singing in the morning and a string quartet playing in the evening. Comfortable seats with lots of trickling water made it a very pleasant place to sit and have an evening drink. Breakfast was scrumptious with lots of choice. Bedroom was average but the whole experience of staying at this hotel was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Simply gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: spt2
Reviews.Content: We stayed the the hotel from 31 Dec to 3 Jan and loved it! Our requests for connecting rooms and harbour views were met.... and surpassed. We wanted the harbour view primarily for the New Year Day's fireworks and we got the best view available, I reckon. The room was SGD198++ and was definitely worth every cent, for the view we had. Spectacular. The rooms were spacious and 'high tech'. Large LCD widescreen TV too. The pool was great, especially with 24 hour access. There is nothing better than soaking in the pool after late night shopping! Although it's not close the the MRT, we found that the shops are Suntec City and the newly refurbished Marina Square Mall were adequate. The only horror was when my partner and I craved a coffee at 11pm one night. Went down to the lobby cafe (where they had a live band) to have our cuppas and was slightly thrown at the prices charged. We had an Irish coffee each and a hot chocolate, which ended up bring just over SGD50. Phew! That was scary. The staff were very helpful and also prompt. I feel that it's much better than the Mandarin Orchard in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Rarified luxury and elegance”
Reviews.Author: Garthy_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four in connecting rooms-great value as it was practically two rooms, one with only shower but luxurious and the other full bathroom. Check in from Ground Floor with personal greeter who took us to Reception on Level 4. Great service with a smile and all obviously picked for their good looks! Lovely Eastern atmosphere with Mod cons. The hotel has had major refurbishment but because of its age rooms are big. Excellent service with rapid check-ups to make sure things had been done. Free drinking water great touch. We did not have the breakfast package but at less than one tenth the cost had great local coffee (Jim Fook at S$1!)-there is also big American chain across at SunTec. Also two or three high-quality food courts at Marina Square and SunTec next door. There is no longer any direct connection from hotel to shopping centres which is good as it provides security and privacy, although one way key card access would be an idea on a rainy day as it is easy to get lost in the huge complexes. Two downsides-the balcony needs the doors sound-proofed as we were there on the weekend and the outdoor music concerts were very noisy. The door to the corridor also needs a seal as the live music from the lobby areas echoes upwards although more quietly. (the corridors can be better lit as well). A great bonus was the live birds in the public areas which sing beautifully in the morning. There were sharma birds and nightingales (thankfully looking healthy in their bamboo cages!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigellatoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Situated centrally, we could see Raffles Hotel from our Balcony. About a 10 minute underground (air conditioned - you don't want to walk too far outside in that steamy heat) walk from the Municipal Rapid Transport which was so cheap and frequent and took us on all our site seeing expeditions. The room was beautifully decorated in black, white and gold. Huge mirrors. Wonderful bathroom with smoked glass walls. Very comfortable bed. Unusually, the hotel's 19 floors are set out in a triangle around the atrium. Nice to have a drink there in the evening. Nice pool. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was great. Lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Marina Mandarin renovated - improved public areas”
Reviews.Author: jkttraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina Mandarin only for one night since I couldn't get a flight back home. Last time I stayed was right before the renovation, when the public areas and F&B outlets indeed were a bit shabby. Now the public areas are a lot more up-to-date, albeit in a boring minimalistic way. Seems like there was minimal renovation in the guest rooms -- the bathroom, I think, is exactly the same except for new lighting and sink taps (which now don't match the shower and bath taps at all!). The pool area and gym are quite pleasant, accessible with your room key thus open 24 hours. Too bad it was raining or otherwise I would've had a midnite swim in the well-lit pool. All-in-all, quite a good place to stay. Definitely nicer than the Meritus Mandarin on Orchard. Except that, as are all hotels in the Marina area, are quite secluded at night. Among these hotels though, I'd still choose the Conrad or Pan Pacific, which are closer and more accessible to the Millenia or Suntec Towers than the Marina Mandarin/Ritz Carlton/Oriental.

HotelInfo.Name: Marina Mandarin Singapore
